Reviews.Title: “After trying Jimmy's mojitos, we booked a room.”
Reviews.Author: Tangledinthesun12
Reviews.Content: We were staying at another hotel in Key West, that evening at sunset we stopped at Jimmy's cart for Mojitos. My husband said anyplace that makes such amazing drinks must be the place to stay. We booked the next two nights at The Westin and were not dissapointed! Great service, beautiful relaxing resort. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay elsewhere next time in Key West”
Reviews.Author: MellyJo01
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West 3/7/12 - 3/13/12. It was an average stay..nothing spectacular. The rooms are average..nothing too wonderful. We had to speak to the manager due to several complaints..we had to ask for face towels; to have the coffee refilled every morning; to have the shampoo, conditioner, and body wash refilled; and to have the sheets for the crib replaced. When they came to the room to give me the sheets, they just gave them to me and didn't even put them on the bed. I then realized they weren't even crib sheets...they were sheets for a regular size bed. The first day we were there, the pool wasn't open because someone had broken glass in the pool and they had to drain it. They can't control that but after leaving at 5 am from Chicago..that sucked because i wanted to use the pool. Now, they make this awesome water that tastes like a Mojito without the alcohol. That was so good. I actually liked to see the cruise ships when they were docked. I had not seen them in person before so that was interesting. the cruise ships were always gone when the sun was getting ready to set. Overall, it was an ok hotel nothing wonderful. I wouldn't spend the money I spent on this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “So romantic and a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jadejoann4
Reviews.Content: Been here almost every year for our anniversary and I have to say that we love it everytime. We stayed in te 2 bedroom suite overlooking the marina and it was perfect. The room was well appointed, the bed were very comfortable and the showers we great. They. The view was perfect for sunsets. Location is right next to Mallory square where they have sunset celebrations and steer performers every night. I love key west.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and what I would expect from a Westin”
Reviews.Author: alamerican
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days in Key West and an enjoyably stay at the Westin. Great location within a 5 minute walk to all the excitement of Duval Street. A few tips for staying here, try and request a room facing the water for obvious reasons and have the Grouper sandwich! Also, very important to know that it's not easy to get cabs in Key West, so give yourself enough time to get one to the airport. My only complaint was that the guys working the valet were zero percent helpful in getting my friends and I a cab to the airport. I had to walk across to Greene Street and flag myself one and barely made my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Really charming luxurious hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RobbertS
Reviews.Content: On arrival around 12 midday room was ready to be checked in. We had a room on the ground floor, with a little patio on the pool. Read in previous reviews people are bothered by the cruise ships in the hotel's marina; for me it was just a nice thing to see all these people and the nice cruise ships from close by. Hotel rooms are pretty standard but kept clean very well. The location is right on the water, in the middle of the central areas of Key West. About 15 minutes walking to the beach. Breakfast in the restaurant is a la carte, but really good quality. Key West was not really my thing, but for people visiting the hotel is really great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Jim â€“ The Best Bartender in all of Key West”
Reviews.Author: HVMcAllister
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have been going to Key West for the past two years and our first stop is always the Westin hotel and restaurant to visit the best bartender around, Jim! Being frequent travelers we have visited a number of bars and restaurant but no one has ever made a better drink than Jim can make. He is a hard worker, great guy and knows how to make an amazing drink. No Key West visit is complete without a visit to Jim.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta see Jimmy the Mojito Man! Great guy and great drinks!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vstrok
Reviews.Content: Westin was a great spot!! Highly recommended! Make sure you stay on the sea side of the resort. Poolside can get loud. Sunsets are amazing, as is the overall atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Jimmy at the bar”
Reviews.Author: ilovebuster
Reviews.Content: "Mr. Mojito Jim" was not only welcoming, but he served "z" best mojitos! We visited him 4 times this week and will come back first thing the next time we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't compare well to other Westins”
Reviews.Author: JamesBeswick
Reviews.Content: The rooms are what you would expect of a 3* motel. The Ocean View is continuously blocked by cruise ships which arrive loudly very early and stay until the sunset. The pool was good except it was out of service one day due to vandalism. The private beach that is mentioned costs $20 per person per day to visit. It also costs $20 per day to park in the garage. We had a ring stolen during our visit - the manager took a report but I never heard anything after. It's the only time I've ever stayed in a hotel and had anything go missing. The rooftop bar has truly dreadful service and high prices. It took 15 minutes to get served (compared with 2 minutes at Sunset Pier which is much busier). Overall, although the location is good, this hotel isn't near the same quality as other Westins.

Reviews.Title: “We are still at the property while I am writing this!”
Reviews.Author: Mel W
Reviews.Content: How can I begin to report my disappointment in our stay. I booked this vacation 3 months ago and I am not a newbie traveler. We are in the "Christmas Tree Island Suite" a "Premium Oceanfront" 2 Bedroom suite. The suite is indeed large spacious, it also has peeling wallpaper in one of the bathrooms, canned ceiling light fixtures that are falling down and dirty carpet with the last guests dried jalapenos in the corner. We had to ask for a small refrigerator to be brought the room as it is so sparse on furniture and amenties that it did not come equiped with one. The room is worn and tired not what I expected at all for $850 per night. Oh and the view? It 's beautiful when the cruise ships move out of the way, which has either been in the evening or now finally on the last morning of our stay. I know the response from management will be that I could check the schedule as to when the ships would be in port so I would know my view would be blocked as they did to a previous reviewer. The one day we had to take the skiff to Sunset Key ,we checked, were told the price waited for about 40 minutes to get the rest of our party together, went back and were told that the boats were sod out for the rest of the day. Called the concierge in the afternoon to book a cab for 5 people so we would not be late for a dinner reservation, show up, no cab. Luckily the bellman was able to call and get one over right away. The point I would to make is that some of the staff here deserves a wonderful review, the restaurant staff, Elliott who finally got us checked in after a 3 hour wait for our room (the prior desk was really quite perturbed when after 2 hours of waiting we checked to see if our room was ready and were frostily informed that no it was not and check in time is 400p even though our traveling companions room was ready at 1p and all of our luggage had been delivered there). I will return to Key West but will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting to eat”
Reviews.Author: fisherdoc
Reviews.Content: Sunset Deck, a restaurant at this Westin, lists it operating hours as 6 to 9 PM, at least during daylight savings time, so dinners can enjoy the beautiful senset at Key West. The Deck is right next to the entertainment of Mallory Square's street performers. The waters are often enhanced by sailboats, making for a most pleasant scene, and for photos. The menu is varied; the background steel drum live music helps to complete a most enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Key West”
Reviews.Author: Helloshello1992
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Key West and we loved it! We stayed at the Westin in room 362 and the view was great! the reviews we saw about the cruise ships are correct they do dock there but we could still see the Ocean and Mallory Square. We enjoyed seeing the ships and watching the people and they leave by evening so really who cares your not in the room during the day anyway. Unless you have to make an ER visit like we did! Our 20 year old got sick passed out at the Truman house during a tour and we had them call the ambulance and no she doesn't drink so that was not the issue! The Hospital was very good and attentative even though they were extremely busy. The rest of the Stay we were more in the room with her letting her rest as she was sick. The only thing I would say they need to change is the beds they are old not very comfy, they are little worn and the couches need replaced we didn't pull it out because when we took off the cushions it looked bad! Other than that we liked the pool the location was good. The bartender at the pool was very very good but the valet , and front desk was not very friendly. The girls at the hotel concierge was ver nice and always had a smile. We wont go back because of the beds and next time we will have 3 more kids with us. But if it's two or three of you its not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Liar, liar, pants on fire”
Reviews.Author: Nancy B
Reviews.Content: Called and booked an ocean-view room with balcony. Arrived to discover the view was of the cruise ships instead - sometimes one or two and sometimes people waving at us from the ships. They were so close we could talk to them. We complained and were promised another room with a better view only to then be told it had a leak. We were surprised when we saw another couple enter the room with the alleged leak the same day. We were then informed this couple had also complained about an inadequate room and they were moved into the room we were promised. To keep us from moving to another hotel, they promised us there were no more ships that were due to arrive during our stay. We woke up to two more!! This hotel has problems. There are no rooms with ocean views unobscured by cruise ships. On top of that, the staff blatantly lied to us. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place, bad timing”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl M
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful, wonderful rooms and beds, great restaurant, and friendly staff. My only issue was with the spring breakers that were in residence at the same time. I didn't think they would be present here but they were - loud, obnoxious and quite annoying in the wee hours of the morning. They even managed to ruin the pool for a day which the staff handled well by offering alternatives while they cleaned up the issue. I guess a little more security and patroling would have helped greatly. I would definately stay there again, just be more mindful of the timing.

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: 1BKAT
Reviews.Content: Greatly disappointed overall. From the initial arrival and having to wait for our "room", because we purchased the room at a discounted rate through Hotwire we were to wait for a room on the backside of the hotel on the first floor. Departure consisted of being asked how my stay was which I responded ok and received an "oh" in response. The quality of the room was no better than the Quality Inn we stayed in while traveling to Key West but not as nice as the room we stayed in at the Comfort Suites while returning home. We were there while the spring breakers destroyed the pool and in talking to one of the employees I stated I was sad the pool was closed he responded not as sad as he was because this was costing him 60,000 gallons of water, chemicals and clean up crew time and was a great expense. If the hotel had properly monitored the property this would not have been an issue and such a disappointment to the vacationers. The housekeeping staff was lovely and very friendly. In the advertisement that their sister hotel has a private beach that is available for use they do not tell you there is a $20.00 per person charge to take the ferry and use the beach or that the number of spaces at the beach are limited. The cruise ships do block the view and the crowds from the ships can be quite an inconvenience at times but for the most part is not an issue. Beautiful sunset but this is also available without the cruise ships just a few hundred feet past the Bistro. There is also entertianment in this area at sunset. I would recommend saving your money because the accomadations do not warrant twice the price for a basic room.

Reviews.Title: “great location, rowdy spring breakers all over the hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArtBIII
Reviews.Content: I agree w/ the homergirl and meridian2 reviews. Well written and accurate. The spring breakers were really obnoxious. Where was the security staff at 3, 4 & 5AM? (BTW I spent two spring breaks in Key West in the 80s as a college student.) The spilled drinks, food and all night partying took away from this trip. Sleep was not possible. The kids brought glass bottles to the pool and of course broke them. The pool was closed, drained and cleaned in 24 hours thanks to the hard working Westin staff. The hotel itself is great. Tasteful, clean and what a view from the sun deck. For one of the four days a cruise ship was not present. The 180 degree view that day was great. Hotwire made this three night stay affordable. I will return, but not during college spring break.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay - they saved our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Holly D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Key West for our honeymoon and originally planned on staying at a different hotel on the island. We booked a room 3 weeks in advance, but when we arrived we learned our room had not been reserved because their computer experienced a booking error. There were no other rooms at that hotel so we had no place to stay. The hotel called the Westin to see if they could arrange a room for us, and they said they could. But they did much more than just that! They were extremely accommodating when we showed up and seemed to have sympathy for our situation. Christopher at the front desk was especially helpful and kind. They set us up in a beautiful suite and made sure we had all the comforts we needed. Our suite was gorgeous - very tastefully decorated and overlooking the pool and hot tub. We only stayed there one night before being placed back at our original hotel, but we left wishing we had booked our vacation at the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Coming back for a 3rd time!”
Reviews.Author: meridian2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Westin Key West two times in the last three years and can't wait to come back in April 2012. This is Paradise! The Hotel is beautiful, clean and well situated, in fact it is the best location in Key West period. All potential guests should always do their research before booking any hotel so it irks me to see complaints about a cruise ship sometimes blocking the view when all of the information can be found on the internet on sites like this. The pool and hot tub are surrounded by the hotel with steps up to the bar/patio which overlooks Mallory and the water- sunsets are spectacular right from the bar, The way the hotel is arranged is awsome because you're in the middle of the action yet the general public below cannot traipse through the property. The hotel pool and patio bar is staffed by experienced attentive bartenders and make something called a Key Lime Colada that is to die for. Watch the sunsets from the patio bar or have fun watching last minute cruise ship passengers running back to their ship because they lost track of time in one of the many establishments nearby. We usually drive down from Ft.Lauderdale airport to enjoy the scenery, the parking garage for the Westin is right next door and is multi level. Although you really don't even need a car in Key West it's easy to come and go because the room key gets you in and out quickly. The rooms are typical Westin, top of the line bedding and toiletries. Never was bothered by noise from adjoining rooms but if you leave your balcony door open, you may hear people at the patio during a wedding or other celebration. I usually close the door because I like A/C when I sleep. A day at Sunset Key can be arranged in the hotel lobby by getting a boat pass early in the morning, We've spent quiet days there and once flagged down a parasailing boat to go have a birds eye view of it all--Very cool! So much to do in Key West, we've done Hemingway House, Ghost tour, museums, Cemetery, lighthouse, Fort Taylor, Martello, etc.. Most attractions are within walking distance of the hotel. See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, except the spring breakers....”
Reviews.Author: Homergirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights on an good deal from Priceline. They did have us first in a first floor pool view room, however, I told them I was a light sleeper and, the manager cheerfully put us in a 3rd floor pool/partial ocean room. The gentleman (not the manager) who checked us in kept saying to the manager "priceline, they are priceline" aloud which was a bit tacky. Room was satisfactory. Basic. Small balcony, cruise ship blocking ocean view....(we really didn't care). Small issues with cleanliness (garbage under bed, and stains on walls and doors)...but I would imagine a hotel that has this type of turnover, it must be very difficult to keep it spotless. Our biggest problem wasn't the hotel at all, it was the college kids at it. Both nights they were screaming and yelling and carrying on all hours of the evening, and morning. When we had the doors closed and turned the AC unit on, it was difficult to hear them, but that is not how I planned to spend my time in Key West. A visit to the manager after our first night was handled efficiently with an offer to move us, and a complimentary breakfast. We opted not to move as we weren't sure if the next room would prove any more quiet than the last (the Manager agreed). She told me that I can always call down to the front desk and the security guys will quiet them down. My biggest issue is if a hotel of this caliber knows of the problem, security should be patrolling the halls/pool area at 1am to monitor the noise level. Waiting to disturb sleeping guests and have them call is not very pro active. Overall, this is a great choice of hotel. In the middle of it all, but probably quiet (when the kids aren't here). We would return, just at a different time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Love Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Alisa B
Reviews.Content: This was the midpoint of our week long anniversary trip for my husband & myself. Upon check-in, we were greeted by Elliot at the front desk who upgraded us to a lovely oceanfront room. We spent a lot of time in the rocking chairs on the balcony "people watching" & waiting for the sunset in Mallory Square. We also had the best seat in the house for the Cat Man show which was a plus! The Westin Key West is in a great location - we were able to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Small Issues: Not up to Westin's Usual Excellence”
Reviews.Author: kareno425
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent three nights at the Westin during a conference I attended. Having been to Key West many times, I felt fortunate to stay at this particular hotel, because it's located both on the water and in a prime area for sunset festivites at Mallory Square. While ithe location is great, you should not stay here expecting a great ocean view from your room. Cruise ships block the view for oceanfront rooms and most rooms are "partial ocean view" anyway. We stayed in a partial ocean view room on the top (4th) floor behind the pool so we could see over the trees, and the ocean view was nice, but not reason enough to choose this hotel (it is on the expensive side). On the other hand, the outdoor patio is right on the water and in an area that is as good as it gets for sunset viewing in Key West. By Westin standards (I love Westin and expect a lot), this hotel did not meet my expectations for the price. Even though our room was huge, it was sparsely furnished and had a tiny bathroom. The bed was indeed heavenly, but the small bathroom had only a smallish shower with mediocre water pressure (no double shower head or rain shower here). Except for the large room size, small seemed to be the operative word here, as the window with the partial ocean view also was very small, as was the pool, which has a limited number of lounge chairs that--as is typical in many resorts--were all appropriated early each morning. There is no beach near the hotel except for the island (see below), so there were no options to just hang out on the beach or at the pool if you didn't grab a lounge chair at the crack of dawn. The Westin does have a small beach on an island and for a $20 per person fee, you can take a ferry to the island beach. However, occupancy is so limited that you have to be in line before 7:30 in the morning (and go then) to go. I recommend this hotel if you want to go to Key West for a couple of days and the evening and nightlife activities around Mallory Square and Duval Street are your priority.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great vacation in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Mark F
Reviews.Content: Front desk attendant Al Duncan made my day! Thanks Mark Fucich

Reviews.Title: “Great location - be careful about ocean rooms”
Reviews.Author: JUDITHbristol
Reviews.Content: Location is the key selling point of this hotel but be careful about ocean view rooms. Stunning location right on Mallaroy Square, top of Duval St. Nice pool area (although be quick for a sunbed!). Several bars/restaurants overlooking the water with great food and cocktails and ability to watch the sunset away from the crowds as well as a private island and private beach you can book in advance with stunning sunset views. All in all a solid hotel in a great location but as some other guests have noted a few drawbacks particularly if booking ocean front rooms. These drawbacks didnâ€™t bother us but the one about ocean view rooms is really important â€“ we were lucky with our room allocation, but others werenâ€™t. I believe they are called â€˜Ocean Frontâ€™ rather than â€˜Ocean Viewâ€™ and this is because cruise ships are docked outside from about 7am to just before sunset (sometimes later apparantly, although not during our stay). This affects/blocks the view from the vast majority of ocean front rooms. We were lucky and were on honeymoon so were allocated a really spacious room in the block where the concierge is (away from the Reception Block) and closest to the Aquarium. Our room whilst partly obscured by the ships did still have a great ocean view, a view of the private island and we were able to watch the sunset from the balcony each evening. However, looking at the layout of the hotel the vast majority of the ocean front rooms would have been obstructed by the ship â€“ so be careful before paying the extra. Also, some ocean front rooms are on the ground floor and effectively step onto the boardwalk so If you are one of those people who worries about others having easy access to your room steer clear from. Personally, I think they need to start thinking about clearer promotion of the Ocean Front rooms as it could really upset somepeople given the considerable extra charges levied for these room types. Most people are understanding if told in advance, but it would be a nasty shock if you didn't know. It isn't cheap and when compared to other hotels of a similar standard in other cities it seems overpriced, but compared to Key West its about right. Despite the issue about room views which is mentioned by lots of other reviewers this is a great hotel with some really nice staff, comfy beds, nice rooms, great food and above all a perfect location to explore Key West. If gets 4 stars from me, but if my ocean view had been blocked and Iâ€™d not been told in advance it would have been 2 or 3 stars simply as they should be more honest about the views.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value for the money”
Reviews.Author: debwarr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 4 nights at the Westin Key West and were very disappointed in the entire experience. We booked an oceanfront room, but no one mentioned that the only view we would have would be a cruise ship right in front of us everyday. I've stayed in some very nice Westins before, but now would be very hesitant to ever book them again since I can no longer trust their brand. Clearly this property is well below the standards I expected from the Westin. It was more on par with a Hampton Inn for 3 times the price. In fact, after making mention of that comparison, a member of our group had a towel in his room with a Hampton tag, so it appears that maybe they did buy a Hampton property and just slap a Westin name on it. The room was small, dated and uncomfortable, and the small balcony was directly above the walkway where all the cruise ship people walked back and forth, so it was often very noisy. Again, had we been paying Hampton Inn prices, this would have been okay, but we could have gone many places in the Caribbean and stayed at a much nicer place for the same price. The location is convenient, but very crowded and noisy when a cruise ship is in port (as it was almost constantly during our stay). If the only good thing you can say about a hotel is it's near someplace to watch a sunset, I don't think that is very high praise. Also the service was terrible. The first night, after watching the sunset (which was wonderful), we decided to eat at the hotel's seaside bar/restaurant. We got there at 7:00 and as soon as our food arrived, the server asked if she could go ahead and bring the check (it was maybe 7:30). The food was mediocre and it was clear that we would not continue to be served. Before 8:00 they came and took away the lanterns from our table. We were told we could "continue to sit there", but clearly, they were closing. If they planned to close by 8:00, they should have told us when we arrived. Throughout the property, the service was consistently poor and apathetic. We did go over to Sunset Key a couple of times and enjoyed that experience. The service was good, the food was a little better and the beach was fairly nice. The beach drink service was slow, but friendly. Although I didn't see inside of the cottages, they looked very nice and the pool was much better than the main Westin property. Overall, it was much more in keeping with the Westin brand than the main hotel. It would be hard for me to recommend either property, however, given the other better alternatives for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great View of Cruise Ships.....Nothing Else!”
Reviews.Author: berniegleason
Reviews.Content: My wife and I requested and paid thru the nose for an oceanfront room so that we could enjoy the sunset and celebrate a special occasion. We were "never" fore-warned that our room would look directly into the side of a large cruise ship. When we expressed our displeasure, we were told the ship would depart at 7:30 p.m. ... of course after sunset! The staff also neglected to tell us that another cruise ship would be arriving the next morning at 7 a.m. So if you book an oceanfront room at the Westin, be prepared to have an ocean view only when it is dark.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to enjoy the sunset”
Reviews.Author: lvtrvlChicago
Reviews.Content: Have a drink outside at the bar while listening to music. The place is friendly and clean!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Key West”
Reviews.Author: Margueritte J
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel right at Mallory Square and on the bay. The sunsets are out of this world. Mallory Square at sunset is outstanding. Would tell anyone to go there

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment at Westin”
Reviews.Author: doodletee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay in an "oceanfront" room. Our room was on the first floor, so it was primarily a view of the walkway filled with dining tables and chairs (the ocean was on the other side of the dining area). 2 of the 3 mornings we awoke to huge cruise ships totally blocking any view we might have had. We were told that the ships come through 5 days/week, so oceanfront should read "shipfront". We went elsewhere each evening for sunset because this time of year, the ships did not leave until after sunset. The room was comfortable and pretty standard for a Westin. Hallways were noisy in the morning, so we ran the a/c fan non stop. There were no movie options on the room TV besides Showtime.....no dvd player or ability to purchase movies over the TV. The bartender and waiter in the restaurant were very friendly and accommodating, but on one else on the staff was very friendly. The hotel is only a couple blocks away from the very busy Duval street. Depending on your wants, this can be a good thing or not. Our last day we discovered some quieter and almost charming parts of the town.

Reviews.Title: “What sea view”
Reviews.Author: Jonukcheshireuk
Reviews.Content: 2 or 3 Cruise ships park outside the sea view rooms most days including the restaurant terace, Blocking totally the sea view, so close the ships passengers are looking straight into the hotel bedrooms. It doesn't stop with the cruise ships, private functions are held on the terrace below the guest rooms with the relevant disco music late into the night. A vastly over rated expensive hotel to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view and location - excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: MindyL58
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservations well in advance for our anniversary celebration We booked a King/Oceanfront room with a balcony. When we arrived - we were disappointed that our 'Oceanfront' room (212) was overlooking the Marina. We went back to office to discuss with the manager. The manager assured us that the room we had was considered 'Oceanfront' - but I was adamant with my frustration. He wasn't able to give us a room with a better view on our first night - but offered us the room we were in (he considered Oceanfront, we considered Marina view) at a $60.00 a night lower rate - and the next day he was able to get us into a room with a better view (which TRULY was an amazing Ocean front view). Once the details of the room was worked out - our stay was PERFECT. The customer service was excellent - the room was nicely appointed with the Westin Bed, a great walk in -up to date tile shower and an amazing view with a balcony. We ate breakfast at the restaurant and the food and service was very good. The Concierge was extremely helpful in booking our excursions. Housekeeping made up the rooms based on our schedule. Our room (361) faced the west - and our view was wonderful. We could see Mallory square and had an absolutely perfect view of the Sunset and the Sunset Celebration. We enjoyed sunset while sitting on the balcony with our own champagne! Cruise ships do arrive daily - and our view was occasionally obstructed - but they generally arrived around 8AM and were always gone by 6PM (before sunset). We were far enough north - toward Mallory square so that our view was only completely obstructed by the cruise ships on one day - when the HUGE Carnival Magic came into port. The views of the cruise ships were even entertaining. The Air Conditioners are pretty noisy - but the weather was pretty mild while we were there...so we just turned it off when we were in the room and on the balcony. The location was absolutely perfect - and easy walk to all of our favorites - including all the hot spots on Duval, Mallory Square, the Historic Seaport Harbor Walk...and Blue Heaven! We will return to Key West - we will book in advance and we will definitely stay at the Westin again. It was truly worth every penny of the room rate!

Reviews.Title: “Best Drinks & Bartender in Key West”
Reviews.Author: betafreeze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have a timeshare at the Hyatt Sunset Harbor in Key West and are residents there for the month of January. While we have never stayed at the Westin, we have spent considerable time at the outside bar with our favorite bartender, Jimmy. If you don't do anything else while in Key West, you must visit him for the best drinks on the island. Our favorites are mudslides and mojitos. Yum, yum, yum! If you miss him at the bar, you can usually find him at the old car cart at the sunset parties. I have tried to recreate his drinks at home, but didn't have any luck! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Location”
Reviews.Author: Carl H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights early Feb / 12 and had a great time. Lovely room with a balcony overlooking the Cruise Line Docks and less than a 5 min. walk to the action on Duval St. and other attractions. Nice staff, comfortable beds, modern washroom facilities, pool with access to outside terrace and restaurant directly overlooking the harbor. Pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: wanderluster215
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to Key West for our second time to celebrate my 40th birthday and stayed at the Westin. When the staff at the front desk found out it was my birthday, they snuck a bottle of wine and glasses up to our room while we were out for the night. I thought that was VERY nice. Other than that, the property is average, and not really worth the extra money. The location is great, but the hotel is not what I would call superior. Our room was in what appeared to be the business office building, and our room door was next to the main Accounting door and Human Resources suite. That was weird and we felt like we were staying in an office building, not a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Reginald666
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin in Key West for weeklong business meeting. The hotel measures up to national standards, with clean rooms, comfortable beds, clean and relatively new linens and towels, etc. Staff was friendly and efficient both at the front desk and room service. Location is a strong consideration when going to Key West â€“ this hotel is right near the cruise ship docks and Mallory Square if you are into seeing the sunsets. Five minute walk to Sloppy Joes if that appeals. There is also a bar/viewing deck that is great for the sunsets at the hotel. Good business services also with adequate meeting rooms and again a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Key West”
Reviews.Author: mblnparadise
Reviews.Content: Before I book a room anywhere I look at what the real people are saying about a place and I look for the reviews that talk about what is important to me when I stay somewhere. My family calls be a travel snob but I don't think that is true. I just like things to be quality, safe and clean. With that in mind the Westin had clean rooms, flat screen television(it is 2012) I like for the bedding to be white and high thread count at least 400. The bed being comfortable is very important because my husband has a bad back. I don't understand why properties don't focus more on the comfort of the bed. The bed at the Westin was about a 8 from 1-10. Which I have never given a 10 and very few 9. It is very important how the front desk checks you into your room. It seems like if that is bad, your stay usually is bad. I like to feel they care if I am comfortable and happy, this seems hard for most front desk. I have read the reviews about the front desk and manager. They must have had a meeting because my experience with both were good. I was check into my room my Elliot whom is 7 feet tall so you can't miss him. Really nice guy, we did have a misunderstanding about my husbands birthday but he was so kind at check in it was hard to get upset with him.The manager Alberto made up for the misunderstanding and was very kind and made my husband's birthday special the next day. Thank you Alberto and Elliot for your great service:) Key West is a very fun place and the Westin is right in the middle of it. Making it easy to walk down town to all the action. It is right where the cruise ships come in, but this that was exciting, just to see how very big the ships are and it just went with the action of Key West. The Westin is a chain of hotels and resorts so if your looking for Something like the B&B's that are cute and with a lot of character like Key West this is not for you, but if you want someplace that is more detail in quality,safe, and clean this is it for Key West. A note to the Westin......Get rid of the managers that are reluctant to make the travelers happy and keep the Elliot's and Alberto's.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but otherwise note worth the price”
Reviews.Author: LGP6868
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in February. First when we made our reservation, in December, we were told that if we had to cancel less than 10 days before our stay, we would pay for ALL THREE NIGHTS, not the standard one night penalty. I asked to speak to managers, but received the same response. That seems excessive. We had a "courtyard view." Our courtyard was a gated garbage area, with a giant industrial air conditioning unit. The shower had almost no water pressure, and there was no bathtub. One day there was almost no hot water. The rooms are tired-looking, and the air-conditioning units are the old noisy wall units. But the bed is very comfortable. There was a mini-fridge in the room, but it was bolted shut. No one on the staff was rude, but they all seemed worn out, and no one was pleasant, friendly or welcoming. So what's good here? The location is fantastic. Having access to Sunset Key is a real plus. It has a great beach, with drink and food service. We had one meal in the Bistro, and it was good. And drinks and appetizers on top of the deck is fantastic. Hard to beat watching the sunset from there. Gorgeous. The pool is nice, and there seemed to be enough chairs around it.

Reviews.Title: “This place is not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: albanydr
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying even if you prefer westin resorts do not book on westin site, the room is not worth it! We used Priceline and think that we over payed for what the "resort" offers. We wanted to take the boat over to the other westin resort since the pool area had wet cushions from the rain the night before and were told it was 20 dollars a person! Keep in mind this is on top of a high resort fee here, insane! Although the manager I other responses has noted the building rooms were renovated 3 years ago again and again, they are just not as nice as the other westin resorts. There are no tubs, the water pressure is awful, the towels were dirty, they have old school ac units and the Check in desk and lobby area are not in the main building. The staff seems angry and unhappy to be working here. Positive is location. I would say it is worth 150 a night max! Also if you have points it is not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay !”
Reviews.Author: Martmi10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin two weeks ago. It was a first visit to the Florida Keys and this hotel was superb . My wife and I stayed in the annexe with an ocean view. The view from the balcony was excellent. It overlooked a small Marina, boardwalk and cruise terminal. The hotel itself was first class. Everything from cleanliness,facilities, helpful staff, sunset bar and restaurant was faultless. Would definitely return and recommend to anyone. The hotel is perfectly located to the resort of Key West. Plenty of shops , cafe's , bars etc.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: DJfromNH
Reviews.Content: We made a spur of the moment decision to head to Key West for a few days and had little time to find a two room suite. We made the reservations and then checked the reviews on tripadvisor and then regretted making non cancelable reservations. We went anyway and fortunately the Westin Marina was not as described in many of the prior reviews. Our suite was in the checkin building not the marina building. The rooms, while not over large, were decent size. Each bedroom had a very nice bath with Jacuzzi. Each bedroom and the living room had a balcony overlooking the ocean with a sunset view. No cruise ships were in port during our stay, which is unusual. The folks in the hotel were friendly and helpful. We had dinner one night on Sunset Key at the Westin. It was very reasonably priced and very good. The view is spectacular. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Merenneito06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our two night stay at the Westin in January 2012. It exceeded expectations. You cannot beat this location. We had a lovely room with a nice little patio. It was just to heaven to sit on the patio and watch the sunset both nights. The service was very good, particularly the bartender in the pool area. He remembered our order from the day before. My only regret is that we only stayed two nights. Will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Snaglpus00
Reviews.Content: We had our company sales conference again at this hotel this past week and as expected Westin was top notch. From the meals to the service to the rooms provided - all were above expectations. They were even very helpful when we had to change plans due to weather and they worked with us to make what we needed to have done happen. It is a great location for work of play and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location, but the hotel is beautiful also. Not the B&B charm but nice for luxuries.”
Reviews.Author: Bafll
Reviews.Content: Certainly not a typical stay for old key west. If its your first time I'd suggest finding a B&B, otherwise the hotel is fantastic. Quite pricey but Westin qualities included. Tip: sunset key dinner is amazing and priced very reasonable. Free shuttle from Westin.

Reviews.Title: “"The BEST Hotel in Key West"”
Reviews.Author: Golfer010_11
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 glorious days in Key West at the Westin and thought the hotel was AWESOME! The room was clean and everything in perfect working order. We had an ocean view and small balcony-granite bathroom with a large shower-on the 2nd floor(SPG Floor)-and of course Heavenly Beds. As far as location, you can not find a better place-it has great sunset views and ocean views- and is just a short walk to everything. The pool was great-service excellent- and Adrian at the front desk was especially helpful. It has great food in the Bistro and of course Lattitudes cannot be beat. The view and sunsets are worth the price alone. I cannot believe some of the bad reviews of this hotel, because it truely is one of the best in Key West and does a fine job of maintaining the Westin's outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Three days in January sunshine”
Reviews.Author: AnOldTimer
Reviews.Content: My wife's company footed the bill for this stay, as she was in Key West for a business presentation. The rooms are very comfortable, and our room both this year and last year had great views of the ocean and the setting sun in the evening. The only problem we had with the room was the drain in the shower. It didn't drain very well. We notified the front desk of this at check out, so it wasn't as if we had told them about the problem immediately. I would recommend the Westin if you can afford the premium rates, but keep in mind that nothing in Key West is inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “"Beautiful Sunsets" - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SueH10114
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the The Westin Key West Resort & Narina for 10 days. Very clean hotel, walking distance to Old Town. The food and service was excellent. Great shopping along the Marina. Enjoyed breakfast every morning; taking in all the wonderful sites and water sports on the Ocean. Only downfall was the Cruise Ships coming into Port. We had an Ocean View Room and the ships obstructed our view of the ocean and the beautiful sunsets from our patio. We did raise our issues at the front desk, and they were most accomodating to our needs. All in All we had a wonderful time, would suggest pool side rooms. Will be returning in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Key West”
Reviews.Author: jonlam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for 3 nights - had eaten Sunday Branch there a couple of years ago - was terrific- but were mid week this time so missed out! Good clean hotel very convenient for the old town and right on the seafront so good walks. Sometimes Cruise Liners are docked there but not when we stayed. Lots of good eating places . . and bars . .around. The two friends bar had a 50% discout on drinks (even bloody marys) so recommended. Also the Cuban restauant 5 mins from Hotel. Great sunsets to live music

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2011 stay”
Reviews.Author: Eric R
Reviews.Content: Recently updated room. Great view of the pool area. Patient, helpful and professional help all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BCape
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night at this property recently and was quite happy. I won this property via Priceline bidding and was happy with the purchase. I am always worried about how the hotel front desk will treat me at check-in when I get a room through Priceline...I have actually had people roll eyes, laugh etc. However, this check-in was wonderfully pleasant and the gentleman even gave me a choice of rooms. We had a pool view room on the first floor. Room, due to facing a courtyard did not have much natural light, but it was something I could live with. Bedding was lovely as were toiletries, towels, etc. Shower was nice with great water pressure and products provided. There were some dings on the bathroom doors and peeling wallpaper in our room, but considering what I paid, it was nothing I would be upset about. However, should I have paid full-price, I might have been annoyed. Hotel is perfectly located at Mallory Square where the sunset celebration happens at night. Walking distance to the main streets and a bit longer walk to the southernmost point. Zachary Taylor State Park is about a 20-30 minute walk, which is doable, but I would recommend a bike. The beach there is beautiful! We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant once and it was great. Service was attentive and quick and prices were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best property on Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Elaineweek
Reviews.Content: Christopher Duncan did a steller job assisting us in acquiring the best room for our stay at the Westin Key West. His "can do" attitude made our trip worthwhile. Diana was also helpful with our flight to Dry Tortugas. We will return to this property for future vacations when headed to Key West! Charlene Barbour & Sheila Weeks, Durham, NC

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: jemz1949
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights and have absolutely nothing bad to say. Excellent location, friendly staff and clean, comfortable rooms. We didn't need anything else as we spent little time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location shabby hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janvals
Reviews.Content: We did not like the original hotel we were staying at and decided to upgrade to the Westin which was a downgrade. We had a two bedroom suite which was terrible. The handles on several different pieces of furniture were broken (when trying to open a drawer the handle came off in my hand). Room was very shabby with broken furniture, plastic plants and caulking on the base of the toilet that looked terrible. Unable to control the ceiling fans because the strings were too short (even though they tried to attach an additional cord that broke). Our room had an ocean view which was a view of the pool. When I contacted the front desk regarding our view they told me to stand on the balcony and look left between the foliage and you will see the ocean (maybe with my telephoto lens). The shower did not have very much water pressure. This hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. The only positive thing I can say about the hotel is the location and the beds were comfortable. Also, the cleaning staff was very nice and gave us extra chocolates.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: Barb B
Reviews.Content: In visiting Key West we went in to the Westin lobby to ask advice about a place to eat and about securing a taxi later in the day. We were warmly greeted by Christopher who was most helpful and who also told us about Bistro 245 in the Westin on the Beach side. After a fun time viewing the performers and the sun setting over the water, we arrived back at the Westin and in to Bistro 245. Karl was our waiter and he was equally as delightful as Christopher. We not only had a delicious repast, (Oh!! that French Onion soup!!) we had a wonderful friendly and thoughtful server. The experience of the two employees will be remembered as one of the highlight of our visit to Key West. Thank you Karl and thank you Christopher.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: max135
Reviews.Content: Took a family vacation to Key West during Holiday week Dec 2 3 -28. We arrived at the hotel and we had two rooms booked. Our children are 24 and 21 and we were staying in different rooms.The rooms could not have been different. one room on the third floor was bright and the room on the first floor was dark and dingy it faced the pool.It was disgusting, I went to the asst manager and complained they said they were fully booked and there were not able to change anything, I asked to see the hotel manager and after a few minutes the manager came out and I explained the situation. He gave us a 3 room suite that was just redone and we had a wonderful experience.The breakfast that was served on the Pier was wonderful and fairly priced, Hotel food is usually expensive and this was not so bad. The cruise ships docked by the hotel were not really a distraction, The hotel is in a perfect location, I would stay again but I would call in advance and request rooms on a higher floor Do not be afraid to complain about a room in a hotel if it your are not satisfied with your room,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Average Service”
Reviews.Author: Coolin
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Westin - Key West this December 2011. The property has the best location among hotels in Key West. The plus points of this hotel are Perfect Location - On Melroy Square, very Close to Shoping and Dinning of Duval Square. Very next to Little Whitehouse, Sunset Celebrations, Trolley starting points and Marina for Jet Ski, Glass bottom boats etc. You donâ€™t require your vehicle which helps a lot as the traffic situation to drive to Key West Center is very bad. Sometime a drive of 10 mile might take you about an hour to enter into Key west. The minus points of this hotel are The rooms are old and have very outdated ambience. The staff of the hotel and restaurants is international and inexperienced so they are not very co-operative and lacks professionalism. The bar closes early. The food is generally good but lacks variety. The travel desk is ok. There are big large cruise ships parks in front of ocean view rooms for entire day which blocks your view of being and ocean front rooms and makes the place noisy in the morning. There is no beach attched to the hotel. Summary : This hotel minus the location would make it a very ordinary place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,perfect getaway....”
Reviews.Author: luckytownbob
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property countless times,since before it was a Westin....it used to be a Hilton. This place always delivers friendly service,clean comfortable rooms,and the location can't be beat.We have never had a problem with anything here. The pool area is plenty big and very nice,centrally located on property.There is always plenty of room to relax,it never seems crowded at all. There are several bars on site and a very nice restaurant waterside-a little pricey but not anymore so than any other high-end property on the island.. There is a marina next door where FURY water sports is,very convenient to "getting out there" for snorkel trips or sunset sails.From the Westin you can EASILY walk to Duval St,Hemingway House,and the Key West Bight.The aquarium is 2 doors down.The cruise ships dock right outside the property.You must valet your car if you have one,parking is a premium down here-your car goes into a garage....the valet team is great,though,and you never have to wait long for your vehicle. The rates here at the Westin are on the high side,but if you qualify for government rates(we do) and book early,you can save 50%.They usually offer AAA as well.....we travel to Key West a couple times a year and this is always our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth money try Waldorf on other side of island”
Reviews.Author: Fivestarlady17
Reviews.Content: Very expensive, great location, but far from beach. No washcloths, we left their restaurant after waiting on a server for 15 minutes...maybe the workers are on vacation too. Explored other hotels and recommend the waldorf on the other side of the island. It's not too far from Mallory square and has a resort theme- beautiful views, easy access, restaurant and bar on beach for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “We checked in and our room reeked of cigatette smoke, they sprayed it that night but could not move us, we checked out d”
Reviews.Author: mary n
Reviews.Content: we checked in and our room reeked of cigarette smoke, while the hotel sent someone up to try and spray it and remove the smell it did not work. They could not move our room and we checked out a day early because of this, staying one night instead of 2 nights and forfeited the cost of the second night, which was on Starwood points but the hotel would not refund them. We only hope that the previous guests did pay the penalty for smokiing in the room and were charged the fee.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, great location, pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: srp66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Westin Key West for a few nights mid-week, on a surprise trip for my mother-in-law. We had 6 of us, plus 2 small dogs, and booked a 2-bedroom suite. The hotel was so accomodating throughout our stay. Upon arrival, we were given welcome packages for our dogs, which included food/drink bowls and a large, cushy dog bed. Our room was very clean and spacious, with a common living area, 2 bedrooms, and 2 bathrooms. We had a partial ocean view. The bed was very comfortable, and the resort itself seemed very family friendly, yet also quiet. The best thing about The Westin, aside from the friendly staff, was the location. It was within walking distance of Duval Street, and also had a portion of the marina that was sectioned off from the rest...intended just for guests to watch the sunset. We had drinks on the marina our first night, and then enjoyed brunch on our last day at the Bistro. The outdoor areas are all pet-friendly (except for the pool area), as well as several restaurants on Duval Street. Our only complaint was that the bellhop was very slow picking up our luggage from the room upon checkout. We were waiting for nearly 15-20 minutes for help - on a Wednesday afternoon. Other than that minor complaint and that the room was on the expensive side, this was the perfect location for a short family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Tom T
Reviews.Content: Had a great time as always. Love key west and the Westin has a great location. Clean room and the people are great. Save money don't go to the spa at sunset key get the best massage around from Susan at pool side. Hope to be back real soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Mohito ever!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRalph
Reviews.Content: Jimmy at the Bistro makes the best Mohito ever. Just the right amount of mint, lime and zip. It's worth the trip to Key West for just one sip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location.. Service so so”
Reviews.Author: coltvr77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Key West over Christmas and had booked our room via priceline. When we checked in, Claire, the front desk manager was not very pleasant to deal with at all. We didn't receive a courtesy greeting even and felt very unwelcome. We were a couple and they couldn't find us a King bed on the entire property. Thankfully we dealt with Elliot thereafter and that's when things started looking up. Though we weren't given a king room the same night, the queen beds room was impeccable. Very clean, neat and perfect amenities. Loved the sunset deck and the Mallory Square proximity. Very close to all attractions and Duval st. We went jet skiing and the boarding station is right behind the hotel which is a huge plus. The cruise ship docking didn't bother us at all. After a slightly choppy start, this ended up being one if the best hotels we've stayed at. I would highly recommend (and hope you deal with Elliot). Check out was not a great experience. On the phone they said we could check out until noon. In person the lady said I had to leave by 11:30. Their front staff can do with some customer service training.

Reviews.Title: “Center of Key West Downtown”
Reviews.Author: crazyteapot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with another couple and added this on to our holiday trip to Florida. We drove in, valet parked for $22/night and did not move the car until leaving. When we weren't walking, we used the bike peddle taxis that got us to our destination quickly. We were in rooms 242 & 244 which faced onto the pool. I used SPG points for this stay. Nice rooms and they brought us a frig as requested(no charge). Small balcony overlooking the heated pool. Pool has plenty of padded chaise lounges and makes for a nice relaxing time. We enjoyed the Sunset parties sponsored by the hotel and businesses. It is along the waterfront at the back of the hotel. The hotel has a mobile bar that offers all kinds of drinks during this time. There are various performers along the waterfront and it is suitable for adults and children alike. We ate breakfast several times at the hotel's waterfront restaurant and enjoyed the views of the water and cruise ships that may dock. The food was good. Also ate one dinner here and the food was good but getting waited on initially even after being seated by a host required a call to the main desk of the hotel from my cell phone. Overall I would stay here again because of the location. You are 1-2 blocks from Duval and maybe 4 from the boat harbor that many excursions leave from. This area is very bike friendly and they are also available for rental. Property has a good conceirge and gift/supply shop that offer a lot. Have some discount coupons for various places - free drinks,etc. and were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Rooms Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: cubfanjim
Reviews.Content: By all means, I would recommend anyone stay at the Westin in Key West. The location is near the center of town and all attractions, so you can walk or bike to everything. We flew into Key West and did not have or need a car. For the $20 a day the hotel will charge you to park, I would leave the car behind and rent bikes or take a cab. The area can be very busy if the cruise ships are in, or quiet when they are not. Pool is nice, big enough, and good pool bar service. Ride your bikes 15 minutes to Smathers Beach...there is not beach at the Westin. The only downside was the room itself...it was big enough, and clean to be sure, and the bathroom was nicely updated, but the rest of the decor was dark and drab. Looked kind of like a Ramada Inn from the 80s. Heavenly bed is of course, very nice. Three stars.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bigsky55
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for wandering the local historic sites and hot spots. We were upgraded to a room with an ocean view for no charges. Very helpful and friendly front desk staff. You pay for parking everywhere in town, so the $20 for self-parking in their garage, although steep, isn't unexpected. The property itself was very nice; clean, attractive, right on the water with a view of the cruise ships right out front. Very nicely maintained, fresh paint and very clean. I bid for a room on Priceline and paid 45% of the posted rate. Not bad, especially since we were there during peak season, on December 26th. We needed 2 beds, which Priceline doesn't guarantee, so followed up my bid with a phone call, and they were accomodating. The bedding was very plush and comfotable, with a choice of pillow softness and down comforter. The toilet/shower was separated from the vanity area by a sliding door which was kind of Asian feeling. Very nice furnishings Overall, the only bad thing is that because it is a 5 star resort, there isn't a breakfast included. They do have a restaurant, but we chose to wander around town and ate elsewhere. Overall, much more luxurious than I generally am used to, so it was a special treat. If you can get a room for a good deal, this is the place!!

Reviews.Title: “Really borderline value”
Reviews.Author: WiseTraveler1974
Reviews.Content: Mid-week stay which I'd just have to give 3 stars for. Can't beat the location and the Westin has nice amenities and spacious rooms. However, they were in the midst of painting rooms all over and the place stunk like paint. We even switched rooms but could not escape it. I was disappointed that we were not warned of the painting and then not moved to a better location or offered an upgrade/discount. Westin usually has higher standards. Also, their $20 boat charge to Sunset Key is a ripoff. It shouldn't be more than $5 for a two minute ride to their own resort where I'll spend more money.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian S
Reviews.Content: the ocean view is awesome even though during the morning its blocked by big ships but there gone by 3pm so you can still see the sunset and its nice. the hotel is clean and has good service the only bad thing is the $20 you have to pay for parking but its good because your so close to everything so it was fine. overall it was a great hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Megan R
Reviews.Content: Originally booked a room at Ocean Key but decided to switch here due to saving $135. Was quite hesitant about booking this hotel after reading the bad reviews...but glad we did book it. Nice hotel with an ideal location. We had a deluxe oceanfront king on the 3rd floor of the marina building. The rooms are pretty small...muchn smaller than The Westin we stayed at in D.C., but we really didn't spend much time in the room. The staff was extremely helpful. We had a friend stay with us for a night and requested a rollaway bed, was in our room but the time we got back and no extra charge. Also had mix up with parking...told our friend to park in garage because it was only $20 a day and he was only staying one night, When he left it charged him $48, Went to front office and they refunded his money. Lost one of our room keys and no problem giving us a new one. Room was clean to our standards which are pretty high. Yes cruise ships were docked every day in front of our room but we really didn't mind it, they were always gone by sunset and as I said before we weren't in Key West to spend our days in our room. Bellhop held luggage for us upon arriving to the hotel before check-in and staying after check-out, very helpful. Only complaints... -Upon arriving early for check-in at around 12:45 was told the room was not ready. They took our phone number and said they would call as soon as the room was ready. We returned at about 3:45 to find our room had been ready and we never received a call. -Found a small spot of mold in the shower on our last night there. -Hot tub is relatively small for a big hotel and had to wait over an hour to be able to use it. Once we were able to use it, we could only stay in for a few minutes because our eyes were burning from the chlorine...good to know it was clean, but unbearable. Also, for a heated pool, was too cold for us to get in. -Elevator we used seemed as though it was never vacuumed. Overall a good stay and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great area to walk”
Reviews.Author: centurytravel
Reviews.Content: As cited by others, the location of the Westin Key West is great for the popular tourist areas such as Mallory Square and Duval Street but I would emphasize you can walk to nearly all the historical sites from the hotel. Adjacent to the hotel is the Custom House which provides insight into the fascinating history of Key West. A block down the street is President Truman's summer White House and further out is Hemingway's home. We were fortunate that cruise ships only docked two of our four day stay and did not impact our tropical court yard view. I would be irritated to have a cruise ship block my view from a premium rate room. The rooms in this former Hilton Hotel are standard size and do not warrant a five star rating in terms of amenities as compared to other Westin hotels. On another floor we did see some of the rooms are undergoing renovations. We had a narrow balcony where we relaxed or we went to the the hotel deck to watch the sunset. The parking structure is about 100 yards away from the actual hotel room building. A highlight was the Sunday brunch buffet at the hotel's Bistro 245 restaurant. Well prepared food including rack of lamb, prime rib, soft shell crab, sushi, omelet station and unlimited mimosa for about $35 per person - a bargain. We would return to this hotel just for the buffet and location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: aly o
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had a great room overlooking the marina. Yes we did see cruise ships, but that did not bother us. Room was quiet and bed very comfortable. Pool area had very comfortable chairs and wonderful service. The best part of this hotel is it is in walking distance to so many great restaurants and shops. We can't wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location - except for the cruise ships”
Reviews.Author: Picky_Eater_From_NY
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, not quite up to typical Westin standards, but more than reasonable for Key West. The location is ideal - right on the boardwalk. Beautiful sunsets, and close to the action. Very close to some really good restaurants. It's a bit of a trek from the parking garage to the rooms, so be prepared if you plan to move your luggage by yourself or take your car out for daily excursions. The biggest negative is the cruise ships. DO NOT waste your money on an ocean view room like we did. All you'll get for the extra $$ is a view of a large cruise ship. In addition to a cruise ship, we were blessed with a big yacht parked right outside our room - about 50 feet from the balcony/window. At least the yacht had the decency to turn off their lights by 11PM - but I did worry about the radar unit constantly rotating at eye level. Opt for the pool side rooms. They are cheaper, identical amenities, and you get a view of the pool and plantings - much nicer seeing people enjoying the pool rather than the cruise ship folks swarming the marina.

Reviews.Title: “What a location”
Reviews.Author: SpikeGreensboro
Reviews.Content: The price was right,the service was fine, and the location is superb. My second trip to Key West, and this compound is in the middle of everything. You are able to walk to most interesting sites. Don't miss the sunset from the second floor open bar. The value was definitely there for the price. I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of the town”
Reviews.Author: boshmd
Reviews.Content: Went here for a business trip and the room was booked by a travel planner and luckily got a corner room overlooking harbor when a cruise ship was docked. Views were amazing though room was a little on the smallish side but only there for one night so no big deal. Great location to hit Duval street and tourist attractions..easily walkable from here to shopping. Check in and check out were pretty easy as well. Would stay again for sure if had the opportunity and pricing was reasonable i thought.

Reviews.Title: “Jimmy the bartender”
Reviews.Author: paj44
Reviews.Content: Jimmy was awesome! He makes a great drink! He is a lot of fun and we wound up hanging for a few hours almost daily! Thanks jimmy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great views and location, needs major overhaul”
Reviews.Author: IPuttheTrickinPatric
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and chose this hotel due to the location. It delivered in that respect as well as the friendliness of the staff, but fell short else where. Although the room we stayed in (05) in the building overlooking the water had a nice view, it was in serious need of repairs and updating.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for drinks along the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Hans P
Reviews.Content: If you're strolling the waterfront in the evenings and watching all the entertainment, you've got to stop by the Westin Bar-Truck for a drink (or 2 or 3) and see Jimmy the Bartender! Sometimes the line may look long, but that's because he mixes the best drinks and it moves fast. Excellent spot to catch all the live street entertainment! Hotel is also very nice, we've stayed twice. Only drawback is no beach onsite but there are many within walking distance and you can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jholapara
Reviews.Content: Had visited this hotel while back. the rooms were preety ok. the reason i give this hotel very good tag cause of the proximity to duval street and mallory square. hotel is quite ideally located. also u are on the waterfront which gives u added advantage. Overall nice hotel to stay if your in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Nice Sunset!”
Reviews.Author: SeattlePM1
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Great Location. Bistro has great menu and weekend buffets. Great outdoor dining and bar on harbor. Cruise ships dock but are gone by sunset. Sunsets are incredible. Only minus is small crowded pool. Great location in old town off duvall street and edge of Truman annex.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcm88
Reviews.Content: We were really looking forward to staying at the Westin because we had a great experience two years ago...however this time I can't say the same. We checked in the morning and we were told a room was available, the room was big and had a great view of the pool and ocean. But I found crumbs from the previous guest that didn't get vacuumed the two days we were there, also the housekeeping didn't leave a complete set of towels on the first day. Though the room was big it was dark, the lightening could be better and though it can't be fixed now the tiling in the shower was not done very well because there is a lot of jagged edges on the floor and wall. There was also a bad/weird smell in the hallway the entire time we were there. We were also a little disappointed with the staff working in the hotel, I expect for a hotel the caliber of the Westin that they would encourage their staff to say hi and smile and be friendly to guest. I did speak with the manager about the issues when we were checking out and he did apologize but with this experience it would make me think of looking for somewhere else to stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic FREE time”
Reviews.Author: SUNandSANDLOVER77
Reviews.Content: The reason I give this hotel an overall good review is because we werent paying customers. We stayed with free resort nights over thanksgiving weekend through the star woods program. My husband and I are avid travelers and he is platinum with star woods, had we paid to stay my review would be much worse. I looked up the cost of the room we were staying in and it was about $500/night. That's totally ridiculous for this hotel, other than the best location I can think of in Key West, the hotel is lacking in many other departments, mainly service. It's true that the staff stand around and act like they don't really care. When we arrived we asked for an upgrade and they told us the hotel was sold out for the weekend, I checked online before arriving and knew this was not the case. After reminding them several times that we were platinum, surprise they upgraded us to an ocean view room, weird how they went from completely full to having a magical extra room?! The young man who was first helping us really had no idea what he was doing and every time I went through the lobby I saw him and he always appeared to be standing around with no idea what to do. The valet staff acted like they were there to hangout and chat with each other instead of help guests and we rented scooters, parked them ourselves and were charged $11/night per scooter to have them "valeted" that was absurd! When departing as we we're walking out my husband was struggling with several bags and one of the valet or concierge staff (not sure bc a lot of guys were just standing around) just stood there and watched us he didn't even bother to help with the door which another guest noticed and opened. Overall the rooms were okay but have probably seen better days. The views from our ocean front porch were fantastic and despite other traveler reviews about the cruise ships blocking the view we didn't mind even when the gargantuan celebrity cruise ship was parked in front of our room for a day. The people watching from our porch was great. It's a very busy area so if you don't like a bustling atmosphere I would not recommend staying here. The pool and hot tub were okay, nothing spectacular and I would say the same for the rest of the common areas in the hotel. The lobby was boring and the water they offered in the lobby was always either empty or there were no cups. Seems like such a simple thing that most hotels never seem to have an issue with, I'm pretty sure there were at least ten staff standing around doing nothing about 90% of the time so they could have easily filled up the water. However, again, the staff just don't seem to care. If I were the manager here I would be totally embarrassed by the overall poor staff morale and lack of care for guest experience. I would not pay to stay here, but given that it was free it was a lot easier to swallow. Watch out for the nickle n diming bc they get you with things like parking, which they tried to charge us $55 for and we didn't even park there for 24 hours. Really what this hotel needs is a good kick in the management and staffs rear, because it has such great potential to be an amazing resort, but is being brought down by it's staffing. We also took the opportunity to go over to sunset key on the boat and had breakfast there twice at latitudes, would highly recommend it, sunset key is a private island/resort owned also by westin but is top notch and unfortunatly does not participate in the free resort nights! As guests at Westin you can also go to the beach at sunset key for $20/person, however you have to get beach tickets from the concierge, they are first come first serve and they only give out so many per day which is annoying but also keeps the beach quiet and serene feeling. Definitely worth the $ to go to sunset key for the beach and the restaurant, also nice to walk around and look at the cute cottages and houses on the island, it's really a one of a kind place! Too bad the same can't be said for the Westin key west resort and marina. Ps my dad and step mom were also staying on their boat in the marina at $100/night and said it was a total let down, not to mention the marina is not protected and very choppy from all the boats coming and going, I'm still nautious from the 30 minutes I spent on the boat sitting in the marina! We also tried the bistro at the hotel for thanksgiving dinner, it was a buffet and while over priced at $40/person it was really good food! So in the end, if you get a deal or your using free nights or points it's worth it, but if I had to out of pocket $1500 for 3 nights here I would be highly disappointed, honestly the Westin at Detroit Metro Airport is better in terms of staff and ambience. For what it costs to stay here, you can get a bungalow over the water in Bora Bora for that kind of cash. Westin if your reading this, time to hire a new management team or send in some serious hospitality training!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, need a lot of help in customer service.”
Reviews.Author: nicholasevans
Reviews.Content: After arriving into Key West we took a scenic cab ride with a very informative driver to the Westin. The area was bustling as cruise ship passengers were scurrying everywhere on foot, bikes and small motorized vehicles. We arrived the Westin and entered the lobby. A few awkward glances from the front desk staff and we were greeted by an un-uniformed staff member with "what can I help you with". We went through the normal transactions of checking in and then the front desk staff member said "I need to speak to my manager about your upgrade". As a Platinum SPG member we are entitled to upgraded rooms when available. I've never experienced the front desk staff leave to check in with a manager and reflected on all of the reviews I've read here on Trip Advisor which spoke of this property being frugal with upgrades. The staff member arrived back and said "We got slammed with the holiday so we can't upgrade you. We don't have any rooms". I noted that I had read a lot of reviews on Trip Advisor and FlyerTalk that this property doesn't like to upgrade Platinum members. He said "I don't know, we don't have any rooms, do you want to speak to my manager"? I told him that online there were plenty of rooms available. He said he would check with his manager again and went back to the office. I pulled out my iPhone SPG app while he was away and pulled up Ocean view, Ocean front and Suites that were all available. He came back and said "I don't have anything now so you'd have to wait...so why don't I put you in your originally booked room". I said that we were happy to wait. He asked me what my SPG app was showing as available and I listed Ocean view, Ocean front and Suites all available. He then looked at his computer and said "let me see what we have" and then called his manager from the desk phone. At this point he must have received permission to upgrade us as he muttered phrases including my name, upgrade, Ocean front, etc.". After the phone call he said he could indeed upgrade me and would put me in a "high room". This was the most awkward check-in experience I've every had. Usually hotels are very welcoming and friendly. Here I had to fight for something that my status with the SPG program should automatically give us, if available, and it was very available. We were put in a second floor Ocean front room in the "main building". I wouldn't call this a high floor but the room was very nice and the view was not bad either. As other contributors have noted, this hotel is right in front of an active cruise dock.
