The room we were in, 261, provided both a view of the ship and the water while views from the annex building of the hotel are almost completely obstructed when a ship is in port. There were a lot of passersby on the promenade in front of our room. If you're looking for a private and quiet experience this may not be the hotel for you. A highlight of the property is Sunset Key Beach. For $20, which includes a ferry ride to and from the Key and beach access, we were able to enjoy serene sunbathing. We were pleased with the experience on the beach. It was very quiet and there were few other people on the beach. We also had an enjoyable room service breakfast on Thanksgiving morning. Not the best food I've had but it was good. I think the bottom line with this property is to not go in with any expectations. As you can see on the forum there are very mixed reviews of this property. We took our chances and, in the end, our feelings on the property are also mixed. They clearly need some assistance in customer service as this was evident in both my stay and in many other contributor's feedback. I've read from the marketing & social media manager, who comments on contributor reviews here, state that the property meets Westin and SPG standards. As a customer with about 100 Starwood stays I would say that this property does not meet the standards I've seen met in other properties all over the world. They should take some of their guests constructive feedback to make an OK property a great property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable hotel, Poorly staffed”
Reviews.Author: kt127
Reviews.Content: I had a two night stay here during the week of Thanksgiving. The hotel is excellently located in the downtown area and on the water. The cruise ships dock behind the hotel, so if a ship is in your view will be greatly blocked. However the ships generally leave in the later afternoon around 5, before the magnificent sunset. There are plenty of things to do within a short walk, including bike, boat, and jet ski rentals. I recommend the island jet ski tour, takes about 2 hours and lots of fun. Plenty of restaurants, shops and bars within a short walk, all geared for the tourist. This town is one big happy hour. Back to the hotel. After a lengthy wait in a line of two people, I finally checked in. I was a little early (1pm) and my room wasn't ready yet so they took my cell number and called within the hour to let me know my room was ready. In the mean time, I asked where the restaurant was located. I was told take the elevator around the corner to the second floor. Did that, nothing but conference rooms. I go back down and talk to the same young lady - I asked for a restaurant and you said it's on the second floor? No I didn't say that, I told you the concierge is on the second floor - the restaurant is outside and to the left. Okay. So off I go again with my roll-aboard bag in tow, take a left and walk all around the entire hotel. No restaurant. Lot's of shops and vendor stalls, but no restaurant. Starting to get a little peeved, so this time I walk past the front desk and ask one of the valet parking attendants outside for directions to the restaurant. Oh the restaurant is in the other building - you have to walk across the courtyard, then through the hotel, than walk past the pool, and then you'll find it. I ate at Bistro 254 twice - once for lunch and once for brunch. On both occasions the food was good and tasty, as were all my meals in Key West. Nothing extraordinary, but good. Both restaurant visits were marked by extremely slow service, almost to the point I felt ignored. On both visits, the routine was to let you wait a while, then take your order, bring your food, let you eat and sit a while, then return to refill your drink and ask if you're ready for the check. No automatic water or coffee refills, no checking in to see if everything is okay. Bottom line - decent food, reasonable prices for waterfront dining, and below average service during not overly busy times (no lines for a table, several empty tables). The room was nice and comfortable. I was upgraded to a suite with a balcony with a partial water view. Bed was very comfortable, typical of Westin. Very clean room as well. Hotel decor, carpeting , etc. was dated and worn, pretty much in line with Key West as a whole, and definitely in need of refurbishment. I didn't mind the frayed carpets nearly as much as the poor service. I slept well in my room, and enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,but cruiseships blocking the view.”
Reviews.Author: Mona A
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and the first afternoon we were able to sit on our balcony and watch the sunset. The next two mornings the view were blocked by cruiseships, one bigger than the other, and they don't leave until the sun has gone down. We're glad we got the first evening with a view, but it's not worth paying for a view you don't have. The rooms are ok in the layout, but the air con is very noisy and the carpets are extremely dirty. We walked on them without shoes for about an hour and our feet were actually black underneath! The private island, Sunset Key, the hotel owns were you can buy tickets and stay at the beach all day is lovely. That is well worth paying for. Otherwise the hotel is very close to all you need, shops, restaurants and watersport.

Reviews.Title: “Very Best Hotel On The Island”
Reviews.Author: Dan B
Reviews.Content: Wow! I can not say enough about how great this Hotel is. It made our stay very enjoyable and carefree. We have stayed there 3 times now and have never ever had a bad experience. First of all check in is easy with no surprises and hassle free. Bell boys take your luggage right out of your car, park your car and deliver to your room if you so desire. The rooms are spacious enough and the beds are big and comfortable. The pool is set away from the crowds and the sight of the public and is very relaxing. The restaurant has exceptionally good food. Breakfast outside looking out to the bay or inside for those prefer to eat inside. The best part of this stay is Jimmy the bar tender. Absolutely hands down the best bar tending on the island. Jimmy will always make you a top notch drink and put a smile on your face. he can usually be found at the outside bar or model T truck bar. Be sure to ask for his specialty drink "the green thing" He will give you a full glass and small taster. I very highly recommend the Westin Key West

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: mschaben
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and have been very pleased with the service. It is right on the water next to Mallory Square and within walking distance to many popular places such as Sloppy Joe's and Hog's Breath! Must places to visit. Also if you want a good drink be sure to visit Mojito Jimmy at the bar in the Westin in the morning. If you are there in the evening be sure to visit him in the old truck which is right by the water outside of the Westin hotel. He makes the best drinks around!!! Went their for the boat races and it was a perfect hotel to watch them from.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Key West.. about as good as you can do”
Reviews.Author: ParacleteLI
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'd say that if you are looking for quintessential Key West, it's probably better to stay in an older guest house or hotel on Duvall which won't be nearly as nice, but probably fits what Key West is all about. If you like newer hotel like surroundings, the Westin is a great place. First off, it's not like a Westin you'd find in a big city. This is only 3 stories high or so, and sprawls around a pool and the harbor. The harbor views are amazing, especially if you catch the cruise ships docking in the morning. You are also in very short walking distance of the bars and restaurants on and near Duvall. You can park your car and forget it, although there are a few great restuarants and the beach you'd have to drive to. If not for the location and place this is more of a 3 to 3.5 star property, but on Key West, about as good as it gets, and much better than nearly every other hotel on Key West. (I think there is a Hyatt next door that appears to be similar)

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sarah c
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights this novemeber. Very very nice, staff were friendly, rooms were lovely and comfortable and had a nice view of the sea. the best thing is it was on the marina and close to to duvel street and malloy square. 3 min walk if that! watched the boat racing that was great. not sure about the hotel food as so much to do and eat outside i didnt eat in the hotel. loved this hotel nice clean, modern and fun!

Reviews.Title: “2011 Boat Race Week”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in Key West for this years boat races. Jim Magee in his "Pier Bar Truck" did an excelent job of making sure that my friends and I had drinks when we were ready for them. It was extremely busy most of the time and he did not miss a beat keeping everyone happy. Thanks Jim! Steve B.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: agg714
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Key West yesterday. If there is anyplace better to relax and enjoy the Keys, we haven't found it! From our ocean front room, we could enjoy part of the Mallory Square craziness & sunsets. The Westin even had a bar set up a few steps away! Ready to return. Maybe Claire (front desk, French accent)will still be there to help check with check in or outâ€¦...

Reviews.Title: “great for teens and family”
Reviews.Author: JIMBOSfBayArea
Reviews.Content: great location and if you want the kids to get scuba they can walk to captains corner for classes

Reviews.Title: “Jane Brannigan Westin 'Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: I had friends in town last week from NJ. Jane arranged our trip over to Latitudes for a birthday celebration at the Bar. She is a true compliment to the Westin staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money or points”
Reviews.Author: SoccerNerd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Starwood properties for business and pleasure and this is by far the worst. The hotel location is great but service and condition of the rooms are not up to Westin standards. The fact that this hotel is on a list of SPG Award Night "Luxury" resorts is a disgrace. To be clear, I specifically look for positive things about hotels and the Concierge assistance was the only bright spot. Check-in- Due to computer issues we did not receive our room keys until after 8pm. Front desk folks acted like this happened all the time and did not seem happy with their jobs. Rooms- Are you Gold and looking for an upgrade or late check out? Not so much.. even with the hotel at half capacity. Requested late check out and was told the hotel was sold out. Why then can you still book rooms on the website? Called the SPG number and suddenly we were ok for a late check out. Housekeeping- Room was cleaned each day between 4pm-5pm. Had to track someone down the last day we were there. Really? Amenities- Due to "computer issues" we could not charge anything to our room the first two days. Cash only at the pool bar and restaurant was not convenient at all. Save your $300+ per night and SPG points and stay at a B&B or smaller hotel. Key West is fairly easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Jimmy Magee”
Reviews.Author: BigCityBob16
Reviews.Content: For the past twelve years I have been visiting Key West for the World Champion Offshore Boat Races. Although, I don't stay at the Westin Resort, I do visit it on a daily basis to relax and dine: my reason for doing this is because of an employee named Jimmy Magee. I stopped in one time eight or ten years ago for lunch at the outside bar where I met Jimmy. The man was very friendly and polite; I had an enjoyable lunch, great food and conversation and have dined they every year since. All made possible by one fantastic person, Jimmy Magee. One of the better moves I have made in my life time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Hottubinit
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin for the powerboat races this year. What a perfect place to watch the races as the boats race right past the hotel and its a great place to view them. The food is good, the service is good and if you want the best bartender that gives you great drinks be sure to visit Mojito Jimmy at the Westin bar. He serves up good drinks in the morning and then serves up great drinks in the afternoon/ evenings in the truck down on the waterfront. He really knows how to take care of you. So if you are ever in Key west be sure to stop by for a great drink from JIMMY!!! He's the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best, overpriced, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Hernandoman
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to stay there using Starwood points, but would have been very upset to pay the huge price for this average hotel room. The A/C didn't work when we got there, but it was replaced quickly. I would think they might have known it wasn't working. Would not recommend unless you like average accomodations for about four times the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Lora B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this last Saturday and had exemplary service from offering valet parking, to late registration, and a wonderful waterfront dinner upon the waterfront with the most courteous of waiters and some of the best grouper and yellowtail we have had. The pool and whirlpool are so beautiful. Our room was perfect with everything that we would have wanted, with extras of sewing kits and nail file to robes in the room along with starbuck coffee and bottled water. The front desk was wonderful about explaining the parking and letting us know at every thing we needed to do to navigate each step of our trip. Also there is a wonderful little Mad Hattery shop nearby that has some very fine head ware. We plan to come back again and stay here when we do, we think the service and the room was wonderful. The Heavenly bed made for a blissful night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice, clean, and new, with perfect location -- convenient to Mallory Square, Duval St., & waterfront.”
Reviews.Author: Labnut
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Westin. The combination of location and the beauty of the property makes it our favorite place to stay in Key West. The Westin is right next to Mallory Square and about a block from Duval Street, yet it's quiet and removed from the noise and crowds. On the opposite side of the hotel from Mallory Square is the marina and Truman Annex -- if you'd like a quiet walk. It's also about a 6 minute walk from the waterfront area. For us, the location could not be better, and we were able to avoid having to take a cab or pedi-cab during our entire stay in Key West. The property is simply beautiful and appears to be relatively new. We loved the architecture and the landscaping around the pool area. Although the room was expensive and a bit small, we've come to expect that in Key West, where space is at a premium, especially in a good location - and we think it was totally worth the cost. Westin even has its own sunset celebration, complete with food, drinks, and performers, so you don't even have to walk over to Mallory Square. The restaurant on the water side (Bistro 245) was excellent, and you can eat while watching the sunset, or just enjoying the view. There are a number of nice shops at the Westin, and it is very close to the customs house (now the Museum of Art & History), the aquarium, the Mel Fisher museum, and the Audubon house, and the Conch Train depot. And it is DOG-FRIENDLY with no dog fee! (Our dog is over the 40 lb. weight limit, but we got special permission from the management to bring him because he is a Canine Good Citizen and Certified Therapy Dog.) Look for rate specials and join the Starwoods Preferred Guest program to get the best rates. You can request a mini-frig free of charge. One down-side, for us, was that when the cruise ship docks at the nearby marina, there is a sudden crowd of people walking from the marina to Duval Street. Also, I think it's possible that a cruise ship will dock in front of the hotel and obstruct the view, but this didn't happen while we were there, and we were assured that the cruise ships leave before sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Key West”
Reviews.Author: MadisoniteFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Mallory Square which holds the evening sunset celebration every night. It is also within walking distance to most of the downtown restaurants, stores and bars. In fact, we walk the entire width of the island to Southernmost point when we are there. The rooms are very clean. Our room was facing the side of the aquarium and their air conditioning unit, we asked and received a better room with no problem. The restaurant is nice with a wonderful outside area, the food is good but with so many restaurants on the island we found that we never ate at the same place twice. This was our 6th stay at this hotel....obviously we enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy Fest Experience”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelers93
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying here for Fantasy Fest this year. We are seasoned travelers and in prior years had stayed in private rental homes for FF. We contacted the hotel ahead of time to discuss room arrangements, luggage shipping, special requests, and in room dining options. The staff was wonderful to deal with. No matter what time of day or night and what level of crowd the hotel came through with every request. We were very impressed. We have already booked fpor next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location- hotel big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2011455
Reviews.Content: You do not get what you pay for at the Westin Key West Resort. Hotel rooms are dated and the room we stayed in everyone that passed could see right in our room. All glass front with door, just like the motels we used to stay in the 70s. Very noisy- our room was located next to elevator shaft. We asked to be moved, again our room was noisy, but at least we had privacy. For use of their beach, you must pay $20 per day per person. Key West is a beautiful destination, but think twice before spending your money at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “o.k. if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: MAamyp
Reviews.Content: I paid for a night at this resort for my aunt's anniversary. It was their 25th and I wanted it to be special and mentioned that when I booked the room. When they checked in they were first assigned a room that was old, dirty and run down. Exposed pipes, a big spot on the wall where a refrigerator had been. They mentioned the missing refrig so the front desk sent up an old broken one that didn't even fit into the spot. She said there was a tiny view of the pool but only if the breeze blew and the trees swayed. Luckily they went down and complained, because this was a special occasion and the rooms were not cheap. They were eventually upgraded to a better room, newer with a better view but this first room ruined the experience for them and I was embarrassed because I had arranged it and they said they wrote on the reservation to make it a nice room because of their Anniversary. The second room was nice but I don't think they would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say we almost changed reservations due to previous reviews, what a mistake that would have been. Second, The Westin was clean, the rooms were nice, and the staff was extremely courteous and helpful. From check in to check the front desk was great. Vasil and Zach at the bar were friendly, positive and refreshing. The bistro was really good and had a great grouper sandwich for lunch (we ate at many places in Key West but had at least one meal a day at Bistro over our eight day stay). The concierge was very helpful in booking our excursions, we did the wine and sunset sail tour through them with danger charters and could not have had a better time. As far as cruise ships blocking views this happened one day out of eight, could be time of year. My wife and I had a very relaxing time and are planning to come back again. To the Westin staff keep up the great work and thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Obstructed view”
Reviews.Author: Debra M
Reviews.Content: We decided to come down for our anniversary, we had an ocean view room. We hardly saw the ocean because there were cruise ships parked in front of the hotel almost the entire time we stayed there. The hotel also owns private villas on sunset key island, wished we stayed there instead. It had a beautiful spa, restaurant and beach with a boat shuttle every half hour. Wished they explained this when booking, but of course omitted that important part.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: melindaville
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Key West Resort four of the last five years. Two years ago, we decided to not return based on the terrible service we received--but we were lured back again by the "heavenly bed" (which is the only decent thing about this place). Two years ago, I was very sick with the stomach flu and after 2 days of being unable to eat, I thought I could try a scrambled egg and sent my husband to the restaurant to see if they could make me some dry toast and a scrambled egg. The restaurant refused, saying it was not breakfast time. So what! Here we are spending 3,000+ on your hotel and your guest isn't feeling well! How much would it take to scramble an egg? But because I have a very bad back, we decided to give the Westin one more chance this year. We specifically requested that our "ocean front" room be far from the cruise ships (because this was another problem the previous trip--our "ocean front" room's view was of UGLY cruise ships! We never saw one decent sunset because of these big ugly monstrosities of boats. When we arrived a few weeks ago, we (again) asked about being spared the cruise ships and the person at the front desk told us that while cruise ships would be stopping in the day, they would not be there for the evening sunset. That was a bold faced LIE as our view was marred EVERY NIGHT of six except ONE. I ate room service one night and I was so disgusted by the way it looked and tasted that I felt sick afterward--after only eating 2 bites or so. And again, the service was poor. I called at 9:45 and was told I could not order from the late night menu because it wasn't yet 10:00. Then they said I could order from the lunch menu (which had closed hours before--supposedly). I guess they wanted to get rid of their old food because what they served me tasted like what I would imagine rejected prison food would taste like. Blech and double blech. Stay at the Hyatt, which is a MUCH nicer hotel. We stayed there last year and will stay there from now on (although my husband and I are trying to buy a place there and we can get our own heavenly ed!). I really don't recommend this place. It's gone downhill increasingly over the last 6 years. I know I'll never say there again--regardless of how great their heavenly bed feels.

Reviews.Title: “Review in reverse”
Reviews.Author: brianrdeal1973
Reviews.Content: This review is based on my interaction with the hotel staff before my stay. Just booked this property on a whim last night, despite some of the reviews I have read. While our stay has not taken place yet, we are excited to try it out. On our last trip to Key West, I woke up early one morning and popped in to the Westin. I asked the front desk if it was okay if I walked around the property since I was thinking about booking it for our next trip. The lady said that for security reasons, only registered guests could access the pool area, etc. (No problem..nice knowing they are looking out for the safety of their guests). Then she asked me to wait just a moment and she got on the phone. Upon hanging up, she said she would give me a brief tour of the property and an unoccupied guest room. I found the property to be very nice and the room to be spectacular so I said "I'll be back". So, I can't help but wonder why so many people seem to complain about minor things like no continental breakfast...this is not a business hotel. Relax. You're on vacation. Most (reasonable) people on vacation are not looking to choke down a piece of toast as if they were on their way to a business meeting And all this whining about cruise ships coming into port?? Kinda reminds me of people who build a house in the flight plan of the airport and then complain about the noise. And people should also keep in mind...the manager, the housekeeper and the front desk staff do not sleep in the rooms. If something isn't right, report it to the appropriate person. These people are not mind readers. In addition to overall service, I think it is only fair to also review a property based on the responsiveness of the staff to a (warranted) complaint. They are not going to go out and move the cruise ships. And if you have to strain your neck to see the sunset because you booked a partial ocean view, well, they cannot be held responsible for moving the sun either. Again, I booked this hotel because the lady at the front desk went out of her way to "sell" me on the property. I doubt she gets a commission for doing that. She provided stellar service to me when I wasn't even her guest! So unless this place has gone downhill in a major way in just the past 4 months, I expect we will have a perfect time. Quit being such a bunch of crybabies! Jeez!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: Delta737
Reviews.Content: The Westin is in the perfect location in Old Town Great Place to Stay ALWAYS Clean , Staff is very helpful. My wife and i have been giong there for 5 years NEVER have a bad Experience we spent our Honeymoon on our third trip there they upgraded our room at no charge, the poolside bar is Great so is the food they serve there i'm a cheeseburger person it was cooked perfect. Close to all the town Bar's Cap.Tonys is one place you have to visit as well as Sloppy Joes, Fat Tuesday The Bull , Smallest Bar in town One place i Haev to visit is Jimmy Buffetts Margaritaville Restaurant for my Cheesburger & a Margarita yes I AM PARROTHEAD been following Jimmy Buffett for 20 years . The Resort is perfect for Mallory Square the night show is Great it is also close to all the shops for gifts to bring home. Key West is also famous for Key Lime Pie one is just down the resort on Green St Key Lime Pie Outlet. i bring 3 pies home every time i visit Key West yes you can carry them on the plane. I would recommend The Westin to everyone who visit's Key West Old Town . Thank you Key West For A GREAT TIME See you again in 2012. Delta 737

Reviews.Title: “Perfect again..”
Reviews.Author: temptingtravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel continually gets mixed reviews. I have stayed here no less than 5 times and am always happy with my stay. I am a very frequent traveler who spends approx 200 nights a year in hotels. I don't normally get to stay at luxury hotels due to availability, but even in a Hampton I have specific requirements. I have never been disappointed in this hotel. Even though my status has dropped to gold, they still treat me as a Platinum member. I had a beautiful gulf front room. Granted, there was a cruise ship that stayed overnight, which is very unusual, but I was fortunate enough to not have it block my view. Many others may not have been so lucky. Otherwise, as always it was great experience. I am only posting a second review because of my frequency at this hotel and the fact that on each visit, it continues to exceed expectations. As a side note, everyone comments on the expensive prices. Sadly, these are right in line with everyone else in Key West so don't hold that against them.

Reviews.Title: “Location-Location!”
Reviews.Author: njscully
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of October. We were disappointed that we did not get the suite that was requested almost a year ago. The suite we did have had nice views, but it was much smaller. They will not hold a suite request! The pool was nice, and the bar was very close to get drinks at. We had room service and the food was excellent! The location was terrific, just down from Duval Street. Had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: kpoconnor
Reviews.Content: I am Starwood Platinum member and just stayed at this property for one night during fantasy fest. You can not beat the location of this property. Walk out the door right in the heart of Key west and Duval street. Staff are all very friendly and helpful. I had been trying to get into this hotel for weeks as it was sold out because of Fantasy fest. Finally got a room day before I arrived. When I checked in I found they had upgraded me to suite with nice view of marina. Was told that there would be a parking charge but never did receive one probably because I was on a motorcycle and never used the gate. Rooms are nice and clean with comfortable beds. Bathrooms are a little small. Do have flat panel TVs with high defintion. Do have Wifi but signal not the strongest. One bad thing is the wall unit AC systems. Bit noisy! Typical Platinum amenity was 500 points. No comp breakfast. This is my top pick for Key West visits. Have stayed at the Waldorff but bit to far to walk to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: ana m
Reviews.Content: the property is incredible. it's right on the water with an amazing view and conveniently located next to all the touristic attractions. however, the service is comparable to a Super 8!!! the ladies behind the front desk, if they are even there, are anything but welcoming. they look like they hate life and are doing you a favor by even being there. Don't bother to ask them any questions bc they'll look at you like you're bothering them. As for concierge, well i don't even know if that actually exists at this hotel because they never picked up the phone and i couldn't find they're location. I've been to Westins all over the country and i'm pretty loyal to the chain, however, i'm NEVER returning to this one. You're better off staying at a small local inn, you'll pay less, probably get better service and stay at a cool local unique place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing mojitos”
Reviews.Author: Beth O
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my husband and I have visited Key West! I have waited 1 1/2 yes to see Jimmy, "Mr. Mojito". We found him on our last trip here and he was the first person i looked for when we arrived! If you see the mojito car at The Westin hotel near Mallory Square DON'T PASS IT UP!!! Jimmy makes the best mojitos in the world! I'm not kidding! He is also a very nice guy, willing to give information about activites going on in the city. While we did not actually stay at the Westin we walked back to see Jimmy several times! Thanks Jimmy .....we will see you again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kk1310
Reviews.Content: A little disappointed at my most recent stay here and will look for better options next time I return. The greeting at check in was non existent and they could not find my reservation that was made on westin.com. Luckily they had a room available. The check in employee treated us like it was a hassle, so much for service with a smile, I am the paying guest here! Hotel has gotten a little shabby since my last stay in 2008 and included dirty towels being offered as clean by housekeeping, a lonely pretzel breadstick that laid in the middle of the corridor our entire stay and the housekeeping staff who possibly mistook the area outside our room as their break area?

Reviews.Title: “Great sunsets, great location, and an overall great experience!”
Reviews.Author: jmshepar
Reviews.Content: The Westin Key West was a great place for my friends and I to use as a home-base while in town. We loved the location and the room was comfortable. We were in town for only a couple of days, but the concierge (Jane Brannigan), was able to get us on track with the best day of activities (from the best breakfast to a day of biking and kayaking). Can't beat the proximity to Mallory Square and the sunsets on the roofdeck bar. I would definitely stay here again if I found myself in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property, great views, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CAN_in_AUS
Reviews.Content: After a long drive down to Key West, we were warmly welcomed by the friendly check in staff. The property is quite nice though a little dated. Our room was very comfortable and clean. Our view of the harbour was also inspiring. I have read previous complaints on here about the cruise ships that dock in the harbour and block the view. It was a non-issue for me as I loved looking at those massive ships. There were two different ships on each morning we were there, but they left in the early afternoon and we got our ocean view back. One thing that was surprisingly nice was the balcony doors keep the noise out very well. We didn't even know there were hundreds of people from the ships basically outside our room until we opened the balcony door - this made the room even more comfortable! Great hotel. Would recommend staying here if you're in the keys. Proximity to Duval Street and all the action a definite bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise here in Florida”
Reviews.Author: Optimisticimpression
Reviews.Content: The Westin hotel in Key West: I've been to Key West a dozen times, and we've had couple of great hotels. The Westin was a great choice for me this time I'm disabled an its important that I am accessible to all the attractions. We we're within walking distance to everything (ie: Mallory Sq., Duval St., Mel Fishers Museum and several eating & drinking establishments.) The Westin was a very clean, safe, and beautiful. Everyone right from the time we pull into the hotel until the time we left was friendly, helpful, and caring. I consider myself being very knowledgeable when it comes to good food. We eat at several establishments and I must say that the hotel restaurant was outstanding (I give it a 10). I will recommend the Lobster & Shrimp Alfredo and the Shrimp bisque (they were incredible). We made a reservation at sunset and the back deck is right out side. We were able to order drinks go out side and enjoy the sunset and other attractions. Then we came back and enjoyed dinner. When I go back I'm definitely going to the Westin. Some people look for the cheapest hotel, but for me a clean & comfortable room, good service, and a comfortable bed is what I look for. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - really fab”
Reviews.Author: Sapna P
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located very centrally and it is easily walkable (or a cheap cab ride) to several key attractions. It was very pretty on approach with friendly staff, great concierge service and valet parking ($22/night) who brought our bags to the room. We stayed in the building towards the back. There is a huge pedestrianised area front and back of the hotel so we felt really safe to let our toddler run around in the day or evening. Lots of shops and a lovely ice-cream parlour (swerve the rip-off Haagen Dazs kiosk in the centre and go for these homemade ones!) Our room's mini-bar was locked and when we asked for access so we could store some baby food, they brought us a whole fridge up to our room! Room service was patchy - the first night the food was amazing and restaurant quality (pricey, but good) but the second night we used them they forgot our request altogether! After an hour, we rang to remind them - they did at least give us the meal for free, as apology. Laundry is pricey - there is a 'Hilltop' launderette a short walk/cab ride away where you can get a load done for $7 - drop off on your way out and pick up on your way back. Breakfast at the hotel was good, not over-priced and convenient, but our server was grumpy, humourless and he was clearly miffed we had turned up 10 minutes before last orders at 11am. We preferred going to 'Harpoon Harry's' - the service was friendly and atmosphere of a genuine 'local spot'. Safe, central courtyard location for hotel pool - great for kids (a family we met suggested you get a roomside pool then you can hang in your room with the doors open whilst their older kids run around)- and a very uninspiring and basic gym, made at least better for looking out onto the pool. They make a big deal of the sunset celebrations outside the hotel, but we thought it a bit tacky to be honest - the famed 'Cat Man' drove me nuts and I had to walk away he was so irritating, but I'm also not keen on animals being made to do tricks. The hotel's sunset terrace was a more chilled place to hang out and watch the evening take hold. Hubby also says he loved the free Wi-fi and genuine Starbucks coffees in our room!

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: McClureAustin_Texas
Reviews.Content: If you prepay for your room you can get an excellent deal. The hotel is located perfectly between the water, Duval Street and Mallory Square. The beds are comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, order room service if you want to play room service roulette!”
Reviews.Author: Sunsnowfamily
Reviews.Content: We like the location since we can walk to all our favorite restaurants, are close to Duval street even with kids, which allows for a very flexible schedule. The pool is a decent size. The gym, although decent size for a hotel is lacking a decent bike and has serious mold issues as they powerwash the cement outside, blowing the water right onto the wood floors in the gym, which are covered in black mold, which is probably not that good to inhale while you work out...you're better off going for a run early in the morning through the streets of Key West. When you return from your run, do not order room service unless you want to play room service roulette. No matter what you order, you will never get what you actually ordered. They simply send you what they feel like. I ordered plain yoghurt with fruit and got strawberry yoghurt with granola, no fruit! We did get a waffle we had not ordered! And although they promise to take the charge off your room, double check your bill upon departure! Service is not consistent. Some bartenders are friendly, others rather grumpy and who wants to deal with a grumpy bartender on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Too little for too much money”
Reviews.Author: Robert T
Reviews.Content: Bob and Sue,,Dunedin Fl.Stayed,,Oct.2 thru4,,2011....There is no view to speak of because of the cruise ships.The rooms are small and the usual amenities are non existant. Like lobby coffee,continental bkfst. etc.etc. Only one restaurant and it is very expensive and limited too.It is close to many things but if you stay there you must pay an additional 22.00 per day to park your car. Seems like they cater to the cruise ship crowds more than their guests.Gouge,gouge,gouge. We will not be lured into staying at this less than acceptable hotel again.Overall,,,This place is Very disappointing at best. Do more research. You can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor staff, rooms in need of repair”
Reviews.Author: cocogrove25
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 4:30 and were delighted to hear we had been upgraded as a platinum to an ocean front room. We were told it wasnt ready (odd given the time) so we waited. Ok. A few minutes later the desk clerk came back out and said she had moved us to a different room. I asked if it was as good as the first one and she said it was. Of course it was not so as soon as we got to the room I called and was told someone had already checked into our original room- yes the one we had waited for and then been told it would take too long. Bizarre and so poorly handled. I went back down to the desk and asked for a manager. Jenifer [--] presented herself and rudely told me i had booked a handicapped room - I had not of course. She was 'upgrading' me by moving us to a standard room. Just terrible service and from the manager! We opted for the $10 minibar as our amenity. Ah but there is no minibar one must call room service and pay a fee and gratuity to use it. Ridiculous. Oh well I called for 1 red and 1 white. When we left an hour later still not delivered. When we got back we had two reds of different brands. The actual minibar is locked so i couldnt even chil my water. The ac is very noisy and goes on and off. I called to have engineering look at it but according to the operator 'it is just noisy.' ah so they get that complaint frequently. There is a hole in the wall where the toilet paper holder was. No repair. Just moved it up a bit. The hallways smell musty and old. The walls are dinged and dingy. In general the property is in poor repair. The concierge couldnt be bothered to get off her personal call to assist us. She simply pointed to the map. In short there are much better options in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: KellyMulligan
Reviews.Content: We stayed Oct. 1-7 and thought the Westin was a good deal. Our room was clean and comfortable. The hotel location is excellent - probably canâ€™t be beat. It literally sits against Mallory Square which is where you want to be at sunset. Itâ€™s a short walk to everything essential - Duval St., Trumanâ€™s Little White House, among tons of other highlights. The room had a hair dryer, ironing board and iron, safe, coffee pot and fridge. They also provide shampoo & conditioner daily if you donâ€™t want to lug that along. We only ate breakfast at the resort, and I highly recommend the spicy turkey taco breakfast. YUM! I spent the day at the pool one day while my hubby was in a meeting and it was nice. They provide towels and have an outdoor grill there too. Iâ€™d stay here again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: jipper
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Key West for 25 years and it is a difficult place to find what i would consider "normal" high-end hotels. Key West is very islandy (similar to Bahamas), and 5-stars here is NOT 5-stars in Paris or New York. It's very difficult to build in Key West so a lot of these hotels are much older properties and simple renovations of older properties. The Westin is very much the same. For Key West it is very good, clean and updated. It's located right where the cruise ships are dock, so the walk into old historic Key West (Duval Street) is literally 1minute. I would price check Key West and see how this property compares to say La Concha Hotel (a Crowne Plaza) - which is also nice, and as close to a "real hotel" that you will find in Key West OR Casa Marina. I've never stayed at the north end of Key West where there is the Day's Inn, Comfort Inn and Hampton's and a bunch of others, but those are more typical of a Interstate junction type of hotel - and nearly not as nice as Westin or La Concha and further away from where you want to be (Duval Street).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy aircon.”
Reviews.Author: Magnus W
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a wonderful family trip to Key West and stayed at the Westin resort. The location is spectacular, walking distance to everything and the sunset is literally on your doorstep. Room was fine however the air-conditioning so loud that we decided to sleep with it turned off, since it was 90 degrees this was not very pleasant. A little amazed by that old style noisy air-condition unit in an otherwise nice standard room. Pool area very nice for families but depends a little on the rest of clients, Key West is a party place and we had lots of heavy drinking groups of "older" men. Probably because of the experience of heavy drinking there were only plastic glasses in the room, it would have been nice to have real glass with a glass of wine on the balcony. Altogether though, the location is perfect, beautiful and we had a great time, would probably choose it again if aircon was less noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: FWConch
Reviews.Content: We travel to Key West 2 to 3 times a year and almost always stay at this hotel. The location can't be beat and the staff has always been accommodating and friendly. Only once or twice have we had a complaint--usually handled promptly and efficiently. The real treasure at this hotel is Jimmy the Bartender--the well-known and much-loved Mister Mojito. He always has a kind word and a tale to tell. Jimmy is the guy I look forward to seeing again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff ruins the experience”
Reviews.Author: elitebuff
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this property during Labor Day weekend. Property location and amenities are excellent, however it seems the staff knows this and feels that they can treat the guests unprofessionally and the hotel will still succeed. I have read the other reviews about the lack of customer service and training the management fails to impart on its staff, however I was not prepared for it to be this bad. On a positive note, I really enjoyed the food and ambiance at the hotel restaurant, Bistro 245. But again, the staff falls short. I ordered the eggs benedict, which unfortunately had a hair on it. No big, deal, things like this happen in restaurants. However I did not even get an apology from the server, let alone a manager. I can attest to the reviewer below in reference to the guest bleeding in the pool â€“ I was there during the incident. A hotel cannot control this type of incident; however the unprofessional response by management was inappropriate to say the least. I hope eventually that Starwood will get involved and communicate with the owner of this property (a â€œfranchiseeâ€� as they put it) that it would benefit the hotel if the staff provided customer service levels as expected from a Starwood property. At the price point this hotel is at, there are better options in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Westin stayâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: Vacay4ever1723
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend. Weâ€™ve been to the Keys plenty of times before but usually stay at a Hyatt property. Well this time we decided to splurge & spoil ourselves. The best thing about this property is its location. You can beat it; itâ€™s centrally located & easy to walk to/from all of the hotspots. During the days we hung around the pool. The first day was awesome; Irenea, the pool waitress was amazing. We were able to enjoy the sunshine without worrying about getting up & walking to the bar area. Unfortunately, the next couple of days were not. Not only was she not working, but there wasnâ€™t any wait staff. To get a drink we had to walk through the pool area & up to the bar. Not to sound spoiled, but for $300 a night on Labor Day weekend, the Westin shouldâ€™ve had wait staff for the pool area. The area was packed with guests & they were also frustrated! The icing on the cake was when a young couple decided to have inappropriate behavior in the pool. When the couple exited the pool, the young lady was bleeding. She proceeded to bleed all over the chair cushions. About ten of the guests told the bartenders & pool manager. The pool manager only removed the cushion, but did nothing about the fact she bleed in the pool. Nothing happened until 2 hrs later when senior management came out, roped off the pool & shocked the pool. We were told to stay out of it for a couple of hours. What a joke! Only after complaining, we were given a free dinner at Bistro 245. The only person that was kind to the guests throughout this entire process was Mark Vose. Heâ€™s a great guy & he provided us, along with other guests, dinner vouchers. After that incident, we didnâ€™t go back to the pool. Overall, if you stay here, youâ€™re paying for the location. The facility seriously needs to be updated. Our bathroom smelled like a sewer pipe exploded & our air conditioner didnâ€™t work. After two calls, the service man fixed the AC but couldnâ€™t do anything about the bathroom smell. Overall, I donâ€™t think we would stay here again. Itâ€™s not worth the price at all! We are Westin members and this wasnâ€™t a Westin first class property at all.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the private beach and the breakfast burrito”
Reviews.Author: Daerv
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff and a very well maintained room. We took the hotel charter boat to the private beach and had a fantastic day at a really nice beach which you rarely get in key west.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Weddingwoman
Reviews.Content: just came back from Key West and the Westin....we've stayed here before and absolutely Love the location...it's near Everything....(well except the beach).The rooms are clean and the beds are definitely 'Heavenly'.....the Champagne Sunday brunch is a 'Must Do' at the hotels restaurant Bistro 245-it's worth every $$$.....like every hotel in KW- the frozen drinks at the pool are pricey-approx $10...the pool was clean and there was always plenty of towels available-- the only complaint I have is about the RUDE front desk staff (with the exception of Quinton-he was very polite)...the first day we arrived I asked the young lady if there was outgoing mail- she rudely took my mail and said that in the future I should go to the post office! another time I asked for a taxi and she rolled her eyes...avoid the front desk and forget the concierge- we wanted to rent a car and she suggested we look on the internet!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect...”
Reviews.Author: danpearson
Reviews.Content: An amazingly located hotel in the heart of the action in Key West. We stayed in a traditional guesthouse and it was just like the pictures on the hotel website. Very modern, spacious and clean rooms with all the amenities you could want. Especially the Starbucks Coffee! Our stay was almost perfect, the only slight criticism would be the the lack of pay movies, its the only hotel of its class that we have stayed with that didn't have a catalogue of movies to choose from. The description for the hotel on expedia.co.uk states 'Cable/satellite TV with pay movies.' Also as stated in previous reviews the Cruise Ships are very much part of the scenery and the Westin Marina. We were lucky enough to get a room on the side not overlooking the behemoth ships, but be aware on booking that the view may be obstructed. Minor niggles included toiletries not being replenished by the cleaning service each day when they required it (had to find them in the corridor to get what was missing!) and only 2 out of the 6 nights did we actually have a paper outside the door. Also in the room documentation it said we would receive a bill on our final morning under the door for speedy check out, this did not happen.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here at your own risk!!”
Reviews.Author: Closergirl
Reviews.Content: I initially booked the Westin because I wanted to stay somewhere really nice for my well needed vacation to Key West. I did alot of research on hotels in the area before I booked with Westin. The location is fantastic and the Westin had a great reputation (or so I thought). After arriving in Ft. Lauderdale and driving for 4 hours to Key West, I was very excited to arrive at the Westin and get my vacation started. I'm a new SPG member and I just opened a SPG amex card because I hear good things about SPG hotels and their reputation. Not at this Westin!!! The front desk staff was somewhat standoffish. They were not the friendliest but this was the least of our problems at this hotel. We got to the room and the door opened and all I saw was the most gorgeous ocean views. I was so happy. We got into the room started looking around and that feeling started to dissipate. The lampshade had what looked like blood on it and was bent and beat up, the walls were badly scuffed and dirty with wheels from suitcases and hand prints, the toilet paper holder was broken, chipped wood furniture and their were other peoples hairs all over the bathroom. My friends and I were upset but we were doubting our concerns. As mentioned earlier this was a big splurge for us and we decided that it was unacceptable. We contacted the front desk who then sent the bell hop to give us keys to a new room We asked the bell hop if he wanted to see our concerns in the room and he did not seem to care. The new room was not much better at all. There was no blood on the lampshade but the walls were severely scuffed and dirty and in desperate need of a paint job. We were now really upset. A really nice housekeeping manager (Anthony or Tony??) came to see us because we said this is unacceptable. The housekeeping manager showed us a 3rd room but it was not ocean front and it was not much better than the others. We settled on room #2 with the dirty walls but I was not happy about our decision. I left for the pool for a bit to try to enjoy myself. The pool and pool area is gorgeous. The pool bathroom on the other hand was disgusting. It smelled like a urinal. We got back to the room and found a fruit basket from the staff as an apology for the issues we were experience. The fruit basket had moldy grapes!!! We were asking ourselves....Is this a joke? We started to get increasingly upset. We then went back into the room to shower to get ready for the night and the drain was clogged. I practically took a bath!!! The thing that really put me over the edge was when I went to blow dry my hair and the heat setting did not work. I was really really upset and my night was spoiled because of all the issues. We let the staff know of all of our concerns. The following morning the hospitality manager called us and we told him how upset we were. He said he would comp one night. This made me feel somewhat better about being in the dirty room for 3 nights. I then tried to enjoy the rest of my trip. The rest of the trip was nice but I could not fully get over the issues with the hotel. Upon leaving, we got a bill with charges for all 3 nights. I was upset again. I contacted the front desk they said to come to the front desk to resolve. The very helpful new desk attendant was great. I cannot remember his name but he was fantastic. In addition the Concierge was fantastic and the housekeeping manager was also great. Everyone else could careless about us. I just wanted to wrap this up by saying that I typically don't complain. I've always just "sucked it up" but I have to say the hotel is not worth the the money. I'm really disappointed in this Westin and I'm not sure if I will ever book with Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: vlc401
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to vacation. Just a short stroll to Duval Street and many attractions. Staff are pleasant and attntive. Rooms are great, beds and pillows super comfortable. On site attraction for many water activites through fury wate sports.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a birthday surprise”
Reviews.Author: Jan492
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights as a family of four to celebrate my daughter's 18th birthday. I contacted Shannon Kennedy in advance to tell her about the birthday in the hope that the hotel would make a small gesture on the day. It was our first visit to Key West from the UK so a special trip all round. We found the front desk curt and unfriendly on check-in but we happy with our room. Unfortunately, no recognition of my daughter's 18th so we'll be sure to celebrate future special occasions in hotels other than Westin. It's a shame that they can't make the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lurtle
Reviews.Content: After having issues at the Hyatt down the street we decided to move to the Westin for the remainder of our trip. Very glad we did! The location is great - next to Mallory Square and right on the pier where we took the Fury excurions for parasailing and jet skiing. I wouldn't splurge for an oceanfront view since you'll likely look at a cruise ship. We had a room that looked out on the pool, and were high enough to even see the water so we had a partial view at a standard room rate. The ladies working the concierge desk were awesome! They gave great advice on activities and restaurants. The room itself was nice...no complaints. The only issue I have is that before switching hotels I walked into the Westin to discuss what they had available and the women I talked to was a little cold and suggested I go online to book. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort, can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Boggybill
Reviews.Content: My room faced the pool and gardens which provided a very nice view. It was an older room but very clean. Was within walking distance of Duval St, restaurants and bars. The staff was very professional and courtious. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's Our Home Away from Home !”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGalOakPark
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort many times and it just never fails to deliver the best! This hotel has a wonderful location - We park our car and never see it again till we check out. The rooms are spacious and very clean. Ask for a pool view room - it is never noisy at night. The Sunset Celebration is right outside the back door of the hotel and it makes for a relaxing evening just having a drink and enjoying the sunset and the entertainment. Harry Truman's Little White House is right next door and so worth a visit. The restaurant serves a great breakfast although it is a big pricey, but you're at a resort so it is not suprising - and again it is a great breakfast. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - It is the best in the Keys!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: FloridainWinter
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to the Oceanfront room and when we woke up and pulled back the curtains the cruise ships were right there - the hotel was nice, even though there was a dog in the room next to us ( they are pet friendly ) we didn't notice anything until we heard a bark. It was close to everything that we wanted to see and walked everywhere we went. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Massive Room, Great Location, Delicious Breakfast...Terrible Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Publius28
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to Key West a couple of weeks ago to attend a friendâ€™s wedding and had a wonderful stay at the Westin Key West Resort & Marina. Our junior suite was room aplenty, there were the amenities expected of a Westin resort, the breakfast was tasty and the location was the best in the island in my humble opinion (also, the wedding took place at the Ocean Key Resort). Service-wiseâ€¦well it was as good as you can expect from a US hotel. Positives: - Massive room - Excellent view of marina and sunset - Direct access to parking lot from hotel building - Delicious breakfast - Convenient location to island sights and shopping Negatives: - Sloppy housekeeping - Clueless front desk staff For a more detailed review + pictures, please visit www.playingforpici.com

Reviews.Title: “The "oceanview" room was really a view of a Cruise Ship”
Reviews.Author: ranndella
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to stay at the Westin for our anniversary and noted that in the comments section of our reservation. When we checked in we were told our room wasn't ready but they were upgrading us to a suite because it was our anniversary. So we went around Key West and came back, got into our "upgraded" suite only to find out that they had changed our oceanview regular room to only a PARTIAL view suite. The 'non-smoking" room also smelled like cigars. We called down to the front desk immediately to complain and they sent the housekeeping manager up and he said that they had just painted the room and that's what the smell was and that if we left for awhile he could put an ozone machine in. Who wants to leave their room when they just got there? And they probably painted it because someone was smoking. Anyway, they offered to move us to either a first floor oceanview regular room with King Bed, or second floor 2 queens. We chose the 2 queens and got there and the room was already occupied! The first floor room was ground level with no fence or anything, people were walking within inches of our porch, so we decided to stay in our original suite and we had to lean over the railing to to be able to see the sunset. Not to mention until 6pm there was a cruise ship blocking our "oceanview" and then again in the morning another cruise ship was blocking the view. The housekeeping manager said he'd have champagne sent for us to celebrate and as an apology thing, but we never got the champagne. We ordered mimosas the next morning and they actually charged us for it! The room was nice,clean, etc, but we definitely weren't expecting the room we got. It was nice of them to upgrade us to the suite but the view was more important to me than the room...especially for just 2 people!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: Mjminnie
Reviews.Content: There were many things that needed to be repaired in our room, and the hotel needs an update.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: vailworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Starwood Preferred members and try to stay at one of its properties when available. We reserved an oceanfront room for a full week and are entitled to an upgrade if it's available at the time of check in. First, there was no bellman available. Second, there was only one person at the check-in desk to help the more than 10 guests who had arrived on the same plane (there are only a handful of planes that arrive into Key West each day, so scheduling help during those times is easily calculated). She was frazzled to begin with but even more so when I asked about our entitled upgrade. She determined that we were a "problem" because we were staying "so long." I must be mistaken when I thought that hotels actually wanted long-term guests, especially at a resort destination such as Key West. She pointed us in the general direction of our room, located in an adjacent building, and again, was offered no help with our luggage. I should point out that while this seems a bit picky, the front desk help was dressed in a casual shirt and pants. I expect to see that at the Comfort Inn, but at the Westin, I expect something more professional, even in a resort town such as Key West. Our room was tiny and located on the first floor, with the busy pier directly in front of us. We would have been unable to open our sliding doors or draperies during any time of the day or night. Again, not the best room for someone staying for an entire week. We immediately expressed our displeasure and were told that there was nothing they could do, and to "go ahead and call corporate, if that's what we wanted to do." We did so and soon after heard from the General Manager, who did have several options after all that were all more suitable. All the rooms we saw needed updating. Early in the week, the concierge made reservations for us to dine at Latitudes, the Westin's fine dining restaurant, located on Sunset Key. I assumed the concierge had handled everything, including obtaining a lovely table on the beach near the water. But noooo. We were seated inside. Of course, we were the only ones inside, and again, the hostess could do nothing to change our seating "at this late date". "Had we expressed our interest in sitting at a lovely oceanside table, we would have had to have done that at the time of booking. My point is this. The ambiance and the service are poor at best. The only thing this Westin has going for it, is the location on the pier and near Duval Street. Key West itself is great!! Fun, diverse, lots to do, or little to do, depending on your mood. I recommend looking into Casa Marina, a Waldorf Astoria hotel, or the Inn at key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: JDIvoire
Reviews.Content: Typical Us style resort, nothing more and nothing less you would expect from a Westin property in the Us. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with separate sitting area and a kitchenette. We had a balcony and ocean view. You have to stock your minibar as they dont supply drinks but that s no issue as the shop is located just at the main entrance by the lifts. Check in was quick and luggage was delivered to ou room within minutes. Room was clean, common areas would deserve a bit more of cleaning but overall it was fine. Toiletries were replaced daily. Staff was courteous and efficient. Wifi is free in your room. The pool is small and water looks dirty. Having said that in the two hours I spent there I was the only one who showered before taking a swim, so you cant blame the hotel, but the Â uncivilized guests and their sun tan lotions. Clean towels were there but I did not see pool attendants asking you if you needed a drink. I would not stay in one of the rooms overlooking the pool, it looks like they lack of privacy and forget a nap in the afternoon with the kids playing around. The best feature of the hotel is its location. It s perfectly located two minutes from Duval St the centre of all the action but not in the middle of the chaos. So you can party hard but when you are back in the room you can have a decent sleep. All things considered I definitely think it s the place to stay in Key West and I would return here.

Reviews.Title: “like being on a cruise ship”
Reviews.Author: JCFFB
Reviews.Content: I am a big Westin/Strawood fan. i am not a fan of this property. Its loud, crowded, service is slow. The location right by the cruise ship docks is a train wreck. It is just not a nice, peaceful property. Now, if you take the ferry over to Sunset Key then you are in Heaven. The island portion of the resort is absolutely wonderful. If you can, stay over there. Staying at the main hotel is no different than being on the lido deck, on spring break, during a limbo contest.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Hildepav
Reviews.Content: I was actually quite surprised how much I did not like this hotel. I usually love Westins, but this was a disappointment. My husband and I came here for our honeymoon. We had requested a room with a balcony, but upon check in, was told that there were only first floor rooms or rooms with a balcony in a construction area. We ended up choosing the construction area since we wouldn't be in the room too much during the day. We booked a couples massage for one afternoon and on the day of our massage, no one showed up! I guess the Concierge forgot to actually book it with the masseuse. We were upset b/c we could have booked a water trip, cruise, etc during that time. After we were told sorry, but that was it, I decided that this was not good enough. This was our honeymoon! We asked that they reserve an area for us on the Sunset Deck to watch the sunset...which they did, and it was very nice. The only good thing about this hotel is the location and the name. I have found that the Inns and Cottages within Key West are much MUCH better and much more affordable. Don't waste your money here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - amazing views at sunset”
Reviews.Author: Nick_TNNC
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous to stay here for the price I'd been quoted, based on the some of the traveler reviews I'd read, but the hotel was fantastic. The rooms were nice and clean, the views we had of the water and sunsets were great, and the location could not have been any better. The hotel is right next to Mallory Square and 2 short blocks from Duval Street, so you're incredibly close to all of the shops, restaurants and bars. The restaurant by the pool had great food that was reasonably priced (for a hotel and compared to the surrounding restaurants), and my only complaint about the hotel would be that the pool water was too warm and wasn't at all refreshing during the heat of the day, but my guess is other hotels would have the same issue. This was my first time in Key West, and the next time I go back, I'll definitely be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. No so perfect accommodations, rude bartenders, and dirty pool area...."”
Reviews.Author: Lisangirls
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect location. People at the front desk very nice and accommodating. Had an Oceanview room, which gave you a piece of a view of the ocean. Most disappointed that you couldn't really enjoy the porch overlooking the water because the a/c vent was in that window and hot air blew out at you while you sat the bench... (and why is a hotel like this have one of those window type a/c units anyway???) Took all day for the room to cool down from the one little wall unit. No shampoo in the shower. And no "extra" toiletries. The POOL area was disgusting! Towels littered all around, with plastic cups and cigarette trays just laying about. No clean towels. The RUDEST bartenders ever. And a luke warm hot tub.. We usually try to stay at the Ocean Key Resort (just one hotel up from this Westin) but couldn't get a room there this weekend, but I will make sure that next time I book far enough in advance and get in at the Ocean key instead of this hotel. For the money (My room was over $400 a night, too!), it is not worth it. Reminded me of a Red Roof Inn. But i did enjoy the view of the sunset, and the restaurant was excellent. Had a great dinner!

Reviews.Title: “A fun 24-hour visit with canine companion”
Reviews.Author: CatskillMountainMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night, using Starwood Preferred Guest reward points for the stay. As a Gold member, I asked for a late checkout of 4 p.m. but was only granted until 2 p.m. which worked out fine anyway. We had a very large, upgraded "junior-suite" type room on the top floor with a view of the cruise ships docked. Room was very pleasant, perhaps a bit under-decorated for such a cavernous space. Hotel was very welcoming to us and our dog. Enjoyed walking around the hotel area with the dog into the lovely historic residential area just adjacent. Ate breakfast and lunch at the hotel restaurant outside with dog alongside the dock. Food quality, service and price impressed me--very good meals, decent price for Key West and in a hotel. I think Sheraton's (another Starwood brand) motto is something like "You belong" but I would say that after only a day at the Westin, we felt like we belonged there and were very comfortable and at-home feeling. It was a refreshing change from the Palm Beach area. Would have loved to have stayed an extra night or two, so we will likely return next winter and won't hesitate considering the Westin again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Key West is GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: Dancun
Reviews.Content: We have actually stayed at this hotel a number of times and it is the BEST in Key West.....Not only is it IDEALLY located next to Duval street, there is a great restuarant (Bistro 254), a nice pool and hot tub with a great bar. Also, you are next to Mallory Square where you can take in the MOST AWESOME sunset you will probably ever see...I will post pics as well. There are many shops around the hotel as well as access to all watersports....the concierge is the best, be sure to drop by the desk and ask the ladies where to dine as they have many coupons for things like yes...drum roll please....a complimentary bottle of wine at the Grand restuarant on Duval. The only thing I will say that could be improved is the fitness centre...its a bit sparse with regards to weights,....all of their treadmills and elliptical (5 of them I think) are in good working order, but there is one workout bench and 1 set of free weights in the weightroom section. Other than that, I think this is the best place to be in Key West...OH, and one other thing....after a nite of HEAVY partying, (if thats your thing), there is no worry abt having to drive home, or take a cab, or catch a hotel shuttle....you can just walk to your room.....AWESOME!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Key West Resort, Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover0729
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location is always important, and you can't beat the Westin for being on the waterfront and within a short walk to Duval Street. And the staff is terrific! Jane Brannigan at the Concierge desk helped me fine the right restaurants for my clients, and the pool bar staff was a lot of fun. I would recommend this resort to anyone going to Key West for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SCGirl14
Reviews.Content: This location is perfect for watersports and walking to most sights in the historical section of Key West. The rooms aren't necessarily up to the same standards of other Westins that I've stayed in, but the location definitely made up for that. As other travelers have pointed out, at times the view is blocked by cruise ships, but they don't stay overnight. And also don't dock on weekends. So, for us the view was just fine in the ocean front rooms. We found maid service to be a bit inconsistent, but adequate. Also, most everyone we encountered working there was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: michaelstrunk
Reviews.Content: We have booked a Ocean front view, which is exactly what you get. A corner room (101) just where all people walks, only separated by a rail. Every morning at around 7am a large cruiseship arrived and not only blocked the view, but with a couple of thousand passengers looking down and afterwards walking buy, you really feeld like an animal in a cage. It was in our three weeks trip far the smallest room with a tiny bathroom. The bathroom was almost so small, that you had to stand up in the tub, to close the bathroomdoor! None evening service, no water, no chocolate - nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Tootsie37
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Beautiful huge room. we used starwood points and was up graded to a two bedroom suite. The location was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip for my daughter's 10th birthday”
Reviews.Author: jasonmendelsohn
Reviews.Content: Jane Bannigan (Concierge), Dianna Bailey (Front Desk) - were terrific, they both took the time to make our trip special. Jane was extremely helpful both prior to our arrival and throughout our trip. Her entire team, including Becky and others truly gave us great advice and suggestions. Jane was the best concierge I have ever had the pleasure to work with over many years of travel. She helped treat my daughter like a queen for her 10th birthday. The birthday card and extras sent to our room had my daughter smiling continuously. Dianna gave us a happy warm greeting at checkin and had wonderful suggestions of restaurants and activities which we enjoyed each day. I also need to commend Fury tours for the best excursions of many years of travel - The jet ski tour was exhilerating - all 28 miles of it. We also enjoyed the Ultimate Adventure & the Commotion on the Ocean. Great trip. We'll be back. Hopefully this starts a tradition.

Reviews.Title: “Run the other way!”
Reviews.Author: Bguthrie561
Reviews.Content: My first impression was the valet telling me I couldn't use his cart for my luggage. This was because he wanted to do to himself so I'd tip him. He actually had the nerve to say that! I paid $430 a night for an "oceanview" room only to have the view of a cruise ship. Also, I didn't sleep at all because my back window area was the host to a live band that paid into the wee hours o the night. You can't even order movies from this hotel. Talk about outdated technology. Also, the water pressure is very weak. It took 30 minutes for me to get the shampoo out of my hair. The staff is so incredibly rude. Any time you ask them a question, the act like thy are doing you a huge favor. Stay at Pier House or the Marriot. Half the price and none of the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place for a Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: kgierisch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding at the Key West Westin on May 13 of this year. YAY!! The entire experience working with Erin and the Westin Staff was fantastic! The lay out on the pier overlooking the ocean and the sun set was stellar and the food was delicious! Our friends and family could not stop talking about how great the location and the food was the entire night and that next day and I recently heard form my mother some people are STILL talking about it. The staff at the wedding were amazing and on top of their game all night long. The entire night went off w/out a hitch and was a fabulous wedding we both are so happy we went with the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey and noisey, call ahead to make sure no construction”
Reviews.Author: pchgal
Reviews.Content: A little pricey for this hotel. Room was very simple, describtion says tropical decor but furniture was brown and worn only one picture in room. Construction going on one day from 10:00am to 7:00pm around the pool area, loud and miserable. Not relaxing. Concierge was the only ones who seemed to care that we were not happy, front desk just did not seem to really care. Parking charge was ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and not a relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Delia0725
Reviews.Content: Ocean view room was blocked by a cruise ship and evenings had a wedding two nights in a row 20 feet from our room. A nice hotel and while cruise ships and wedding happen, the price should reflect it. Any time spent relaxing at the pool was disrupted by banging maintenance and loud machinery.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great view!!”
Reviews.Author: AngryBirdMom
Reviews.Content: The view is great. Yes, the cruise ships dock right at the hotel, but it is really cool to watch and they leave by 3 or 6. The location can't be beat. Fun sunset celebration and view right at the hotel and all the shops, museums and restaurants. I have a teen and tween and they were quite pleased and did not complain about walking. The rooms are nice, but it would be nice to have a fridge. It is not worth the $40 to go out to the private island's beach. Instead, go out to Fort Zachery and swim and snorkel. Lots of sea life to view by the rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: lkcare
Reviews.Content: Great view of sunset and pool from room 333. Quiet and close to everything. Cruise ships were only there one day but left before sunset. Staff was quick to respond to our needs, Small lobby but adequate, concierge was in different building but easy walk and on call. Grounds were well maintained and building was well appointed. Pay the $20 to use sunset beach well worth the money for the day, quick boat trip and you have your own private beach. Dine at Lattitudes or be served on the beach. This is a great day. Free internet was a plus for our teenagers. All activities are in walking distance making this a great location. This is the only place to stay and if in Key West again we will return to this hotel. Our room overlooked the pool and Bistro restaurant giving us an ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Bigkahuna1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days and loved evry minute of it. The hotel sitson the pier just south of Mallory Square.
