It is peaceful yet very close to all the action going on at Mallory Square for the Sunset Celebration. The food at the restaurant is exellent, you'll be evry surpirsed at the quality of the food. Their Sunday bruch has been voted "The Best In Key West" and many locals come here for the Westin's Sunday Brunch. The rooms are spacious, but the housekeeping lacks some attention to detail. The pool area was very quite and peacefu, but it lacked food & beverage servie. If you wish to get something to eat or drink you must go to the pool bar and order it. All and all the employee go out of their way to make sure you have an enjoyable experience. I would recommend this hotel and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great trip and definitely plan on returning!”
Reviews.Author: kcasey6
Reviews.Content: The Westin Resort Key West is clean and the staff is friendly. The pool was the perfect place to relax in the sun with music and waiters coming around to take drink orders regularly. The space is nice and although right in the heart Mallory Square, it is off to the side so its not overwhelmingly crowded and has a great view. We read things about the cruise ships and their obstruction, but didn't find it too bad as they were really only there for a few hours and only 2 of the 5 days we were there. The Westin restaurant, Latitudes, on its own private island was a great experience- we spent my boyfriends' birthday dinner there, and highly recommend it for the romantic ambiance. Overall, our stay was great and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Steve34292
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel; great rooms; great beds; we had breakfast overlooking the water; in the center of everything. Street performers from 6 pm until ?? in the promenade in front of the hotel; great place to see the sunset

Reviews.Title: “Great girl's getaway”
Reviews.Author: LorikAtlanta
Reviews.Content: For anyone looking for a laid back, fun place to vacation Key West is a great place to go. The airport is only a 15 minutes cab ride to the downtown area and that is the only time we were ever in a car. The Westin is one of the largest hotels in the area with a fantastic location. Since there were 4 of us traveling together, we opted for a one bedroom suite. The room was nice with two queen beds and a living room area with a pull out couch, small refrigerator, overlooking the pool area. We had a few meals and snacks from their restaurant and the food was just okay. But there are so many options within walking distance it wasn't a problem to go off property. The pool and deck bar was great place to gather before heading out for the night. The bartenders were friendly and offered us great suggestions for places to eat and hang out. Biggest Con: small pool Biggest Pro: Location. If you are looking to party you will want to be downtown. The Duval Crawl is a real thing.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place if you can!”
Reviews.Author: scoobytrips
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice because of business meetings there. It gets worse every year. For the high prices they charge, it's totally unacceptable. I arrived after the restaurant closed and ordered a salad for room service. It was clearly just a bag of brown wilted lettuce from the grocery store dumped on a plate with 2 crummy grocery store tomatoes on side and they wanted $12.00 or so for it- give me a break! I sent it back and got a refund. No others to be had. Since I have a food allergy I could not try a sandwich but it would probably have been just as bad. When I complained about the awful food at such an expensive hotel it was clear the staff didn't care. I even spoke with the night manager and she just said in a bored voice, "we'll refund your $." There was no offer to get me anything to eat so it was lucky I had some protein bars with me. Ugh! My room reservation was messed up so I got put in a suite at no extra cost as that was the only extra room they had. I thought this was going to be great, but It looked like something in a Holiday Inn. It was 2 huge rooms with nothing but 2 big beds, a chest in each room, nothing on the walls and a crummy couch and table in the sitting room. Only good thing was nice shampoos and Starbucks coffee. Since I couldn't get any food, I drank all the coffee! Also, even in the suite, there were 2 lights that didn't work and the blinds were broken on 2 windows. The only good thing was the bed was pretty comfortable and the room was clean, but that was it. Can we say this place is an expensive dump? I can't imagine why people go to this hotel, truly. Next year I'm staying at the Marriott across the street if I have to pay for it myself. This place is a mystery to me since I have stayed at other Westins in other states that were very nice. I don't get it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, great views.”
Reviews.Author: jamiholms
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay when doing the downtown thing. Sunset access can't be beat. The bar outside in convenient. The pool is very clean. Our room was small but the view was incredible. The Westin is great for doing the Duval Crawl. Park your car when you arrive and just walk the whole time. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to the Westin name”
Reviews.Author: RobyBolt
Reviews.Content: I feel a bit guilty complaining about the hotel because we stayed here using Starwood Points, so it was basically free. But when you book a Westin, you expect a certain standard of room and service and this didn't meet expectations. The location is great and the pool and gym are perfect (although they're small and could easily get over crowded in peak season). It was nice to have a suite and the couch was crazy comfortable but the bed was not at all Heavenly and probably more on par with one you'd find at a Holiday Inn. The bathroom was small and when we checked in it was still dirty (looked like there were boogers in the tub, gross!) The biggest problem was the housekeeping staff. They never changed our linens, even when requested, and refilled only the toiletries that we didn't use. Why they felt we needed 7 bars of soap but could get by without shampoo, conditioner, and body gel, I will never understand. I'd stay here again. If I could do it on points. But if I had to pay, I'd definitely consider other options

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dschlotterer
Reviews.Content: We really wanted the beach experience, but didn't want to sacrafice location... the Westin is the perfect balance of both. It's located right next to Mallory Square on the pier... just one block off Duval. But, what I loved the most, was the option to get a beach pass from the concierge to travel over to Sunset Key to spend the day on the beach over there at the sister property. It was very secluded and lovely over there as well... we got to enjoy all the amenities of that property for the day without the higher price tag that staying at Sunset Key brings. Then, when it came time for going out for dinner or drinks, we found ourselves back at our perfect location on the pier at the Westin to watch the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Overall acceptable”
Reviews.Author: julieh202
Reviews.Content: We were in room 206 from May 22 to 27 for management reference. I checked the reviews here before my trip and found the experience to be very accurately reflected. The location was really wonderful for walking about and experiencing Key West including restaurants, Mallory Square sunset and street performers, Duval Street and Marina shops. The marina area was very quiet at night and good for sleeping. Upon check-in we were upgraded to an oceanview room. There were cruise ships almost wholly covering our oceanview 2 of the 5 days we were there. They did leave by the evening and we had a lovely view of the marina and ocean from our balcony every evening/night. I suggest that if this concerns you, you should check the cruise ship schedule. I found it to be only a mild inconvenience, but my have been more upset, if I had missed the view say 4 of 5 days. Or planned on spending lots of daytime/mornings out on the balcony :) We checked in on Sunday, May 22 and were checked in by an extremely pleasant trainee front desk clerk and trainer. Our check-in experience was great. The 'trainer' walked us out the lobby door to direct us to our rooms, held doors, etc. The check-in process met or exceeded my expectations. We did check around a few nearby lots to see if we could find a more reasonable parking rate than $20/night, but the best we could find would have been $25 and I'm not sure that would include in/out priveleges. So while the parking rate may sound high, I think this is due to location rather than anything else. Now, as I said the other reviews are true to form, so there were some areas that fell short of my expectations for this hotel. Housekeeping: There were several details missed which I would not expect. One day after our room had been serviced, our dirty wine glasses were not replaced with fresh wine glasses. Another day, we selected that our room be serviced anytime except from 2:30 to 4:30 which it was, but housekeeping still knocked on the door mid-afternoon nap. Thankfully, we had locked the door for privacy. Room servicing did tend to be late in the day unless specifically requested otherwise. The last day we did not get any washcloths at all and had to substitute handtowels in their place. We were also charged nearly $20 for mini-bar purchases although we had not taken anything out of the fridge (this charge was refunded promptly on check-out). One evening in the middle of our stay we decided to take the car out to see the non-touristy part of the island. We went to get out of the garage and our key would not work in the garage. We tried both keys and both gates (meaning, we had to have several people back up behind us twice). I went to the front desk and explained the problem as politely as I could without totally hiding the minor frustration of having everyone back-up. I would have expected a minimum comment of 'Sorry, for the inconvenience.' But friendliness did not seem to be on her agenda. She simply mumbled that it must have become uncoded somehow and handed me some fresh keys which worked without issue. In fairness there were two other pairs of guests that she had also been assisting just prior to me and I do not know what issues she may have been assisting them with. But I expect the desk clerk at a nice resort to maintain a level of friendliness even when multi-tasking. When we checked-out the same desk clerk (trainer) that had been there on day one was in the lobby and opened the door for us again. A different desk clerk checked us out (removing the erroneous minibar charge). The check-out experience was generally good and went smoothly. For the right price (note not their standard charges), I would consider staying here again. The location was excellent, the view was good but the service was hit or miss. I would probably check out the other offerings in the area before rebooking.

Reviews.Title: “Some Unpleasant Surprises Here”
Reviews.Author: lotsasalsa
Reviews.Content: My husband and 3 family members booked rooms at Westin at my suggestion. I assumed the Westin standard would be evident and enjoyed. Not so much. (1) The lobby to our building was stuffy/uncomfortable during several 90 degree days, as if the air conditioning was set for a high temp or not on at all. Guest rooms were fine, but the lobby was miserable. And there was no water for guests in the lobby. (2) The front desk staff was, on five occasions I can recall personally, stand-offish, difficult, arrogant, just unhelpful and unfriendly.Just one example: I asked the desk clerk if I could leave my outgoing postcard for mailing. She replied 'if you are a guest here and it has postage' (!!!). (3) The pool looks much better on the web and in photos than in person. It's on the smaller side and lounge chairs are crowded about it. Bar service by the pool was great. Water in a large not so pretty thermos dispenser was available one day but not on two others. (4) Self-parking at the garage for guests is $20/day. Ouch. (5) There is no hotel shuttle to the airport, not even for a fee. To the plus side, the location is great for walking the town and historic district. We enjoyed lunch at the hotel's indoor air conditioned restaurant and libations on the outdoor deck watching sunset celebration. The highlight of our stay was the $20 per person daytrip by boat to Sunset Key, Westin's island with rental cottages 10 minutes away by water. Lovely meal there at Latitudes restaurant and nice beach... although the concierge neglected to tell us we needed water shoes to be able to walk into the water, the sand floor is covered with pebbles that hurt. Also, no cold water available to guests in the oceanside beach hut.

Reviews.Title: “The room with a view might be a Cruise Ship”
Reviews.Author: DandMRidgefield_CT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location near Mallory Square where you can see the sunsets at night. However, check in is in a very different place than the concierge which is tucked behind their gift shop. The room was a nice size and we had an ocean view. However, they should warn you that cruise ships anchor right outside most mornings. So when we got up and my husband opened the curtains he said "Wow a building just moved in!" It was bizarre. The cruise ship is huge and it does look like there is a building in front of you. So forget the view. Also, they have amenities at a little island where they have a shuttle. Well, make sure you reserve that way in advance. It gets sold out and you cannot just go over to the island for the day without paying a fortune to get there. Needless to say, we did not get a chance to do that.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep, it won't happen!”
Reviews.Author: Stachu
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the check in process, my wife was treated harshly, actually at check in my wife commented "what "b" and it rhymes with witch. 2am, alarm goes off, evacuated building. 7am, sunrise and the mini blinds allows sun in the room, the curtains do not pull all the wY across to prevent light in the room. Air conditioner turns off and on frequently and is excessively noisy. Not to Westin level that we have had at other properties. It is the location that gets them the bookings, just shouldn't put the Westin name on the property. I consider the name is synonymous with quality, which this isn't. Location is great, but there are much better here as ww are frequent travelers to key west

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dexbet
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Westin very much. All the staff were friendly and very helpful. We had a wonderful room. We received an upgrade because it was our anniversary and and had champagne and chocolate covered strawberries awaiting our return from dinner our first night there. All nice touches! If we ever go back to Key West we will be sure to stay there and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive with below-average service - but still worth considering due to location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTerp
Reviews.Content: There are many great aspects to this hotel - excellent location right downtown/walking distance to everything, the Sunset Key beach/service is great, we found the concierges to be consistently excellent, and we were upgraded after our first night (due to issues with first room). That said, there were a number of small issues that together added up to put a damper on our stay, and give me the impression that this hotel has room for improvement in the level of service it provides its guests, e.g., old/smelly food left in minibar when we first checked into our room, large bug found in room one night, poor maintenance (e.g., toilet paper holder fell off of wall, one of air conditioner controls broken, sink stopper broken, light on mirror burnt out, refrigerator delivered to room was broken, gym water dispenser empty), some employees friendlier than others. Also - parking is an extra $20+/night, a trip to the Sunset Key private beach is $20/person/day + you have to get up at 8 AM to get the tickets (first come, first served each day), and standard check-out time is 11 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service and rundown property- Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: mzilby
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel April 21-23, and it couldn't be a worse experience. Here are the downfalls of my trip. 1) It took over 2 hours to get my luggage. No apologies from the staff. 2) It took over 2 hours to get the 2 cribs needed for my twins. Again, no apologies. 3) The spout in the shower/tub fell off. The engineer put on a new one, stating it wasn't high quality. It was put on incorrectly, and was leaking water. Nobody fixed it for the 2 days we were there. 4) The air conditioner was nonfunctional for the first 8 hours. They "fixed it", even though it leaked on the balcony terribly. They also informed me the room wouldn't get colder than 73 degrees because the hotel is "green". I have never stayed in a hotel where it wouldn't get below 73 degrees. It was very uncomfortable. 5) I notified 2 managers, and was treated terribly. Kristen was very rude, telling me that I would be issued 6000 points, and that she wouldn't apologize for anything because I was upset, and I would "probably interrupt her". Come on! Is this how a Westin is run? Deborah, the other manager, was apologetic, but did nothing to fix the problems. I asked to speak to the operations manager, and am still waiting for a call. I guess I won't hold my breath. Bottom line- beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not a Westin feel or service.”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Traval
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic right next to Duval Street and Mallory Square. Lots to do around the hotel, and because it is in such a historic part of Key West, there are probably many limitations on what can and can't be done to the hotel. We only stayed one night. Here are a few things to consider: 1) It is only 3-4 floors, and depending on what type of room you have (we had an ocean view next to the marina), it could be very noisy at night. There is another Westin building nearby, and if you stay there and your room overlooks the pool, you could have the same issue. 2) The lobby is small and unimpressive with only two check in stations, it is always appeared to be full, and the concierge was in a different building. Weird. 3) The AC and windows were terrible. The AC was quite old and loud and kept kicking on throughout the night. The drapes could only be closed half way, and the other half had plantation blinds. What this meant is that when the sun came up, light would come through even when the blinds were closed....no sleeping in. 4) The hallways and cleaning had a lot to be desired. As we'd walk to our rooms on both days, bags of either clean or dirty linens could be seen in the hallway or jamming the door...without a maid's cart next to it. They looked like they were simply abandoned. 5) When I requested a late check out the night before, I was told I had to call back the next day because they day shift decided. When I called back the next morning, I did receive one after explaining I was a gold member. This is the first time I experienced not being able to request late check outs in advance. I have stayed at many properties and have been able to place requests as early as one week. While Westin may be doing the more "efficient" and "practical" thing, it didn't feel good from a customer perspective. All in all, I would go back to Key West but not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: WORLDTRAVELER239
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It is 2 blocks off Duval Street and near a lot of attractions. It is also the best location for watching the sunset. Pool was nice and secluded with a bar. The rooms were nice but service sucked. The person cleaning our room left fresh towels and that was it...she forgot importatant things like soap and toilet paper.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean view room.?.?”
Reviews.Author: Dandoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights last week. The first couple of nights were great. Then it got later in the week and the weddings and cruise ships started to come. The cruise ships were leaving by 3 everyday before, but now they stayed all night, this was the problem, we had a great room over looking Mallory Square, great view to watch the sunset. But that was fixed toward the end of the week. So along with the cruise ships there were wedding receptions out there as well. Not just 1 but 3, a different one every night. These started around 5 and went until 11, The music wasn't that big of a issue, they did a pretty good job sound proofing the rooms. But they also don't tell you that the pool is open to ALL of these people. So it was great to try and find 2 chairs to lay in. By the way these Ocean view rooms are about $100 more a night then the other room. They also have a sunset deck, but good luck getting up there to watch the sunset, this can be rented out to private parties as well. As was the case. But that didn't matter because of the cruise ships. This place looks really nice but there are better places to stay, we are going to do that next time. Good thing it was only $1600!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprise”
Reviews.Author: MoePatC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked our room for three nights at the Westin Key West through Trip Advisor book.it ...Upon check in, we were offered an upgrade to the sister property Sunset key...a one bedroom cottage just a few minutes away by ferry. I had read all about this beautiful property when doing my research and although it was very appealing but the price was just not in the budget. We accepted the offer and proceeded to the island. Just beautiful...very quiet and lush property with a restaurant, beach, pool w/bar, and spa. The ferry which connected to the mainland ran on the half hour so we went back and forth without any problem. We stayed in a 1 bedroom cottage w/lvg rm, kitchenette/dining rm, 2 bath, huge king size bedroom...and wrap around porch with rockers. Stereo, high def tv, breakfast pastries and fruit delivered to porch every morning...juice and chocolate every night. All of the hotel staff were friendly and helpful...the ferry always there waiting when we needed it. What a very memorable and relaxing vacation ! Thank you Westin !!!

Reviews.Title: “I will dream of going back!”
Reviews.Author: antgina
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of the taxi at the Westin, we began a perfect vacation in the Keys! We were checked in by Taillon (spelling?), who was friendly, personable and so welcoming! We arrived before check in and he found us a room we could get into without having to wait until 3pm. He also upgraded us when he found out we were celebrating our 20th anniversary! Our room was clean, bright, modern & beautiful! Overlooked the marina. We could view sunset right from our balcony. Yes, the cruise ships during the day blocked the view of the Gulf, but we weren't in our room during the day so it really wasn't that big of a deal. And they deported by 4pm each afternoon. The location of this hotel was the best perk! Do not rent a car if you are staying here! It's right off Duval & Front street so there is no need. You will do a lot of walking but that's okay! You can rent bikes & motor cars. The pool isn't large but it was nice and private. The bartender at the pool bar was okay. The one thing the pool area needed was some nice music playing. It was too quiet. One of the guests brought down their ipod speakers one afternoon and that was a nice addition to the atmosphere. There is no lack of dining or entertainment in Key West and you're in walking distance to everything. Rooms were cleaned everyday at a nice time and all the staff we came in contact with were really nice. I would highly recommend taking the boat ride over to Sunset Key, the Westins private island/beach. It is $20 per person but it is amazing! You feel like you're in the Carribean! Latitudes restaurant serves an amazing lunch, you have your chairs, towels, huts all set up for you on the beach. That was a great day! I would absolutely recommend this hotel. Pricey but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you don't have to cancle your reservations!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmacboat
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms, wanted ocean view. Told them we wanted adjoining rooms and a view that we didn't have to crane are neck to see the ocean. No problem!! Booked the rooms. Checked the reservations, said Partial Ocean view, no mention of adjoining rooms. Called back, very upset. Changed reservations to Ocean Front then were informed only adjoining rooms were pool area. When were they going to tell us about this, when we got there? Just realy didn't sit well with us and cancled the rooms all together 1 hour later. This was almost 2 months before check in date, which would have been March 25. Still on our Discover card. Took 1 room off our charge card but won't take the other charge off. Had to pay 1 night in advance for each room to hold the reservation. Now I am still being charged 530$ for a room I never stayed in. Both rooms were cancled on the same day at the same time. I am not the only one who had this problem. Have read this same problem whith this Westin here before. Be VERY Careful. Not satisfied at all with how this was handled at all!! Thanks BROOK

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and needs work”
Reviews.Author: Didmaster
Reviews.Content: If I'm paying $400+ for a room, I don't think the place should look or smell like a spring break party room. Even if spring breakers party there, the hotel should make a concerted effort to properly clean and fix the rooms to mask the history of previous guests. The first room they gave us smelled bad, the carpet was not vacuumed (clothing tags on floor), a pillow was dirty, and the patio door lock was broken. After complaining, they relocated us, but I could tell they sprayed a strong air freshener in the new room to mask the smell. The new room was better, but there were a lot of scuffs on the walls, the partial view I paid extra for was of the nose of a cruise ship, the tv had a lot of fuzzy channels, and the bathroom light fixture was pretty crooked. Not a well polished hotel, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!!”
Reviews.Author: mike_p_3110
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and must say it was great. Room was clean, staff great, but best of all is the location. Sunset was something else. Would recommend this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced .... save your money!”
Reviews.Author: sweetrain3
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, but after that, things go downhill in a hurry. We would NEVER stay here again. Terrible (almost non-existent) service for $450/night! Room was missing a lamp but no replacement could be found. We had to ask daily for toilet paper, toiletries, washcloths, etc. The numbers were worn off our remote, the duvet had stains on the underside, the pool cushions are filty, the hallways are dusty. The business center (i.e. two computers) was outdated - we couldn't even print out boarding passes because the browser was too old and we couldn't sign on to the airline website. Our departure morning wake up call never came.... the list goes on and on. The front desk staff is pleasant, but it seems their main job is issuing comps for food, parking, etc. because of the ineptitude of their co-workers. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Centrally located Clean Hotel with wonderful Sunset views from Deck”
Reviews.Author: Hayden40
Reviews.Content: Stayedfor 4 nights at the Westin Marina Key West. had a great roomwith nice balcony and great bathroom. Loved the huge shower,but missed having a bath. Nice HD Television and friendly staff. The location was nearthe Fisher Mueum, the Cruise ship harbor and Duval street. Had a great time walking,shopping and eating. The only downside was the valet service. When we arrived they just ignored us and did not say a word. Finally I asked if they were going to park the carfor usas we were checking in. Other than that, mostof the staff was very nice and helpfull. i really recommend doing the Jetski tour of the island. Leaves right from the marina dock and was lots of fun! Alsothe Mel Fisher museum is across the street and amazing for the gold and finds from the Atocha ship.

Reviews.Title: “Don't have a button labelled "service express" if you provide neither, and resent the request”
Reviews.Author: JJWLW
Reviews.Content: Very unpleasant experience with the fellow who answers the "service express" number late at night. Apparently, he's an "auditor" pressed into phone duty, and resents it. Bad attitude, and apparently thinks that a guest who is upset enough to say that he is going to come to the desk in order to speak to a manager deserves to be intimidated by a threat to call the police. Plenty of other decent hotels here. They don't deserve my (or anyone's) business.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this Westin!!”
Reviews.Author: StarwoodGma
Reviews.Content: I strongly disagree with many of the other evaluations here. We just returned yesterday from a two-night stay at the Westin. We really loved everything about it. Of course, the location is perfect, right near everything of any importance in Key West. We loved the Westin on Sunset Key with its Latitudes restaurant. We took the five minute ferry ride to it and had dinner during the most beautiful sunset! Our room at the Key West Resort and Marina was very clean and the bedding was so fluffy and bright white. Our view was of the pool, no upgrade was available for us. We used our Starpoints for the room. The only complaint I could have was the fact that it was Spring Break there, not the fault of anyone. Kids came in at all hours speaking loudly on the way to their rooms. But, we were all kids at one time. Parking is 20 dollars a day for self parking, and 22 for valet. You really don't need to use your car if you are just there to see Key West. Just park it and walk.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...”
Reviews.Author: abc713
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 nights at the Westin. The location can't be beat -- but a lot of other things could be at this property. Luckily we used points for our stay, if I had been paying $400 to $500 a night I would have been very upset. Service is almost non existent, concierge seemed like she'd rather be anywhere else, rooms were just okay.... This hotel is definitely not up to par with other Westins. The bed and shower were not of the typical Westin "heavenly" variety. Pros were the location, the fitness center, the pool and the ability to get a day pass to Sunset Key for $20 and access the beach there which was fantastic -- as was Latitudes the restaurant at Sunset Key. We loved Key West and will definitely go back, but would probably only stay at this property again if we could use points. Would recommend with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Westin only by name... disppointing”
Reviews.Author: soccerg
Reviews.Content: Summary: If you're staying in Key West, choose another hotel. If you're looking for a Starwood property, choose a different one. This hotel appears to be a cheaper resort that was renamed as a Westin. The lobby has a slight hint of the signature white tea scent (mixed with other scents), the bed felt like a heavenly bed, and they had Westin white tea aloe toiletries. Outside of that, the hotel was poorly decorated and didn't resemble a Westin property. The location is convenient to West Duval Street and Mallory Square, which is excellent. If you pay extra for a suite with a view (no, you won't get upgraded for free), the view is fantastic as long as there is not a cruise ship in port. Unfortunately, the noises are awful. The air conditioner is incredibly loud and wakes you up at random intervals during the night. Cruise ships arrive at 7am and wake you up with chimes and announcements. When we initially discussed some of these concerns with the front desk, they seemed to see the situation as a take it or leave it decision. After staying in many Starwood properties, especially Westins, the lack of hospitality was unusual and disappointing. The next time we return to Key West, we will be staying at another property.

Reviews.Title: “Not for experienced travelers”
Reviews.Author: sheinbrot
Reviews.Content: Last minute reservations limited our choice of hotels. On line pictures of the Westin Key West looked fine. Made non refundable reservation for a 750 sq foot suite, overlooking the harbor. Oh boy, here is what we found: Hotel lobby is small, threadbare, ugly, with no seating, as in a small motel off an interstate highway. Suite was large and appeared clean. However it was dark, with small windows, musty smell, and low ceiling. While the deck did face the harbor, the view was blocked by a huge cruise ship, its loudspeakers blazing announcements. I was prepared to eat my losses. Happily, my wife remembered that Sunset Key Resort, on Sunset Key ( 5 minute ferry ride from Key West) was a Westin property. After a bit of back and forth with the manager, we were given a cottage at Sunset Key with no change in cost. What a gift. Probably not possible if my wife had not been as intrepid as she was. Sunset Key is lovely. Unfortunately, the Westin Key West Resort is a bomb.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Stale/Stuffy Room”
Reviews.Author: drb3434
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Key West. Staying at the Westin conjured up images in our heads of lush and grandeur, plush pillows and sunset views as the cool breeze flowed around us. I'm not sure how that got in my head but the reality couldn't have been further away from that. We arrived for our three night stay to our first floor room which was dark, dingy, and poorly spaced out (it was smaller than our expectations to begin with but somehow still managed to waste significant space). My main issue was that the combination of the recycled, recirculated air along with the intense smell of alcoholic cleansers made it legitimately feel like a stale hospital sick ward, certainly less than pleasant to be in, much less sleep in. Being literally on the ground floor poolside, there was no way to open a window in addition to it not feeling very private. Upon asking to be moved to a higher floor, where at least I could perhaps open a window, I was told no other room was available. I'm not usually a complainer, but I just couldn't help but feeling like I was completely taken as I checked out with a runny nose, a sore throat, and a $400/night bill (which somehow is on the low end of what people pay there (or so I was told)). Don't get me wrong, Key West is a fun and lovely city, we had a good time and we did enjoy some beautiful sunsets; however, our room at the hotel did nothing to better our stay there. In summary, if you want to wildly overpay for a stale room that makes you feel like you're in some combination of a motel and a hospital, the Westin is for you. Otherwise, I'm certain there must be better values out there for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: christina106
Reviews.Content: I would not bother with an ocean view room b/c there is a cruise ship nblocking some times. The hotel was clean staff was excellent and it had a great location. I recomend paying the $20 and taking the short boat trip to the beautiful private beach. The sand was nicer at thids beach and it wwas much more peaceful. the $20 includes the boat ride ,the chair rental and the towels. The Hotel was walking distance to duval, there is also a museum and a an aquarium near buy. The hotel has starbucks coffee in the room and my sister and I also requested a fridge so we bought milk and cereal at a nearby cvs and also had cold water for our trip. It saved us bfast money and time we both just wanted to get to the beach and pool : )

Reviews.Title: “Best Mojito in town”
Reviews.Author: lindapenfold171
Reviews.Content: For those who enjoy a cocktail, a trip to Key West is not complete without trying one of Mr. Mojito's (Jimmy) famous cocktails. Mr Mojito makes the best mojito in the State and it is truly a Key West authentic experience! This is my personal 'must-do' when visiting Key West. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the cruise ships!”
Reviews.Author: mjc794
Reviews.Content: On non-cruise ship days, you will love this hotel. I had no complaints whatsoever. But when the cruise ships are docked, the entire view (and the main reason to stay here) is obliterated. In fact, there were three different cruise ships blocking the views today. Obviously, the situation is beyond the hotel's control, but you should know the risk before you book your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: calicocat_4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Westin and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Using our Starwood points, we booked a basic room. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a king deluxe on the third floor. We loved the location of the room, with a view to the left of the ocean and in front of us was a courtyard where we could watch people walking by. The courtyard had beautiful palm trees and vegetation, so the view was very relaxing. I would recommend getting a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor, so you won't have people walking in front of your room. The room was large, with a great balcony, flat screen tv, and a comfy bed. We ate at the Bistro and had a great lunch. I had a grouper sandwich ( I know, a fish sandwich doesn't sound exciting), but it was one of the best sandwiches I've had lately. We also ate breakfast there, and it was good. It's nice eating there because it's part of the hotel and the ocean views were great. I have trouble walking long distances, so it was great to be close to all the action in Key West. While in Key West we rented an electric car for 4 hours, which was great because parking is an issue in the city and it's easy to park and travel down the narrow side roads to look at the pretty houses. I would also definitely recommend Le Creperie, which had the best crepes ever! We went there 3 times. I had a crepe with raspberry dark chocolate filling with fruit and cream. To die for!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION ON THE ISLAND.”
Reviews.Author: jrsmitty
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful hotel, best view around. Cruise ships, Mallory Sq. next door, food & drinks by the water. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Location...”
Reviews.Author: BB8077
Reviews.Content: Not the typical Westin but you're paying for the view not the room. Clean enough, rooms aren't too fancy. $20 to park.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and mostly fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: Lynzieb
Reviews.Content: For the most part, my group of 30+ people had a fabulous experience for our "company offsite." The meetings went without a hitch thank you to Erin in catering and Sandy in banquet services. We had an especially great evening having dinner overlooking the water thanks to Scott, manager at Bistro 345, and our servers Martin & Renata and busser Alex! Food, drinks, service, location...all perfect! Rooms were nice.....but the late afternoon and evening front desk staff needs much improvement. If everything else wasn't so fabulous, it would have put a real damper on our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: manusod
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better. Right next to Mallory Square and the Sunsets. They even have a second story bar that overlooks Mallory Square and the sunsets. Went to Sunset Island for dinner. Was fabulous service, food was good/very good and again, the sunset was amazing. You need to make reservation in the Westin to get the boat over to the island. Bottle of wine, 2 dinners, 2 appetizers ran about $160 including tip. Westin is a moment's walk to Duval Street, so its easy in and easy out. Parking costs $20 self park or $22 valet ($22 gives you in and out privleges and $20 doesnt). Asked the bartender if they have great Mojitos and they said "best in town". BUT, the best are not at the Westin, they are at the Cuban restaurant that is in the middle of Mallory Square. They have inside and outside dining and a bar inside and outside. Their Mojitos are the best I had anywhere in Florida, let alone Key West. If you get it in a glass, you get more than in the plastic cup (hint hint). Good Luck, Have a great and safe time. AND get that Mojito at the Cuban Restaurant / Bar. You will thank me later!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but.....”
Reviews.Author: Ariesunshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights for my wife's birthday, the room was very nice and the location is great (walking distance to everything), but we payed an extra $50 per night for a ocean front room and every morning there was a cruise ship blocking the ocean view, and on our last night a cruise ship blocked the view of our sunset which is the highlight of the day!!! We had a romantic in room diner planned and there was a stinking ship right in front of us. We were not the only people complaining about it, both couples on each side of us all felt the same, like I said nice place but they should let you know before you pay almost $400 a night that a cruise ship is the only thing you can see out your balcony all day :( !!!!!! And by the way on top of $400 a night for the room, an extra $20 to park in there parking garage

Reviews.Title: “Ocean View Rooms”
Reviews.Author: funseekerCT
Reviews.Content: OK hotel in a great location on Mallory Square, but our ocean view room had a cruise ship docked right in front of us 4 days out of five

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: yogicupcake
Reviews.Content: We go to Key West each year and selected the Westin this year for our stay. I had stayed at this hotel years ago when it was a Hilton and remembered liking it a lot. It certainly did not disappoint! The front desk staff graciously let us check in early, as our flight arrived at noon - we had a partial ocean view room on the second floor. We loved our room - it was on the corner of the building with 2 balconies! The people watching was great. Yes, there are cruise ships but not every day, and if one is blocking the view from your room there are plenty of other places for good views. This small island community depends on tourism and the cruise travelers provide revenue for those that live here. The location of this hotel is perfect - we walked everywhere! We had a fantastic stay and can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vivers
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort through hot-wire and then checked reviews on trip advisor which made me aprehensive to say the least but I can honestly say after staying in the resort it was a very enjoyable break and cannot recommend this resort enough and do not be put off by the reviews as I could find nothing to complain about

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: KWWY11
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding booked at the Westin Sunset Key for the end of Jan 2011. Stayed at the Westin Key West for 5 nights, then Sunset Key for 3 nights. Couldn't have asked for anything more. Been to Key West countless times and didn't know what to expect from the Westin and trying to plan a destination wedding. Can't say enough about Erin and Lordes for all the help. Ken did a great job at the ceremony. Stephan and Jose (I think I got their names correct) were the two taking care of everything at the wedding reception were excellent. Made the entire stay effortless and made us feel as though we were the most important ones staying there. As soon as we stepped off the boat at Sunset Key, everyone we met congratulated us and offered to help in any way. Great staff made for a perfect wedding. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “The service is Westin perfection”
Reviews.Author: goobergus
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fantastic trip to Key West and stayed at the Westin Key West Resort and Marina. Once again, Westin service and amenities did not disappoint. We had booked our stay at a really reasonable rate for a King poolside view and were given an OK but not great room on the first floor for the first night. To our delight, the hotel was able to upgrade us at no extra charge after the first night to a fantastic small suite ocean view King on the top floor of the hotel. The Westin staff made the move so easy in moving all of our luggage and checking on us later to make sure we loved the room. The only drawback is that the cruise ships move in for the day so part of the view is blocked.. but they are gone well before sunset and not there every day. The concierge staff were top shelf and every recommendation they had for us scored big points. Their jet ski tour recommendation was a smashing success. We spent a gorgeous day at the beach of the Westin Key West sister hotel Sunset Key, with beach side service extraordinaire. Last but not least is the sunset bar on the deck of the Westin pool. It overlooks Mallory Square so you can watch the action but stay away from the fray.... a magical spot to watch the sunset and one we frequented often... We loved the hotel and the Key West experience.

Reviews.Title: “As always, a great place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BigKat1616
Reviews.Content: The Westin is pricey, but I think worth the extra $. Very nice accomadations, great beds, helpful staff, nice pool, but most of all fantastic location. You will not need a car, can walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! A 10 !”
Reviews.Author: reemard
Reviews.Content: Ill start off with saying Ive been to Key West at least 10 times. This is by far my favorite.LOCATION!LOCATION! Being next to Mallory Square was awesome.Came down for extended weekend-4 nights and reserved a standard room. We had a poolside, large room with king bed, sitting area, desk , and a large bathroom with a sink and dressing area seperate. VERY clean and smelled wonderful. The beds held up to the "heavenly" Westin advertises. The staff from check in to check out exceeded our expectations and would smile and greet us everywhere. The onsite Bistro was a huge hit-we ate there twice . The Sunday brunch was pricey(35 per person) but included mimosas, prime rib, seafood, thick french toast,etc..The pool was warm and relaxing. The gym was basic-just enough for a decent workout. I was a little nervous after reading some of the recent reviews, but I loved this property. We will be staying here again in the fall , Im 100% sure of that. Id also like to mention that it is very quiet, suprisingly , being nex to pier and Mallory Square.

Reviews.Title: “they need to "green "this place up”
Reviews.Author: annlan
Reviews.Content: Great pool, warm and good for swimming,comfy ,padded chairs,nice large room with good make up mirror,comfy bed(although the scratchy,starched sheets aren't heavenly).I don't care for the location.Too commercial with all the cruiseship people mobbing the area.We were supposed to have a partial sea view but all we could see were ugly ships' sides with intercom and vibrations,yuk!My major beef with this place was when I asked a worker by the pool where I could recycle 3 plastic bottles-he told me to throw them in the trash!Another problem-a worker was at the bar at 2 in the morning hosing the place down and he had the music playing right under our window.

Reviews.Title: “They are ripping us off”
Reviews.Author: mcgdrg
Reviews.Content: We had had booked two rooms at the hotel over the Marin Luther King Day weekend and unforunately had to cancel due to one of the guests havjng a medical issue. While we cancelled well before the one week cancellation period we were still charged the full price for 2 rooms and 3 days. The hotel will not provide a refund even though the corportate office of Westin shows we had cancelled. DO NOT STAY AT THIS WESTIN PROPERTY. They have no understanding of customer service and don't seem to care about their guests or potential guests.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment - This does not live up to the Westin Brand”
Reviews.Author: JL-NYC10
Reviews.Content: I stay in Starwoods properties, primarily Westins, between 150-200 nights per year, and with that large frame of reference I can tell you that the Westin Key West really does not measure up and does represent the Westin brand very well. Primarily, I was most disappointed with the cleaning staff. Our room was not cleaned satisfactorily any night we were there. The beds werenâ€™t made properly, the towels were thrown under the sink, the sink wasnâ€™t cleaned, the toiletries werenâ€™t replaced, etc. I could go on. Secondly, the cleaning staff also left bags of trash and dirty linens in the hallways for long portions of the day. I have never stayed in a Westin and witnessed anything like that. That is what I would expect from a motel, not a Westin. Third, I asked for a late check out and was given one, but then the staff called asking why I hadnâ€™t vacated the room yet â€“ obviously a communication problem by the staff. Finally, although minor, the dÃ©cor and amenities overall are just not in keeping with other Westin properties. One bright spot, however, was the concierge staff. They were very helpful and extremely courteous. Also it was pretty centrally located if that is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Accommodation....Absurdly Rude...”
Reviews.Author: CyberJava
Reviews.Content: I booked a double-bed room through Expedia.com, and was told only King size was available upon arrival. Checked the hotel website on the spot - the double-bed was still being offered online. Was told that it was typical to over sell in the hotel industry - what they were selling was not necessarily available. Somehow, the staff finally managed to come up with a double-bed room, which I later found out to be a substandard room. It was located on the first floor, next to the pool. It was dark, humid, and noisy. The furniture set in the room was missing pieces - no table, no chair as in the standard room. The light switch by the door could not turn on the light upon entering the room. Overall, a MOTEL grade room on a Westin property. Asked to be switched back to a king-size room, and was told it was just conveniently sold out. Asked whether there would be room available the next day, and was told no promise could be made, and if we wanted to check out early, a $250 fee would be applied, even if they did not have the proper room to deliver. Luckily, the next day, we were moved to a second floor room. It was much brighter and cleaner. Left a message to the General Manager, but the call was NEVER returned. When tried to check out by the phone, was told by the Service Express lady: "You're welcome to leave now." I don't know how Westin trains their staff, but I found it to be absurdly rude in the hospitality industry- never encountered attitude like this....

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a wonderful town”
Reviews.Author: RJS and Gale
Reviews.Content: We used points for the room, so do not know what the value would be for payiing guests. The hotel is in a great location for walking to just about everywhere, and the rooms are decent for an ex-Hilton. Staff were friendly, but somewhat indifferent to providing good service. Had to get towels, etc, each day, for instance. Concierge Desk was very helpful to us. Got great resturant suggestions from them, and booked on OpenTable after checking reviews there and here. Just stay away from the hotel food, unless you like paying more for mediocre food... even dinner at Latitudes was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mixed Emotions on this one.”
Reviews.Author: WillMyWifeGetSick
Reviews.Content: Family of four with 20 and 22 year old kids. Full disclosure: last minute trip thus we were willing to pay a premium as well as forgo some due diligence. Got the Hemingway Suite. This included a large bedroom with it's own 3/4 bath (small, cramped); a huge bedroom with a full bath (a bit cramped as well); a moderately large sitting room with sofa bed; and a useless, large entry room. All the rooms looked as if furniture had been removed and the remaining furniture did not fit i.e. small flat screen tv perched on top of a dresser so far away from the bed due to room size the tv looked like an after thought. This was the case in both bedrooms. We had a total of four (4) verandas and since we were on the 4th floor we had good views of the pool and partial view of the ocean....EXCEPT when the cruise ships were docked. The hotel was dirty in general with little evidence of cleaning in public spaces during the 5 days we were there. The same dirt and bits of paper remained in the elevators the whole time. Things that needed fixing often did not get fixed i.e. toilet paper holder. Maid service was OK but it was difficult to time one's activities during the day as the service times varied considerably. Communicating with the maids was difficult given the low levels of understanding of English as a second language for most of the staff. During our first 48-72 hours at the Westin there was intense, intermittent cigarette smoke mixed with marijuana smoke seeping into one of our bedrooms. Management was sympathetic but was unable to accomplish much for at least two days. This made one of our bedrooms a smoking room and the only way to alleviate the stench was by turning on the AC (very high) and opening the veranda door (a poor option since the temperature in the Keys was quite cold for those few days). Please note that management freely admitted that other customers in other rooms had also complained about the smoke but that they were unable to locate the source and essentially 'we're sorry'. Along with the smoke smell a dog in an adjacent room barked intermittently (left alone by owners despite hotel policy not to do that). While this didn't bother me or my wife to much (sounded like our dogs at home) this could make a room difficult to sleep in for many people. Food at the hotel restaurant/room service was average to mediocre and given the prices was a pathetic value proposition. The restaurant servers were sloppy and overworked. The silver ware was dirty frequently. The only good thing about food on the trip is that Key West has great food options. This doesn't help much when you have to eat at the hotel for one reason or another. The pool is quite small and is set between the wings of the hotel. This means that exposure to the sun is relatively limited given that configuration. This is ironic since most people go to such a locale for the sun in large part. The bartenders servicing the pool/outdoor area were good. The drink sizes were skimpy, prices high (surprise surprise). One CONCERN was the ability of anyone from the nearby boardwalk (heavy foot traffic) to gain access to the bar above the pool as there was LITTLE TO NO SECURITY PRESENCE. This is an issue in general at any resort/hotel but in Key West one only has to read the papers to understand that they do have a bit of a problem in this regard. This is potentially compounded by the frequent docking of the cruise ships during the week with many of the passengers and crew milling about quite near the Westin. The concierge service was uninspiring and was in fact misleading on several issues that mattered to us. One example was dinner for New Year's Eve, a difficult reservation to make by any standard. The concierge told us that our top choice for that evening did not take reservations. I asked the owner of that restaurant who stated that in fact they did take reservations for New Years Eve (but of course were filled by the time we sorted that out). Perhaps the best feature of the Westin in Key West is the location. It is very close to the Truman Annex, a quiet residential area that is wonderful to stroll through. The Truman White House is available for daily tours and is quite interesting. It is within the Annex and quite close to the Westin though well hidden from view by large palms and other vegetation. The Westin is also located near Duval street (Key West's mini-answer to Bouron St in New Orleans). It is also close enough to walk to the real marina at the opposite end of Front St where one finds a large variety of great seafood oriented restaurants and bars. One has to wonder as one walks from the Westin to the marina whether the Hyatt one passes would be a better place to stay? Another good feature of the Westin were the beds (as usual) which are some of the most comfortable at any hotel/resort in the world. At the end our stay we realized that we had a great trip though it was generally in spite of the short comings of the Westin rather than due to any significant number of positive features of the resort. In essence, the Westin Key West resort is a lot like an expensive PIT STOP and I cannot recommend this resort hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nursewebb
Reviews.Content: Great Key West location. Comfortable, clean and modern. On the water to watch the sunrise and sunset and walkable distance to all Key West attractions. Parking 25 a day, internet included in room price. No issues with housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Westin bed as always to die for”
Reviews.Author: polxawiers
Reviews.Content: Everyone should experience Westin at least once a year - we all need a good night of sleep and their beds will definetely take care of that. Westin Key West has a great location right on Mallory Square and close to Fort Zachary State Park. Rooms are rather big, nice baths and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and location makes this the only choice in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: Horrified-of-London
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend the Westin Resort & Marina highly enough. Without a doubt the best location in town not only from the perspective of being at the centre of the action (yet insulated from any unwanted noise) but also as the more sophisticated centre of Sunset Celebrations. This is an exceptionally good 4-star hotel with a relaxed waterfront vibe that belies the very high standards of service and fixtures&fittings on offer. Particularly worthy of note is the informal yet highly professional service of the reception staff, the flair and expertise of the hotelâ€™s bar-staff (my God, do these people know how to make a cocktail!) and the comprehensive local knowledge and affability of the concierge team (in particular the ex-pat Brit Jane whose restaurant recommendations were on the money every time). The combination of the Westinâ€™s superior standard of accommodation and the very chilled atmosphere of Key West itself make for the ideal relaxing break. It was the Westinâ€™s near-perfect Trip Advisor score that persuaded us to choose this hotel, and weâ€™re delighted to continue that record of excellence with an unreserved 100% across the board!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ordinary hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Coloradotmom
Reviews.Content: Celebrating our friends' wedding was picture perfect on the Sunset pier outside the westin. The location is what you pay for. The rooms are nothing better than a holiday inn. However, the rooms are spacious. The service was unbelievably poor. Over an hour to get our breakfast was ridiculous. The quality of the food was awful. Save money, go to one of the zillion other restaurants in Key West. With all of the boutique hotels, this one could fancy up a bit. I would choose another one if we ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: chicagoTRVLR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Key West Westin property over a weekend. As soon as we arrived, we rushed down to join in the sunset celebration. I had one of the best mojitos that was prepared on the Westin pier. The location of this property cannot be beat; just steps away from Duval and Caroline Streets. The room was pool facing and was spacious. The pool and hot tub areas were very clean and well maintained and had access to the 2nd floor sunset bar. The concierge desk was located in our building and was helpful for reservations. I would return to this property if I ever get a chance to come back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, subpar customer service”
Reviews.Author: lviewguy
Reviews.Content: The Westin Key West Resort & Marina is in a great location and in the center of all the action in Key West. The room was also very clean and spacious. My only issue with this stay was the poor customer service. My issues are minor, but still troublesome considering the rate paid for the room and the Westin track record of perfect service and attention to details. The first issue was that although I requested a higher floor room, they put me on the ground floor. The second was the fact that the alarm clock was set to the wrong time, and housekeeping never bothered to update it (this happens at a lot of hotels, and even more annoying when the alarm was set by a previous guest and not shut off by housekeeping, as should be standard checklist procedure). The final issue was the most troublesome. I had requested an early wakeup call the morning I was leaving and never received it. When expressing my displeasure with the person at the front desk when checking out, she called someone and he said he called me but I hung up, which is a blatant lie. When I told the individual I didn't receive a call, she just shook her head and said no, you did as I just confirmed. She then didn't even bother to thank me for staying at the Westin or give me what I needed to exit the parking garage since my room keys (which are supposed to work to open the gate) were shut off when I checked out. Although I'd stay here again for the location and cleanliness, I'd go in with low expectations for any level of customer service compared to other Westins.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - okay staff - but location and room makes up for it”
Reviews.Author: KirkcollmWp
Reviews.Content: This really is a great place to stay i fyou want to be in the middle of the party that is Key West. It is perfectly located so you can reach Duval street easily and you are right at the pier for the sunset celebration everyday. We had a pool view room and were very happy with it. If you get a pool view on the 2nd floor you can walk right over to the bar and see the sunset, it is great. The staff left a bit to be desired, in terms of helpfulness and friendliness. It also sucked that they closed the pool and hot tub down for 36 hours for annual maintenance. When called they would say it would open in one hour (each time we called). So really this is for location and the room.

Reviews.Title: “Key West trip”
Reviews.Author: SharonE3
Reviews.Content: In town for family wedding. Lovely time, although short. Brunch and wedding was so lovely. Staff was so nice, able to get a crib and all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful pool”
Reviews.Author: Caroline34345
Reviews.Content: I am pleasantly surprised at the size of the room and bathroom and at the overall professionalism of the service, particularly in housekeeping. This hotel has cleanliness and location going for it for sure. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cecy_10
Reviews.Content: Great location, service, food, friendly and helpful staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: clay_10
Reviews.Content: That last review is a bit extreme. I found this hotel to be nicely located for old town adventures and the pool is great. The front desk was quick to check me in and the room is very clean and smells good. I did not eat in the bistro but that should not be part of the hotel review anyway, it should be for the bistro itself.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good hotel, love the pet-friendly policies!”
Reviews.Author: CarmenGator
Reviews.Content: This was not my first stay at this Westin property, and I've often recommended it to Key West visitors. I live here, and it's my favorite hotel on the island when I need to plan an in-town evening away from home, or a "stay-cation." I love the pet-friendly atmosphere and the lovely island-style decor. The service is great - I needed to check in very late, and the staff was wonderful about making sure my room was available. I do recommend parking elsewhere because guests are charged $20/night if you use their lot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, except customer service”
Reviews.Author: Talidog
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good. Very nice location. The hotel it's self was nice and I have no complaints other than a dirty carpet in the room. The concierge was very helpful with any questions I had as well as was the front desk personel. Thats about all I can muster for the good because the trip was ruined by the managers and the over all customer service. First impression are everything and I should have stuck to that advise. When I originally called to book the room I asked if there was anyway to tell me if my view would be blocked by a cruise ship (read several reviews with this issue). The person told me that there was no way of knowing and that she had no clue as to where I could get this information. Made no attempt to help me finding the issue. By the way, I googled it and found the info in 30 seconds. Because of this encounter I decided not to stay at the Westin. After looking around at other places I found that the Westin was the cheapest, so I went against my better judgement and to save a buck booked the room at the Westin. Again the hotel is nice and the only issue I had while staying there was the fact that the carpet in the room was dirty and caused my 12 month old to have black knees and feet from craulling around (front desk told upon check out). Here is where my bad review really kicks in and the fact that I will pay the extra money and stay at the Ocean Key resort or Pier House next time. I checked out on a Sunday and paid $500 of my $700 bill with cash. The rest went onto my Debit card. Upon getting home that evening and checking my bank account balance I discovered that there were two pending charges for $678 and $250. I contacted the Westin manager, explained the problem and she told me that she was not sure why there were two seperate pending charges but that they should be released back to my account on Monday. On Tuesday the charges were still pending so I called back. This time I spoke with the director of operation, Joe Bru. Prior to doing this I called my bank and they stated that they were just waiting on Westin to release the charges and the money would be placed back in my account. Again I explained the problem to Joe. Joe's response was, verbatom "let me get the sign from the front desk so I can read it to you". He then read me the statement from the sign that states that it could take the Westin 7-14 to release pending charges back to an account. For approximately 10 minutes I went back and forth with Joe on the fact that $900 was being held from my account by the Westin after completely settling my bill. The only response he could provide me was that I would need to be patient and allow them the 7-14 period to get the money released. At no time did Joe ask me for my information to verify that my reservation was properly checked out of their system. I finally asked him if he wanted my name in order to check that I properly checked out. I ended the conversation with asking Joe if there was anything he could do to fix the problem and stop me from never staying at this hotel again and his responce was, again verbatom "No, you will just have to be patiant and allow the 7-14 days to pass". I have stayed at many hotels in my time from large chains to small B&B's and have never had this issue yet when I called to have the issue resolved, the response was SO WHAT! That says alot. Oh, one last thing. Prior to deciding where to stay I chacked around and found that almost every hotel in the area charges a resort fee or a parking fee which is clearly stated on their websites. This was not anywhere to be found on the Westin website and I was told about the $20 a night parking fe upon check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...right where everything happens.”
Reviews.Author: Cypress208
Reviews.Content: Don't bother requesting and paying extra for an ocean view room because its not beach front. The cruise ships block your views and it has no shore line. Definitely enjoyed the ferry ride to Sunset key for dinner at LLatitudes. The hotel is a bit spread out, and had to walk across the property to another building, however on the plus side...its in the midst of everything,,,its where everyone goes to see the sunset. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat It!”
Reviews.Author: mandapie8
Reviews.Content: My husband took me here for my birthday and our anniversary over Labor Day weekend and we had a wonderful time. The location was great, the people were friendly and the concierge made our trip. We both definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Chloe014
Reviews.Content: The Westin Key West is located right where it is all happening. Whether you want to view the sunset party, walk to Duval Street, Mallory Street or any of the other attractions this is where you want to stay. The only caveat, we had an ocean view room and if the cruise ships are in town they block the view during the day but leave at about 5 PM. This was not a problem for us since we were not in the room during the day and the ship was gone by the time we returned in the evening. There is no beach but the hotel is located on the Marina. The hotel is in tune with the low key atmosphere and fits the Key West landscape.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Disappointedguest52
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was for a business meeting the first week of August. I was really looking forward to my stay at this location, however my dreams were dashed when my shower over flowed onto the bathroom floor all five days, even though I reported every morning before class, the pool was closed down the second day we were there with no explanation of why or when it would re-open, the check- out was a nightmare to just get a correct receipt for corporate accounts, the conference room was a inferno (which just may have been me?) because the guestroom were cool enough. For the price (which was outside the per dium rate) this place was not worth it. Several season veterans who had attended this course before did not stay here this year; I will be one of them when I attend next year. Shining ray of hope was Kate in accounting that helped sort out the bill a month after the trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excellent Excellent. Starwood properties are the best period.”
Reviews.Author: Westondrive
Reviews.Content: This is the only place to stay in key west. Starwood rocks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Check the Cruise ship Schedule!!”
Reviews.Author: r0n10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Key West and stayed at the Westin for our wedding anniversary. Paid for an ocean-front room, which had a beautiful view...until the Disney Cruise Ship docked and blocked the entire view. There was never any mention of the fact that the cruise ship would be docking during our stay. Manager on duty offered to minimally cut my rate since now "I had an ocean view room instead of an ocean front room". What a joke. The pool was also closed for repairs for our entire stay. I would not stay at this property again and I would not recommend it to a friend...or anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Location, People, and Rest”
Reviews.Author: thegov
Reviews.Content: Typically in Key West, you have two options for lodging. An independent house or B&B, or a larger corporate hotel. As far as the latter goes, this Westin is tops! My wife and I stayed here at the end of July for a quick overnight getaway, just the two of us. Our stay was everything we were looking for - comfortable, quiet, clean, and with a warm and welcoming staff. The property is in excellent condition, with a wonderful modern room, amazing Heavenly bed, great bathroom, and even nice details like free wi-fi (this is huge), and AMAZING shower water pressure. We were upgraded to a marina view room with a small balcony, and it was just perfect. Overall, I can say that our stay was ideal. The staff at this Westin were very nice, location is very central to Duval and Mallory square, and I slept like a baby. My only two complaints are that I wish we were here for another day or two, and I wish that parking wasn't $20 a day. $12 a day for hotel guests would be more like it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, brill location”
Reviews.Author: kennethevo6
Reviews.Content: Well after a little bit of research on trip advisor , i picked this hotel for our stay in key west...The location is the best, your right near the marina and the beachs are a small walk but the main thing, your right beside Duval St, which is the main area with all the bars and restaurants, So thats the location, as for the hotel.. its says 4 star reviews on this, id say it just scrapes it...The staff were very friendly, they didnt tell that the rooms are in a different building though..anyway that was only a small thing, the decor of the lifts and hotel itself is very outdated and could well do with a revamp, but once we go in the room they were nice, 2 big double beds, and a small bathroom, but it was enough for us, the price wasnt bad either, The location is still the thing that would make you forget the small things about this place, ands saves you getting a cab uptown if your staying anywhere else, theres loads of great bars if your out for a good night out, Irish kevins was brill, Sloppy joes was also very good, Cant remember the names of the others, so thats my 2 cents on this place anyway..

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic Getaway for Holiday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: HealthITConslt
Reviews.Content: I used 2 Free Weekend Night rewards I had earned previously and then paid for 1 night with points. Prior to our arrival, I e-mailed the concierge and mentioned that we were going to be spending our anniversary at the Westin over the 4th of july weekend. Neither of us had ever been to the island before, and were not sure what to expect. Upon arrival to the Westin (about a 15 minute cab drive from the airport, after dropping other riders), we were told we had been upgraded to an oceanfront room with balcony (I'm Plat with SPG), but the room was not ready. We left our phone number and went to grab lunch. Our room was overlooking the boardwalk where the Sunset Key boat docks. It also happens to be overlooking where the cruise ships dock. It was actually pretty neat to see the cruise ship come in in the morning. I know some people have complained about the view being blocked, but when we go on vacation, we don't spend time in the room. By the time we watched the boat and got ready, we were out of the room. The ship left around 5p that night. We had a great time by the pool and really enjoyed the hotel. The location is fabulous and makes it so easy to get around town. We walked everywhere, including southernmost point and to Old Town Key West. We will definitely consider coming back here. The only issue we had was redeeming a certificate for $25 I had from Starwood. The only room charges we had were a breakfast one day at the restaurant, and it was around $36. I brought the bill and cert with me at check-out (around 6a). The desk clerk did not know how to process this cert and i was unable to use it. I primarily travel on business, and wanted to use it ASAP. I called corporate services as soon as I got home and they contacted the hotel on my behalf. The hotel comped all charges within 2 days. This was above and beyond what I expected, and they were most gracious. The hotel was fantastic with recommendations regarding food and things to do, especially off the beaten path. It's always good to get the locals perspective on things and they did a wonderful job.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular”
Reviews.Author: 68merlin
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations in a big way! The location was in the heart of Mallory square and the room was just lovely. The service was excellent and I will be staying here from now on when I visit Key West. 3 things to make sure you do: 1. Make a sunset reservation for Latitudes...it is a tad pricey for someone who doesn't normally splurge, but the location and view are simply spectacular. The food was great and service even better. 2. Go to the sunset celebration in the square. It is so much fun, especially the Cat Man! 3. Eat at the Hotel's restaurant for breakfast or lunch. Their menu is quite reasonable and the food is good. What a better way to relax than to be at your own resort! Heck, order room service. For a relaxing trip, the $3 for delivery is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodations & Staff Made Good Trip Better !”
Reviews.Author: dewhit6959
Reviews.Content: We were guests at the Westin Resort in Key West from June 26 thru July 3, 2010. Our original plans were to stay here for four nights and spend three nights in Miami but we enjoyed ourselves so much in Key West and this property that we cancelled our Miami reservations and spent an extra four days there. Upon arrival, we were upgraded from an ocean front balcony room to room 301, a very nice ocean front corner one bedroom balcony suite. On an earlier trip we had flown directly into Key West, stayed at the Hyatt suite property. We decided to burn up frequent flier miles into Miami this trip and make the drive. We probably won't do that again as the drive was alright, but nothing special and left us with a vehicle that sat in the parking garage all week the week. The valet parking is an additional expense, but necessary in Key West. The valets were a very friendly hardworking group of young men. We met a group of three young folks late one evening near the Truman annex who were living out of a older two door hatchback at a parking meter. They were young and flexible and didn't need mattresses and seemed to be having a great time. ( (Ahh, those were the days!) ) The suite was well laid out with a bedroom/smaller balcony and connecting bath/vanity area and a larger front entry room with larger living area with wet bar/fridge/dining area/large balcony and a comfortable sitting area with entertainment center/40inch hi def television and dvd player. There was another bathroom/shower connected to this room with a vanity area and large closet/robes/ironing board. The balcony is a large corner deck under a cupola roof with views to the marina and ocean front/ Mallory Square. The rocking chairs were very enjoyable on this deck. (It was extremely hot on our trip with the heat index registering over 100 degrees) Each room of the suite had a air conditioning unit controlled by thermostat and worked very well. We are from Atlanta and live with heat so we normally set our thermostats at 77/78 and are comfortable. We did hear some others complain that their rooms would not cool down to 65/66 degrees, but I question their logic at coming to the Keys if you want a ice box room. We would turn the units off when going out on the decks to enjoy the decks even more. The cruise ships docked directly in front of our room, but didn't block the entire frontage. We enjoyed seeing the ships and passengers disembark and that fueled conversations about past and future cruises.
