We were not bothered by their presence as we were usually gone by midmorning and the ships gone by five pm. The balcony was a great place to watch the "cat man" and his show and gathering during the sunset and evening. We changed to another one bedroom suite for our last three days, room 432, an interior courtyard/poolview/oceanview room without the additional bath or wetbar/dining area. There were also two balconies on this suite, but smaller than the ocean front corner suites. Jeff Alexander of the front office handled our room switch as the ocean front corner suite was reserved for a film crew making a marketing film. We enjoyed both suites and thank Jeff for how he handled this. Jane Brannigan is the concierge supervisor and performs her job very well and has a great sense of humor considering some of the utterly stupid remarks some can make. I could not do her job. The tropical storm Alex was forming behind Cuba and it's path into the Gulf was still uncertain and I listened to some really insane comments made in the concierge area as Jane helped them. (( "Will the party cruise still go out if a hurricane comes?" )) The pool is medium sized and open until ten pm. We enjoyed daily. The area is well kept and attended. The restaurant was alright. We ate breakfast there twice and enjoyed. Prices are reasonable for a tourist location. Speaking of prices, many have commented that this property is expensive. I felt the prices were quite in line for the area and reasonable for the quality of the rooms, services and location. It is a tourist location. The location could not be better. We walked everywhere and liked the location, but would rent bikes next trip to cover more ground. We met Diane Schmidt, the general manager of the resort and thanked her for our upgrade and the overall quality and friendliness of the staff we had met. She was very cordial and interesting to speak with. We enjoyed the Westin and will stay here again in the future and hope to plan a larger family trip later for the resort or at Sunset Key. We are not travel agents or affiliated with any travel/hotel/industry group and are not subsidized in any way in our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: surfzup321
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth time to Key West but first time at the Westin Key West Resort. Wow...what a wonderful hotel. We had a room with a view of the pool area which was beautiful and surprisingly quiet. The room was immaculate. The two queen beds were very comfortable. The bathroom had a walk in shower, no tub. The staff was very helpful. The location is fantastic. You are right by Duval Street and the waterfront activities such as watersport excursions and the Mallory Square sunset festivities. There are many shops, restaurants, museums, etc. Great location for teens as we felt very comfortable letting them walk around the area. The hotel has a private beach that you can take a shuttle boat to for an additional fee, (we didn't go this time because we ran out of time) but there is also the state beach nearby that is very nice too. This hotel was running some wonderful rate specials for the summer. We will definitely make this hotel our first choice when we return for more Key West fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bmoney1276
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin in Key West for 6 nights and couldn't have had a better experience. We had a 1 bedroom oceanfront suite on the 3rd floor and had 2 balconies with perfect views of the ocean and sunset! The hotel is a stone's throw from Duval st. which is where all the action is at. The pool area was decent but not really up to Westin standards in my opinion and the fitness center was a joke! The other downside is they make you pay 20 bucks a person to use the beach on sunset key island. I think I paid enough resorts fees, room charges and parking where that should be included. All that being said we'll definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Uriel05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Westin Key West Resort & Marina this week and LOVED it!! It is in a nice location and great to get some work done. The staff was very friendly and helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location - so much fun!”
Reviews.Author: escapeorlando
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Westin, Key West. I had a great time and had the best location. You're far enough from the action that if you want to get away you can, but if you want it, it's only 2 minutes away! Everyone I dealt with there was super nice and friendly. Checking in was speedy and easy and the guy there answered questions I didn't even know i had. It's also very nice to have the concierge. The room was pretty nice, very big. The only weird thing was the bathroom had this sliding door that didn't seal... that can make for some awkward bathroom times. We were there for 4 days and there were cruise ships there 2 of the days. These weren't a big deal. We were in the building with the pool so they didn't even block our view or anything. All we really noticed was that it got very crowded around then. Someone who worked on one of the boats we went on said they have to be out of there by 4ish, definitely by sunset. So that shouldn't be an issue. The pool was small but I didn't have a problem getting chairs. The chairs were comfy. I thought it was weird they didn't have an ocean view from the pool like a lot of the other hotels. I didn't have a problem finding sun and a lot of the times I wanted shade. All in all we had a great trip and would do it all the same. We went on a lot of boat excursions and pretty much had to walk right out our door to get there. We were a block from Duval. There was tons of food, shopping, and activities all around. Couldn't ask for more. Oh and if you go you MUST try Latititudes. Pricy but so worth it. Maybe one of the best dinners I have ever had. So nice to see the sunset. Such an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic View”
Reviews.Author: FloridaKeysGabriela
Reviews.Content: We really like the balconies and just relaxing. When you pay this much for a hotel room the room itself better be nice, which it is. We are also happy with the Restaurants and the Room Service. Thank you Westin Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location...all else 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: TheBozells
Reviews.Content: great waterfront location, no beach handy though... QUIET & PRIVATE 2 bdrm king suite premium waterfront views allowed for alot of great scenery..furnishings in living area less than desirable..worn & shabby, cheap to begin with...beds & bedding were blissfully welcoming...customer service and all inquiries handled through front desk, concierge, etc... took multiple phone calls...not exactly the level of attention to detail or friendliness that I expected...nothing but great things to say about kitchen manager...only one conversation and he was able to arrange for the room to be fully catered upon our early arrival...would consider going back if it weren't so much of a hassle to ensure that our accomodations were in line with our expectations. Front desk staff needs to be trained more specifically and quit deferring each request to a different dept....multiple calls to different individuals is certainly unnecessary for the kind of attention to detail that should go hand in hand with the Westin experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worthy”
Reviews.Author: TD5181
Reviews.Content: I stay at Westin Hotels all over the country - this one in Key West is a Westin in name only. The location is excellent, but the service is incredibly bad. Cleanliness is average. The people running the on-site restaurant should be replaced. They have no desire to be in customer service. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit; 3 Star Hotel with 4 Star Location...”
Reviews.Author: bowman716
Reviews.Content: The "Good Stuff": Newer hotel (1996) with wonderful water and sunset views. Location is ideal for Duval and Old Town activities. All employees I encountered were friendly and professional. Property is spotless and well maintained. Large rooms all with balconys, free internet (slow) and Westin heavenly bed. Quality of room service food was some of the best I ever had! Areas lacking: Very small bathroom vantity. TV is old with dark picture tube and very few pay per view options. Flat Screen TV's need to be the standard... Only one telephone in room. Pool is too small for the entire property. Slow elevators in need of servicing. Asked twice for sheets on bed to be replaced and never were. I maintain status with Hilton and Marriott but no longer with Starwood. I travel 20 weeks a year and would perfer to stay at Westins, Sheratons and W's but find them inconsistant and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: CO_Traveler_CO
Reviews.Content: Just like many others noted, the location is top notch. 2 blocks from Duval Street and right on the water. Just close enough that my friends and I could stumble home from Irish Kevin's or Sloppy Joes without getting lost. The sunset deck is pretty neat.....although it didn't seem busy enough for our taste.....we were looking for the party environment. Rooms are nice and beds were very comfy. This place wasn't "extravagant", but it is far better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....”
Reviews.Author: oh2bonvacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westing KW from 25-28 May 2010. Our room was 105 and it was ocean front. Great views to the water and right next to the bar. The cruises docked right in front of the room. I didn't mind but if you are looking for peace and quite this is not the room for you. One morning I was awaken by the morning annoucements of the cruise ship! The location of the hotel was incredible! walking distance to the best places. The pool has tooo much shade for my taste. If you are looking for a middle of the night life hotel this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wish the pool wasn't so shaded”
Reviews.Author: teesmc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin along with another couple for a long weekend. Our friend booked the rooms since he has some sort of "status" with Starwood hotels. We were on the concierge level, so we thought our accomodations would be top notch. The room itself was nice, but not over-the-top, and very small vanity area in the bathroom. We were supposed to have an ocean view from our balcony, but you could only see a tiny bit of ocean from the front corner. Our balcony was over some big air conditioner/blower, so it was too loud to sit out there and enjoy. The location of the resort cannot be beat. You walk off the property one direction and you are on the water, in the other direction you are right in town with all the shops and restaurants. The pool area sits in the middle of 4 buildings, so it is very shaded. We weren't able to sit out much because with the wind and lack of sun it was too cold. I am guessing in the summer months this shade is welcome. We did take the water taxi over to the private island to eat dinner at Sunset Grille. The experience was great, but the food was not worth the $800 tab for 4 people. I would stay at this hotel again, though I think Ocean Key has a better pool area if that is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Solid room”
Reviews.Author: anon345
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night. The location was great and the premises was beautiful. The room was a typical hotel room but was decent, clean and spacious enough for our needs. We were given a first floor room next to the pool. It was relatively quiet. The staff were informative and friendly. The daily parking was a total rip-off at $20/day but I would think that the rates are similar anywhere else you stay on the island. All in all, it was a good enough stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LUV2GoKentucky
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a great place to stay for fun and relaxation. We had an oceanfront room with an incredible view of the beautiful Gulf and all the boating activity. We enjoyed the beautiful sunset each evening. As far as the cruise ships....no problem. My husband enjoyed watching them dock. They are gone by 4pm and since we just don't sit in the room, they are no problem at all. The Westin is located in walking distance of restaurants, attractions and so many other activitites. The only thing it could improve on is the outdated furniture and televisions. They need to install flatscreens immediately as the current tvs make the rooms look so outdated. I am only pointing this out, because this hotel is so pricey and you just would expect these updates to be made since they have undergone recent renovations....maybe this is yet to come. Otherwise, this is a great place to stay as far as a great location, friendly staff, and out of this world beds! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: helen94
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Key West before but were unhappy with the accomodation so thought we would give The Westin a try. It was a big success, not least because of it's fabulous location right on the harbour, by the famous Mallory square. Travelling with an extended family from 11 years to 84 years this became really important because the elderly relatives were able to walk out of the hotel and straight into the town for shopping and restaurants. The views are spectacular out across the bay with the aquamarine ocean and the boats. We were there over the May Day weekend, and we discovered that the big ocean liners don't moor at weekends which is fantastic, because come Monday morning there were two enormous ships moored at the harbour blocking much of the view to the left. The breakfast in the Bistro of the hotel, overlooking the bay I can honestly say was one of the most delicious I have ever tasted, especially the bacon! The smoothie was the only down side not being real fruit smoothie and more of a frozen virgin daiquiri. Service was friendly, rooms very comfortable, beds with plenty of pillows. The elevators let the place down, being old, shuddery, slow and not in keeping with the rest of the hotel. We avoided them after a while and took the many stair exits around the hotel, being only one floor up. That apart, we loved our stay in Key West and would happily return to the Westin. It was really delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: BeachTraveler31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for 4 nights / 5 days. Great hotel for the location. You are right in Malorey Square where locals perform unique and fun shows. As far as the hotel goes, it's a Westin: clean room, clean grounds, staff friendly, service good. Our room this time was pool side third floor. Previous reviewers complained about the noise, I didn't hear it, no factor. Pool was very quiet after 6 pm. Also about the cruise ships docking right up to the hotel, this is true, but really not a big reason to knock the hotel. The ships usually dock around 7am and leave by 4 pm; more than enough time to see a spectacular sunset. So don't worry about the cruise ships, and besides, it's kind of neat to see these huge ships so close. As far as food goes, I recommend one place for breakfast/brunch. Blue Heaven has the most delicious banana bread in town! Read the restaurant reviews and you'll see. The earlier you get there, the better. The wait can sometimes be up to an hour, but well worth it. We ate and 9:30am and only had to wait 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but service not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: kc1016
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Westin. We wanted oceanfront and were given room 260. The view to the ocean is not very good as it is blocked by shrubs. Next day, at our request we were moved to room 263 which was a corner room with an excellent view of the sunset and a large balcony from where we could watch the sunset. The huge cruise ship which docked during our stay did not block our view so we were happy. The food at the Bistro restaurant was very good. We only had lunch and breakfast there and both were excellent. The room came with Starbucks coffee but I am a tea drinker, and the tea tastes awful if you use the coffee pot to make it. So, we tea drinkers are out of luck. I did request an electric kettle from room service but they didn't have it. I had to go out and buy an electric kettle! The hotel is in a great location if you pay for the ocean views and close to everything downtown. But service is mediocre, staff needs learn how to speak politely. They are very abrupt and curt especially, room service. This is my second visit to Key West and last one too. There is not much to do there especially if you don't drink. Duval street is packed with bars and all sorts of the typical touristy schlock! Went diving with Captain's Corner to Stake 9. The reef is basically dead, nothing much to see.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: florida14
Reviews.Content: Just celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary at the Westin. Selected the Westin again this year because we had such a wonderful time last year at the resort. Location is ideal, only 1-2 blocks from Duvall, yet room is peaceful and serene. Great restaurants in the area, but for meals close by, we found Westin could compete with the best of them. Swimming pool, sunsets, heavenly bed, and service were all perfection. Oh...did I mention the Aloe White Tea fragrance that is infused in the air of the resort and in the complimentary toiletries...now that fragrance alone is reason to come back to the Westin each year. We are plainning our 2011 already. Thank you Westin and thanks again to Diane Schmidt (manager) for the incredible anniversary gift tray and for making Westin a very welcoming place.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely nest in the city”
Reviews.Author: oliveerpent
Reviews.Content: After a long road from Miami to Key West, we arrived at the Westin Key West, a lovely place with a beautifull swimming pool area among a tropical garden. The bahamian and colonial style of this hotel was for us a real moment of leisure. This hotel offers a unique situation on walking distance from the center of Key West and it's famous Duval Street and Mallory Square. Just in front of the Marina, you can also enjoy an amazing view on the cruise boats. A lovely peacefull nest in the heart of the old town.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location...okay hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dedle
Reviews.Content: We are gold members and stay at Westinâ€™s often. The location is excellent and the rooms are clean. However, we were staying on points and if I would have paid $500.00 a night for this place, as advertised, I would have been really upset. The television was so blurry that we could not even watch it. We like moviesâ€¦no time to watch them at home. After being asked to move, we were told that the hotel was completely sold out and that we had no chance of moving that weekend (we were leaving on Tuesday). Room was facing the pool, with no view at all. Housekeeping did not come until after 4pm every day, no real issue...but they always seemed to come in when we were trying to get ready for dinner. I have high standards for Westin properties and this did not live up to it, especially for the advertised price. I think the location is worth the points, but I would never pay the asking price for the room that I received.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations”
Reviews.Author: paws1393
Reviews.Content: Stayed in new section of hotel. We received an upgrade to a suite which was terrific. Had a great view of the Key West sunset from our balcony and also sunrise the next morning. The suite was very large and comfortable. Location of the hotel was great. The bellmen were very helpful bringing our luggage to our car so we could spend a little extra time sightseeing. Would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip -- nearly perfect hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: ajhawk_10
Reviews.Content: We chose the Westin so we could use our Starwood points. We expected a cheaper room because we were redeeming points, but we got a great room on the Starwood wing, complete with a beautiful ocean view and a deck. The room was very nicely furnished and the bed was very comfy. The bathroom was a bit small, but it was clean and modern. We walked everywhere and had no issues. We didn't see the need to rent bikes or scooters. No complaints about the service. The room was cleaned and the mini bar restocked every day before noon. The bartenders at the pool were very friendly and attentive. We ate breakfast at the restaurant most days, but it's a rather limited menu and we got bored after a few days. Plus, they don't serve breakfast before 7 a.m. (not even room service), so if you have an early flight or an excursion that departs early in the morning, you're out of luck. Most of the boating trips tell you to arrive with a full stomach to avoid sea sickness, which is tough to do when nothing is open early. (I mean nothing. Nothing at the Westin. No restaurants, convenience stores, nothing.) We spent most of our days at the pool. We were disappointed that there was no wait service at the pool. If you order food at the bar, they will bring it out to you, but that's really it. Even though the website says the pool is heated, it certainly didn't feel heated for the first five days of our trip. We intentionally chose to travel the week after Spring Break so we could avoid some of the families with kids, but no such luck. The pool was kid soup most days. So I guess it's a family-friendly place if that's what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good hotel with a few minor inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: Gary144
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights using SPG points. When I checked in, I asked if an upgrade was available as we are SPG gold members. The front desk clerk moved us to the "Christmas Tree Island Suite" which appears to be one of only a few rooms that have their own name. I have no idea why they moved us to such an elegant suite, but it was a huge suite with two very large bedrooms with full baths and whirlpool, a large living room and foyer, and three balconies overlooking the ocean and the dock. The rooms were very comfortable. Also gave me the wifi code unsolicited. Unclear if this is standard or not. There is self parking or valet. Self parking was extremely convenient to our room in the SPG floor (3rd floor), as there was a bridge that led directly to the rooms. Only critiques: (1) the suite did not have any in-room safe (odd for such a luxurious set up), (2) on the first morning a fire alarm went off at about 6:00 a.m. and lasted for a few minutes. When it stopped, there was no announcement of whether it was safe to return to rooms. When I asked later what had happened, they indicated that there was construction elsewhere on the property and that dust had apparently gotten into a smoke detector that was supposed to be disabled and had not been disabled. (3) on the second morning, at about 4 or 5 a.m., the ceiling sprinkler in our bedroom started buzzing or rattling quietly, and I was wondering if it was about to turn on. I didn't want to call for maintenance because I didn't want to disrupt everyone else's sleep, but it was very unsettling. After about 10 minutes it stopped. Lastly, the concierge was helpful with discount coupons for the butterfly habitat and Hemingway house, but after hours there is a sign directing you to concierge services in the gift shop next door, and the clerk was totally incompetent. The attached restaurant, Bistro 245, had excellent food and reasonable prices for such a nice hotel. The key lime pie was OUTSTANDING - the best I have ever had, and our waiter was very helpful with suggestions for sightseeing, etc. The location is phenomenal - next to the pier where everyone gathers to watch the sunset, next door to the museum and Truman's Little White House and not far from the Hemingway House, butterfly sanctuary, and southernmost point in the continental U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great staff, what a magical stay”
Reviews.Author: kreay32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four night stay at the Westin Key West Resort and Marina. Our trip was magical, and at least a small part of that magic was due to the experience we had at our hotel. We booked kind of last minute, and when we checked in, we were told that the property was fully booked. Our room was not in the most desirable location in the hotel - first floor, looking at the pool. I spoke to Meghan, the manager on duty. She was extremely accommodating, polite, and friendly. She moved us to what has to be one of the best rooms on the entire island the next day for the duration of our stay, and threw in two bottles of wine for our trouble (full disclosure, we're Starwood Gold level members, not sure how much that helped with the upgrade; but I'm certain that Meghan's and the staff's wonderful and helpful attitudes were completely genuine). The room had a million dollar view of the setting sun, which is a spectacle that thousands gather nightly on the boardwalk to watch. Below our top floor room was a happy crowd of tourists, cruisers, performers, and locals, all gathering to watch the beautiful setting sun. The hotel has several rooms that have a similarly great view, and a great deck to gather with bar from which to enjoy the view. The hotel is located near the top of Duval St. It's steps from all of the fun, tons of great bars, restaurants, shopping and arts. We drove to Key West from FLL (convertible), and dropped our car off at the Key West airport the day we arrived. No need for a car when you're staying in such a great location. The hotel was clean - we would have liked our room cleaned a little earlier in the da, but once it was done it was great. We didn't eat at the hotel - too many other great spots (Pepe's, Blue Heaven and Seven Fish are locals' favorite spots, and now ours too). Meghan, thanks for everything. You're doing a great job and Starwood should be thankful to have you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice,with a few buts......”
Reviews.Author: postcardNewYork
Reviews.Content: Let me preface my review with the fact that I used mostly Starwood points to pay for this stay. If I had to pay the astronomical price for the room we stayed in,I don't believe i would have been as happy because it was certainly not worth 350-400/nite. Check-in: Friendly and quick. Room: Almost completely re-furbished. Modern furniture,very contemporary feel. Regular( not flat screen) tv,with very bad reception- we didn't watch it very much anyway. No Art work in the main living area. Beautiful lamps. Bathroom area VERY nice! Nice towels and robes. Starbucks coffee and Tazo tea. When they did not replenish the tea, I called to ask for some.....they arrived within 5 mins with about 10 tea bags of 4 different varieties . A truly Heavenly bed that was sooo comfortable we had a hard time leaving it. Facilities: Pool area was very nice. Lounge chairs had thick, comfortable cushions on which I easily fell asleep....and I NEVER fall asleep poolside! Sunset deck-perfect location to view a sunset , IF you get their early enough to catch a front row seat. Bartender did not put Liquor in the drink I believe. The Strawberry Daiquiri was awful!!! The gym looked great.....about 4 treadmills and a few ellipticals. Conceirge: AWFUL!!! Now I did read some negative comments about this, but you don't realize how important this can be until you stay somewhere without a knowledgeable person It is even MORE pronounced at this Westin, since the main part of the hotel is in a different area from where you sign in. So....we finished our sunset cocktails and was looking for a restaurant to grab a bite to eat.....concierge gone by 8(remember sunset was at 7:45). I had a list of suggestions but the girl in the gift shop who sincerely tried to help gave us the wrong directions to what was apparently a very popular spot. We walked a couple of miles and finally had to settle for some sports bar someone told us about because all the other restaurants were no longer serving. But, my BIGGEST complaint was about how they tickets to Sunset Key are handled. The Westin sets aside a limited number of passes to Sunset Key daily. The girl in the gift shop said that I should be fine at 8:15, but I decided to get tot he concierge desk by 8. There was a line of about 5 people in front of me. I knew that they set aside 20 passes , so I figured I was ok. When she gets to the guy in front of me....she looked at the both of us and said ....I don't know what to do since I have only one ticket left......I guess I can extend the number by one and sell you two. Now I am staying at a 'high-end' resort and it was obvious that everyone standing on that line at 8 am was there for one reason and at no point while she is filling out forms/tickets does she give any indication that the number left was getting low. She waits until the LAST one to mention anything. I was really MOST disturbed about how they handle this situation. I called the manager(who leaves you a card each morning) and she was not in so I left a message. Never got a call back or an acknowledgement of my call. I called the manager on duty who explained that the concierge maybe thought I was making dinner reservations.....how ridiculous. No offer of a complimentary anything....something I would think an upscale hotel would do. Frankly, I was left with such a bad taste in my mouth with how this was handle and how little the hotels provides advice, etc ( you can get a nice bed anywhere) I would not recommend this hotel......we stayed at an amazing bed and breakfast the other nites.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, in a great location, at high cost”
Reviews.Author: humin32
Reviews.Content: Initially stayed at the Westin Key West Resort/Marina during my first ever trip to Key West. My wife and I decided to spread the wealth and stayed at three different places during our 7 nights in Key West. The first two nights were at the Westin. Pros: The location is really ideal. The Westin is roughly a block and half to Duvall St and one block to Capt Tony's. The location is a very short walk to the most active part of Key West with regard to tourist activities. We had a sea view room with balcony. The room was very nice, I really wish timing would have worked out better to spend a sunset on that balcony with an adult beverage. Cons: Very expensive, two nights at the Westin cost more than 4 nights at a bed and breakfast. When we went to bed we had a nice ocean/harbor view room, when we woke up our view was a gone and the only thing we could see was the side of a cruise ship. The customer service was not up to what I would expect for the amount of $ I paid to stay there. My wife and I were away from the room from 9AM to 4PM, when we returned the room hadn't been made up. Housekeeping knocks on the door at ~4:30 wanting to come in, but my wife has just gotten in the shower, so I ask if they can come back, "but we get off work at 5:00", so I tell them to forget it. However, housekeeping did wait until we went out and made up our room after 5:00, no prompting of management required. Our luggage was delayed in arrival to Key West, not the fault of the Westin. But when it was delivered, nobody brought it up to us - I had to go down to retrieve it, which is non-trivial considering the layout of this hotel. They offered us toiletry kits on our night of arrival (toothbrush etc..) but couldn't piece together two complete sets (only one toothbrush). I would expect the front desk to have those readily available. As we later discovered this is common to Key West, but the walls allow all manner of noise to penetrate. We were woken early each morning by the activity in the marina. Considering that I paid probably twice what I would have paid for a similar star level hotel in Manhattan, the Westin Key West Resort and Marina doesn't live up to expectations. I expected to be wowed and I wasn't. BTW - I'm a Starwood member, so I've got some experience with this hotel chain. Would I recommend this hotel, yes, but with the caveat that it's not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tshissler
Reviews.Content: We will be back. It is located in the BEST area of Key West with easy access to everything. Everyone is very helpful. I don't know of one thing that they could have done better. The Sunday Brunch was great too!!! The massage that my wife and I had there was one of the best that we have ever had. GET ONE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: 3weeks
Reviews.Content: We (husband and nine month old baby) moved to this resort after a bad experience at the Casa Marina Resort (see review). We were so appreciative of the staff for letting us check in on such short notice. The front desk person, Indiana, was very helpful and accomodating. They were so nice and welcoming when we arrived. We got an ocean view room with a balcony on the third floor. It was a corner room and it was huge. Plenty of room for us and all the baby gear. The balcony was great because we could put the baby to bed then go out on the balcony to relax. Great views of the ocean and perfect for watching the much hyped sunset. Very quiet after dark, slept great w/ out any noise disturbances. Woke up each morning to see a gigantic cruise ship right outside the window but surprisingly didn't hear a thing--and I am very sensitive to noise when I am sleeping! We could literally look right into the cruise ship but it really wasn't a bother. Location of this hotel is great--depending on what you want to do in Key West. It's very close to seedy Duval street and all the other attractions of Key West--but no beach. The pool is very small but it was too cold to swim anyway. Ate at the hotel restaurant two times and the food/service were good. All in all it was a good hotel, but we weren't very impressed with Key West as a whole and would not return and cannot see what the draw is.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and fun location”
Reviews.Author: ElizaD00Little
Reviews.Content: Yes, this location can get a bit crowded with the cruise passengers and Duval street close by, but it was peaceful at night. I don't know what all the fuss is about re cruise ships blocking the view, they leave before sunset so you still have the great sunset view. The Mallory Square crowd leaves right after the sunset festivities, so the area tends to be exciting by day, but peaceful at night. The beds are quite comfortable, the rooms clean and modern. Also, the pool chairs are very comfortable. My only complaint about the pool is that they don't have staff available to bring you drinks, but it did help me save some money. The service is what you would come to expect at an upscale hotel. The front desk staff go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The conceirge are friendly and helpful. I inadvertently left some cash behind in the safe after I checked out and the maid even returned it all in full. When I went back to pick it up, they called in a manager off-duty who returned to help me and the front desk staff gave me a bottle of water while I waited (which wasn't long at all). I also stayed 2 nights at the Sheraton by Smathers Beach for business, and I would not recommend it all. You will be highly disappointed, despite the fact that it is rated higher here on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmRC
Reviews.Content: Spent one night for business here before driving down to Miami with work colleagues. i didn't want to get out of bed. The minute I went to my room and plopped down I felt I was in heaven - they really are "heavenly" beds! I had a hard time getting out but made myself get out of bed lest I miss out on my very short stay at finding out about Key West. Positives: Beautiful hotel, friendly, courteous, and helpful staff (both valet and front desk), free wireless access, clean room, great location, walking distance to all main streets, and absolutely wonderful bed (didn't I just say that). Bistro Cafe overlooks the water - good food, good service, great view! Negatives: Was on second floor facing the pool. Would have love to sit outside balcony but felt conscious because of the people on the pool. It was a bit noisy with pool guests still out at night, and then people going to their rooms. You could hear the conversations in the hallway. I didn't like the ceiling fan - I turned it on and it made such a racket that I had to turn it off and relied on the air conditioning instead. Other than the few negatives, the hotel really was comfortable and a nice place to sleep overnight. Wish we could have stayed another day.

Reviews.Title: “Went back”
Reviews.Author: jaypalisades
Reviews.Content: Nice and relaxing. Far enough away that you need to rent a moped, but close enough to get to the action when you want it

Reviews.Title: “Great location but disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickCarraway
Reviews.Content: My gf and I recently spend 4 nights at the Westin. I requested an Ocean front room with a balcony...which was fine (was in 101). But specifically ask for one on the upper floors, much more privacy from the crusie ship crowd. Also, the DJ on the ship was absolutely blasting music at 5:00. Surprized the city let it go on. If I did it I would have been arrested. Anyway the bathroom and room was very old. Nothing replaced in 10 years including the TV. We attempted to get foam pillows instead of down but no one was of help. So I requested a move to another 3rd floor room which was fine, except they was no safe in this room...was simply told this particular room didn't have one. Air conditioner is way too loud. You won't sleep. They said I could bring jewelry ect to the front desk but who wants to spend time doing that. Then the closet door was literally ripped off. Didn't exactly look nice. This was room 381. It says on the balcony that you can hang clothes in the bathroom where there is a line provided for hanging only problem was there isn't one. Left and stayed our last night at Ocean Key which was gorgeous. Much sunnier pool also. Gorgeous rooms. Also, no indoor bar at the Westin. Lame fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, paradise in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: marker0706
Reviews.Content: First , I want to thank Shannon Kennedy and Shirnell Schuman for making it possible for us to stay in an Ocean Front room. This was my second trip to Key West and the Westin Key West Resort in 2 months. The 1st was a business trip with spouse and business partners. We stayed for 7 nights and had a great time.. No complaints. As soon as I got home, I made arrangements to take my 74 year old mother and sister.. They had never been to Key West and I hoped they would love it as much as we did. When I inquired about rooms available I was told that there were no ocean front rooms left. I wrote a letter to the Westin and received a quick email reply from both Shannon and Shirnell. I asked to be put on a list in case of a cancellation for an ocean front deluxe room. I was so surprised and happy to learn that we were able to have the same room that my husband and I had just stayed in . The room is 262.. You could not have made us happier. My mother said she has never stayed in such a nice room.. the view is the BEST!! We loved watching the cruise ships pull in and out , the sunsets, the sailboats, etc. My mother was able to walk to all the nearby museums, shops and restaurants, She even went on her own one day and took the conch train tour.. she loved it! We all felt safe alone and as a group as we explored Key West! We all 3 took the Key West Trolley tour which allows you to get off at 12 stops and get back on whenever you want. This was ideal to see the Hemingway House . We ate breakfast outside everyday at the Westin Bistro overlooking the water. The food was excellent and the service freindly. Thank you to Helen the hostess for her smiles!! We spent a little time at the pool reading and the bartender brought a platter of fresh fruit around to all the guests!! What a nice surprise... My Mom and sister and I were at the Westin for 5 nights... and we had NO complaints..the beds were comfortable, rooms clean, Free WI-FI for my Ipod touch, housekeeping staff freindly, a refrigerator was placed in our room for cold drinks, the views from water front deck were magnificent.,. . I travel with our business to 10-12 trade shows a year,, all in resort golf areas..and I have no complaints about the Westin Key West.. I hope to visit the Westin later this year for the annual business trip..it was the perfect relaxing location for us.. Thank you again to everyone at the Westin Key West Resort who made this stay so special for my Mom.. a lot of wonderful memories.. she kept saying it was the nicest place she ever visited!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Hotel, but don't expect anything special”
Reviews.Author: JackandMaddie
Reviews.Content: Positives: Great location, within walking distance to Duval St, Mallory Square, shops, restaurants, museums, etc. and friendly staff Negatives: Ground level room was a bit noisy, and bright light in hallway made for difficult sleep I stayed here with my husband for four nights in February. The staff was helpful and the facility itself is very nice looking. Our room was on the first floor near the pool and a restaurant. There was quite a bit of noise at night because of the people lingering outside of our room. What bothered us the most was the bright lights lighting the hallway on the first floor. One of lights lit up our room at night even with the drapes pulled as far as they could go. The problem was there was a window with blinds and they didn't offer much light blockage. It would have been better if they had put drapes all the way across the window to block the light. The bed was not very comfortable, and the TV was not a flat panel like the Westin that I had stayed at in San Diego. We really enjoyed the Starbucks coffee in the room that we could brew ourselves. We loved the location and we were able to tour the island on foot. The weirdest thing was one night we came back to our room and there was a large glass bottle of water on my nightstand. When we asked abut this mysterious appearance at the front desk they were puzzled as well. They do not have a turn down service, nor do they give out glass bottles of water. This worried us because that meant someone had gone into our room without our knowledge (it wasn't the cleaning crew). Nothing was missing from our possessions. This is a nice hotel in a great location, but don't expect anything fancy or special.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ewatts74
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at this hotel and we love it!! We were upgraded to an oceanfront room at no charge. The rooms were nice and clean. Traveling with pets can be a challenge to find a nice hotel but this delivers! They even brought us a pet pillow and doggy bowls too. Plus internet was free. All the staff was wonderful and friendly. My husband had a massage and loved it! This is the best location on the island for a hotel too. We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Wonderer
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel property. The location is perfect, the rooms are exactly what you expect from a top tier Westin resort property. It's true about the Ocean View rooms... ours was partially blocked by the cruise ships - but the cruise ships were fun to see and the visitors gave the area a nice energy. The cruises aren't there everyday so it was fine. The only downside we had was the pool area - the way it's set-up it's in the middle of the property and not that big. So the chair situation can get tight on a great day - meaning the dreaded "towel on the chair to hold it" - we were always able to get a spot but I could see that being an issue during the busy season. We love our rooms and had a great stay. We would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Yes...it is a chain, but...”
Reviews.Author: temptingtravel
Reviews.Content: You absolutley cannot go wrong with this hotel. I have now stayed here 5 times and as much as I love the b & b's here in Key West, I love the Westin. It has never failed to disappoint me. The views are amazing. The rooms and beds are comfortable and inviting. (heavenly bed) The most professional, top shelf hotel in Key West. We enjoy Duval like all of the other tourists, but it is really nice to be only a few steps from quiet comfort and solitude. I get a sunset view every night from my room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean View Rooms..Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: Buco52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Jan. of 2010. We paid quite a bit extra for a "deluxe balcony/ocean view" room. We were spending just 3 days there. The first day we got acquainted with Key West, walking all around visiting Hemingways home and a few other attractions with plans to hang out on our lovely balcony and just relax and enjoy the views the other 2 days. We woke up the 2nd morning, walked out onto our balcony only to be staring at what seemed like HUNDREDS of balconies on a huge cruise ship with people staring right back at us! The extra money we paid for the sunset views we might as well have tossed in the garbage as the next day there were 2 more cruise ships blocking our views. We couldn't believe this wasn't mentioned when we booked. I did read something online about cruise ships but the area they showed them were further down from where our hotel was. This is a nice place to stay, but don't pay extra for the ocean view rooms unless you find out the cruise ship schedule. It really was very disappointing. Hotel staff were rather "flippant" when we brought it up and even told us very sarcastically that there was a picture of a cruise ship on their website. Well I didn't see any picture and that really didn't make anything better. They ended up giving us a gift certificate for $40 towards breakfast in their restaurant, which was nice but didn't make up for all the money we lost paying extra for a view we didn't get!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very good hotel, even better with the Upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: pia_traveler519
Reviews.Content: I can't stress enough the prime location of this hotel for all the restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. that Key West has to offer. Mallory Square is a short walk away. Pretty much everything was in walking distance. We had the car valeted which was a mistake (an extra $2/day) not a big deal but we never got the car again until we checked out. And you can watch the famous sunsets from your room if you get an ocean view room. which we reqested but got one even better... Upon our arrival they informed us we had been upgraded to a 2-bedroom ocean-view jacuzzi suite. The rooms (I say rooms because we acutally had two good-sized regular hotel rooms with a living room in the middle, 3 total) all were great with an ocean view balcony from each. They were great to watch the sunsets. We got lucky and there were no cruise ships docked there for our entire four night stay. It was only the two of us so we had way more room space then we needed (4-6 people could have slept ther comfortably). But having the two seperate bathrooms/showers, etc. came in handy when getting ready to go out for the day or night. We didn't really use the pool because we took advantage of the private sunset key beach. It was $20 for a beach pass for a day but we thought it was worth it. We also didn't use the hotel bar/restaurant because as I said before everything else was so close we didn't need to. I can't really comment on the value or whether the hotel is "worth the money" because with the upgrade what we paid seemed a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ustehkc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent more than a week at Key West and were initially thrilled with our choice to stay at the Westin Resort & Marina. The location is superb. However, I want to give potential travelers a balanced view from a Starwood Platinum member who has stayed more than 60 nights in Starwood (Westin, W, St Regis, etc) hotels in 2009. Positives 1) One of the best locations in key West - easy access to everything. Best view of sunsets in Key West. That said, cruise ships docked at the pier sometimes block the view of the sunset 2) Staff - very friendly and accomodating. Moved us from one room to another after 3 days as we could not tolerate the 1st room were were given due to size and location 3) Free internet in room, free use of business center (internet and printing) Cons 1) Rooms - despite the fact they have evidently been redone recently, the rooms are very average and feel like a "motel" to some extent. If you are going to pick a room that is not a suite, I would pick room 309 as it is at the end of the hotel and has 3 balconies. It is also fairly large. The bathroom is tiny though if that is important to you. 2) Pool area - very little sunshine gets into the pool area due to the buildings. Further, it is very small and guests quickly hit the area in the am to secure their spot by throwing towels and books on the chairs Overall, the hotel just feels like it needs to be refreshed. It does not compare to other Westin hotels I have stayed at in the past. To be honest, I found myself going to a hotel on the beach called Casa Marina, which has a great lunch, drinks and view. Its a classic hotel and does not realy fall into the same category as the Westin so that comparison might be unfair. My vote next time I go to Key West is to stay at Casa Marina, which is unusual for me given I will have to pay for the room as it is not part of the Starwood program.

Reviews.Title: “Your hotel gives Westin a bad name!”
Reviews.Author: ShotgunJohnny
Reviews.Content: Undergoing renovations? Then be responsible and shut the hotel down until renovations are completed. The management of this hotel depicts unconscionable business and moral conduct and unrestrained greed considering what they were charging their guests. I spent three nights in a wing of this hotel with my family where we were the only guests occupying a room while all surrounding rooms as far as the eye could see (and ears could hear) were undergoing massive renovations. If that wasn't bad enough - we were awoken at 7:00 a.m. each morning with the sounds of jack hammers, power tools, and crow bars ripping material out of the room adjacent to ours. Sleep? There would be none of that at this Westin. We hand wrote a long letter to the manager expressing our disappointment. Never did we receive a response. Who is to blame for this? The local management, or the corporate management? No one seems to take responsibility. Many years ago, I lived in a Westin in Denver for three months and found the hotel chain to be of very high caliber. But staying with Westin in Key West has ruined their reputation with me, and with many others as evidenced in other reviews. I've been traveling the world on business and pleasure for over 40 years, and never in my experience have I seen such disregard from a major brand hotel toward their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocare, Not enough bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: Milo911MD
Reviews.Content: The rooms were just renovated. But there is still nothing especial. The property is clean. However I would not call it a Resort. It lack all the component that a resort should have. This property might as well been a Holiday Inn Express in a small mid west town. The best part is location, as it is close to everything around. However even this is mixed bag, since an average 2 big cruise ship anchor right in front of the property during most days and completely block your views ( and all the extra day tripper roaming along the vicinity and the property). There is really no service to talk about. The pool area is tiny. We were staying using are SPG points. But I can not recommend this place if you were paying the prices they were asking for per night. Key West has became very touristy and is primarily catering to cruise ship day tripper.( with tons of T shirt shop, ... It seems a lot of them are owned by Russians as well). It is no longer a quite sleepy Caribbean town, that I remember during my last visit 21 years ago. We stayed for 6 nights between Xmass and New year, which was way too long. I don't recommend staying more than 2-3 nights max. Pros: Location, clean Cons: Not really a resort, Lack of services, Nothing special about the place. Cruise ship constantly blocking the views, Day trippers all over the place.

Reviews.Title: “Service very mixed”
Reviews.Author: worc33
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel primarily for the location and for the comfort that a Westin would be reliably clean, comfortable, etc... On those two points we were satisfied. However, we thought the service was sub-par for this caliber of hotel. Most of the shortcoming was with the concierge desk which essentially handed out brochures and did little else. Also, we booked an "ocean front room with deck" as opposed to a pool/garden view. While we would probably do the same if we were given the choice again, you should be aware that the view is often a massive cruise ship docked in port. Also, the decks are very small with flimsy tables and chairs. You would not want to spend very much time out there. An upgrade in deck furniture would be a nice touch. All told - nothing outrageous but enough to knock this review down from 5/5 to 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Westin - More like a A Motel 6 with a high price tag”
Reviews.Author: In79days
Reviews.Content: What a disappointing hotel. I stay at Westin Hotels all over the world, and have come to respect and rely on their consistent quality and service. That past experience made my stay at this hotel all the more unpleasant. The location is perfect, but the good news unfortunately stops there. The rooms were plain, and poorly furnished (the TV looked like something out of the Honeymooners, there was no phone at the desk, no full length mirror, etc). The voice mail didn't work, I never received my alarm calls, and the restaurant was more like a glorified snack bar. You had to pay to use the Hotel beach, and the pool was contaminated with babies swimming in soiled diapers. I've 'traveled rough', and backpacked, and that is OK at the right time and place, it's just not the experience I expect from a Westin. I suspect the problem is that the hotel is split, and the real amenities and quality are in the sister location in Sunset Key. I know at least two guests upped and moved over there during my stay. The Key West part of the resort appears to be treated as the Cinderella, or unwanted step child, and unfortunately the amenities and service reflect this. Don't waste your money, the 3 star Southernmost Hotel at the other end of Duval Street is much nicer, is a lot better value, and doesn't even charge guests to use its beach! .

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: VHBlue
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade to an oceanview room for being a Starwood Preferred Guest member. Our room had 2 queen size beds and a balcony where we could see yachts and cruise ships docking. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use Valet Parking”
Reviews.Author: JAKFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June and it was great. However our recent experience was terrible. We arrived at the hotel at 4 p.m. and handed our car over to the valet attendant. We never took the car from the garage the entire 4 nights there. We checked out and never noticed until we stopped for fuel that there was a small dent and deep scratch in the paint on the rear passenger door. We called and asked for the hotel manager, who was unavailable. Our call was returned by the assistant manager who took the information and advised us that she would check the video tape in the garage and forward it to their corporate headquarters. We did receive a call from "the management company" and they told us that they were not responsible for any damage done in their garage by their attendants! If you are paying $20.46 per day for valet service it seems that they should be responsible for damage done in their garage!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: tracycul
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. We got upgraded to one bedroom suite and it was probably the nicest room I have ever stayed in. The location is great, easy walking distance to everything. It was perfect from the time we got there till we checked out. If you can stay here, it is well worth it. Didn't really like that the cruise ship docks right behind the hotel but it really wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: drubano
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend at the Westin and EVERYONE was as pleasant as could be. We were given a 1st floor room near the pool and I was concerned with noise. We didn't hear a thing! The rooms are well equipped and recently renovated. I highly recommend a short boat ride to Sunset Key for lunch at Lattitudes. The food was fantastic and the beach very nice and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TCJF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took the Key West Express from Fort Myers to spend the weekend of 10/24/09 in Key West. The location of this hotel is great and you can walk to almost everything, plus there is a lot going on around the hotel. The hotel is in excellent condition and the rooms are great. Service is also very good. There is no extra charge to use the Fitness Center. We stayed here a few years ago when it was a Hilton and if anything it is even better now. The only thing remotely negative is that it can be a bit of a maze to find your room and if you have a car be prepared to pay for parking. Overall we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: MichelleC7127
Reviews.Content: The Westin was great. The location is spectacular- the views are wonderful.. Housekeeping was great- everything was very clean. Check in and out was easy. Would stay here again. My husband and I were traveling for our anniversary- not certain if I would bring my children with me- interesting things happening around the pool. one note- the cruise ship dock is right in front of the hotel- so our ocean view room became a big cruise ship view from 8 am until 7 pm on three of the days. Also- this hotel is dog friendly- a yipping dog awoke us one morning at 6 am. A quick well- received call to the front desk took care of it immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Key West”
Reviews.Author: ValerieS4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located walking distance to Duval street and the water activities. The private beach is only a ferry away. Friendly staff and would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay At The Westin Key Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sliphorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel and found that it is a good choice for being in the center of the action of this lively, eclectic town. I wasn't ecstatic at the $20 nightly parking fee, but it beat the street where parking is tough to find, and it WAS in a nice safe garage attached to the hotel. We stayed in the main (older?) building and had a gulf-view room. We were on the second floor but could see well. The only time we could not see was when the mammoth Carnival Discovery was docked and resembled an enormous city. We had only that as a view until departure that day at 2:00. The world-famous sunset was find from our balcony the second night. On the fist night, we joined in the party to watch the sunset but were dismayed to find several boats blocking everyone's view at the precise moment of sunset. A commercial boat called "Fury" was right there in the middle with loud music blaring to disrupt the romance of the moment. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted well and escorted to our room. During our stay, unlike the previous one at The Don Cesar in St. Pete Beach, we had to open the door ourselves as we were ignored by the doormen most of the time. The concierge was located in the other ("newer") building and we found that fact out just before checking out. Our room was very nice and had all the amenities it should have. The furniture, due to be traded out before the end of the year, was old and damaged in spots. The location is the big thing as we could walk to every attraction in the downtown area. We loved coming and going like this. Despite the information provided that the remodeling had been completed except for the furniture, I can report that our room was not renovated. I would stay there again though for the reasons listed above.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints...but for a Westin, just ok”
Reviews.Author: dru37
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to Key West and we really enjoyed ourselves. The hotel is in a prime location, just 2 blocks off Duvall St. and front row seating for the sunset. The rooms are smallish, but certainly clean. We didn't have a renovated room, but no big deal, we didn't spend much time in the room anyway but would have liked to see what the new rooms are like. The hotel staff were pleasant. There is a bar at the pool and one on the patio for the sunset, but both close early...I suppose with Duvall St. 2 blocks away that makes sense. Overall, not a bad place but not a special place either.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but Overpriced and looking tierd”
Reviews.Author: BON_VOYAGE245
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August with my husband and 13yr old son.. The hotel is very well located near to everything and we had a fabulous view from our one bed jaccuzi suite. We stayed for four nights and checked beforehand the cruise docking days... we were lucky to only have one ship wake us up at 7am...with the horn on loudspeaker!!! Then everyone leaves the ship in large groups walking past the rooms... sounds like one big party... Be warned.. they are noisy.. When there are no cruise liners in , its the best view.. to sit on the balcony watching the sun disappear into the ocean. We booked a one bed suite to have a little privacy from our son... unfortunately not the case, as there was no door into the bedroom, so we could hear every breath and movement from my sons very uncomfortable sofa bed. Bathroom nice, but paid for jacuzzi which had no plug so couldn't use but nice large shower. The room was a decent size but looking tierd.. was also disappointed that there have obviously been cutbacks, as the usual luxuries which we all appreciate seemed lacking.. ie I left my slippers in NY fully expecting them, but alas.. had to walk on the floor in flip flops at all times, knowing that this is a pet friendly hotel.. The houskeeping was of a good standard and the were always friendly... which is not the case for the receptionist at guest activities.. BE warned.. we stayed at this hotel with a future stay in mind at Sunset Key. We wanted to go over and have a quick look at the faciliteies , pool , restaurant and beach.. To get the boat over they wanted a total of $60.. what a rip.. out of principle we didn't go and will not be staying in the future.. How can they charge this for a brief look round... must not be all as it seems .. and as I said guest activities were very rude... The pool is small and if you are not dog lovers.. beware, I saw several dogs lying on sunbeds... Ok in your own home, but I feel not quite right in a hotel.. Had lunch once.. ok but nothing special... one thing I would recommend is the Sunday Brunch... Outstanding and soooo much choice.. Would have been happy with this choice for an evening meal.. Best meal out was at Prime Steakhouse.. not cheap, but worth it, great choice, sides huge and outstanding service. Overall, not a bad hotel, but taking the prices into consideration I have stayed in far, far, superior hotels for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Warrior33
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took the trip to the Keys for his birthday weekend. We reserved a room at the Westin because of the location and the reliable name brand (we frequently stay at Starwood Hotels and are aware of their company's standards). When I made the reservation, the only available rooms had 2 queen beds, which was fine with me, but I mentioned that it was his birthday weekend and requested to be put in a room with a King bed if one became available. The morning of our arrival, my boyfriend called the hotel to confirm everything and let them know our estimated arrival time. He also reminded them that we were celebrating his birthday and had requested to be moved into a room with a King bed if they had any available. The associate that he spoke to said that they would try to accomodate us upon arrival. When we checked in, the front desk agent did not acknowledge my boyfriend's birthday, nor did he apologize for not being able to put us in the room that we requested. What's worse, is that the desk agent next to us was helping another guest move to a room with a King bed! We were checked into a handicap room with 2 Queen beds on the first floor with a door that opened right onto the pool....how romantic. We didn't complain, because the room was big and clean and we didn't plan on spending much time in there anyway. (The room was great except for the location and the crappy old TV). After we freshened up, we went down to the pier to grab some drinks and watch the sunset at Westin's Sunset Bar. We had THE WORST COCKTAILS ON THE FACE OF THE EARTH!! and service to match it. The drinks were only $8 but they came in tiny plastic cups and we're pretty sure they didn't even contain alcohol. Its not that hard to make a mojito and a maitai...c'mon people. We waited around to be seated, ended up seating ourselves, waited 15 minutes for our order to be taken, 15 more for our drinks to come, and then half an hour for our bill. They're lucky we didn't leave without paying. Ridiculous. The worst part is that its slow season in the Keys. Its not like there were long lines of people or that they were short-staffed - Guess they just didn't care about providing good service and creating repeat business....

Reviews.Title: “Slightly above average for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: joeygill
Reviews.Content: Hotel was overall quite clean. Westin beds are always nice, room was well appointed. There are pros/cons to the location of the hotel. The pros are that its VERY close to Duval street and all the nightlife/eateries. The con is that there is no beach out front! It is a marina. For $20/day you can use the private beach at Sunset Key (short boat ride away). Treatment for SPG Platinum guests are poor. Our "upgraded" room was small, although it did have an ocean view. Note this was the off-season. There is also no Club Lounge, or free breakfast unlike most other SPG properties. We had to call daily just to get them to refill the water bottles in the room! Also, the pool is a little small for a resort. Its the size of a pool you'd expect to find in a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Westin - what you would expect”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl086
Reviews.Content: This Wesin is exactly what you would expect from this chain. The location is what is has going for it, right near Duval streeet and where the sunset celebration is held each night. We coudn't get a late check out even though we were leaving super early to go diving and needed a 1:00 check out - and I'm a gold preferred member. This was kind of a pain. We spend two days here and two days at a place called the Gardens Inn - which we enjoyed better.

Reviews.Title: “best experience i've had in years”
Reviews.Author: dannya50
Reviews.Content: There is everything right, and nothing wrong with this hotel. It is located on a beautiful marina with a sunset view. It is walking distance to duval so you never need a cab and could stumble back late at night. The pool has a great scene, and the food is good. I can see no reason to stay anywhere else. Small, and I mean very small negatives, are that when the cruise ships come in the ocean view is gone, the fitness room is very lacking and there is no spa.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Key West...and I've tried alot of them”
Reviews.Author: rooooomie
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel you will find to stay in Key West. The comfortable size of the room, pricing is good, service is excellent, pool is gorgious, and it's location is ideal. It's along the pier where the cruise ships arrive, and where the Sunset Festival is held everyday at 5pm until sunset. If you get the right room facing the pier (rooms 101-105, 159-163, 201-205, 259-263, 303, 304, 360, 361, Half Moon Key Suite 362, Sunset Key Suite 301, or suites 408 or 455) , you can sit on your patio with a homemade drink in your hand and watch the festival. Then you can walk to Duval street to take in all the festivities there. We used to stay at the Casa Marina Resort (a high end hotel not near Duval) but found their service got worse, and their housekeeping was horrible. I have stayed a few times at the La Concha Crown Plaza on Duval, but the noise from Duval is not nice when you do try to sleep, plus you have no view, and no nice pool area. The Westin give you everything!!! This is the only place we stay at. Also if you have a pet, you can bring him/her!! They even offer dog bowls for food and water, and a dog bed, at no extra cost. The suites have awesome huge jacuzzi tubs!! All rooms have mini friges to hold you booze. The gym is not too bad for Key West. Casa Marina gym is bigger and better but don't like their rooms. Westin gym has 3 treadmills with ipod hook up, and tv, 2 or 3 incline eliptical machines, free weights, and one cable machine. It's enough for your quick workout before a night of drinking. ......I LOVE THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “heavenly bed - need i say more?”
Reviews.Author: californiamom
Reviews.Content: i was shocked when i read the aug 1 review of the concierge at this hotel. we checked into the hotel on july 31 and checked out on aug 2. on aug 1 we also spoke to the concierge and had no problems. we were treated professionally and courteously. i guess we just got the right concierge... in any case, the hotel was fantastic. the location is perfect. so close - walking distance to everything like duval street. u do need a cab to get to higgs beach, which is a couple miles away. there is a sunset celebration held right on the pier behind the hotel. our room overlooked the swimming pool. we had absolutely no noise whatsoever and i am a very light sleeper. i was thinking that the hotel's location, since it's so close to all the action, that loud noise in the hallways or at the pool would be a problem. but we had absolutely no problem whatsoever with noise of any kind. in addition, when i made the reservation it said on the website that the hotel was currently under renovations. i asked at the front desk what the renovations were. the clerk told me very minimal. when we got off on our floor there was a man painting. he was busy painting the entire weekend, but i never smelled anything in my room, and my nose is very sensitive. the only thing i would change about the hotel was the pool. the pool has salt water. the water was so hot! it was actually hotter in the pool than out of the pool. and when we were there it was 94 degrees with who only knows how much humidity - sweltering hot. it would have been nice to cool off in the pool. i could only swim around for a couple of minutes because i actually started sweating in the pool! the pool is 3 feet on the ends and 5'5" in the center. the lounge chairs are thickly padded and are very, very comfortable. there are tons of towels available. we asked what time the pool closed and were told 10pm, but we did see people swimming after 10. but like i said the noise from the pool could not be heard in our room which was directly over our room. the rooms also have very large balconies with two chairs and a table. i cannot say enough positive things about this hotel. i would not hesitate to stay there in one second. the other small thing that i did notice is that drinks, food were not picked up quickly enough at the pool or in the front lobby, but that was a very minor issue. also no flat screen tv in our room but whatever. also in the lobby there is a large plastic bottle with ice cold, freshly squeezed orange juice in the mornings. the food offered in the restaurant is also very good, but of course at resort prices - worth every penny. the free wi fi was also a nice touch. and then of course those heavenly beds. oh my goodness. and the white tea scent throughout the hotel and the rooms. i am heading to nordstrom on wednesday to go and pick out my heavenly bed ensemble. i am so convinced. thank you so very much again westin for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rude service, chain hotel feeling.”
Reviews.Author: julie_LA
Reviews.Content: For such a pricey hotel with a nice pool, location, etc., I was blown away by the rude service of the concierge. We checked in and our room was not ready. No biggie. But the concierge snapped at us that we were 20 minutes early and that the room was guaranteed at 4pm. I tried to stay in a cheerful mood - we were in Key West, after all, but when the room wasn't ready at 4:15 and I half playfully pointed out that the the guarantee the (very young, maybe 20 year old) concierge had used against me almost 30 minutes prior wasn't good for that much, he flipped out and said he was doing everything he could and why don't I speak to a manager, etc. I was shocked by his terrible attitude and behavior. I was spending over $250 a night for this hotel (more than I paid for the Loews in Miami Beach which I would give 10 stars to, if that were possible; the service was impeccable) and I was being chided and snapped at about room readiness. It colored our whole stay there, since we got off on such a bad foot. A manager did give us a $40 certificate ($40, huh? Doesn't go far in Key West; that's almost laughable - except it gets better....) that could be used for breakfast only. We tried to cash it in the next morning but we had missed breakfast. The amiable waitress let us use it for lunch but here's the catch - if the lunch cost $25, and the certificate is worth $40? You lose the balance. So that certificate was a joke. It's really too bad because this hotel is in a nice location and has nice rooms, etc. but it feels very much like a chain and the services are provided with a shrug - it's not personal and they do not go the extra mile - BY FAR. Another concierge was also rude and indifferent to us when we asked a question about where to find something in town. Two thumbs down. I will never stay there again and I seriously would save your money if I were you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!! Loved it and can't wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: Greycorgi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two young sons, just returned from a 4 night stay at the Westin Key West. My husband is a Starwood member and we used his points to stay for free two of the nights. When we arrived after a long day (flight from NJ then drove down to Key West from Ft. Lauderdale airport), we were greeted by Jeff at the front desk, who was extremely courteous and polite. We initially booked a pool view room and were upgraded to a two bedroom oceanfront suite with the most magnificent view of the sunsets every night. This hotel is perfect. The location is within walking distance to all of the attractions including Mallory Square, Duval Street, all the shops and the Conch train. On our first morning there we had a great breakfast at the hotel restaurant, but had most of our other meals in town at different locations (we like to try it all). The hotel room service was extremely well priced and the children's portions were very generous and $4 for chicken fingers was the best that I have ever seen. There is a large variety and all children's entrees were between $3-4 each (it was great). The internet service is wireless and free, yes, I said free. The parking was $20-22 a day depending on valet or not. Key West is great! Our first trip here 13 years ago (before we had children), we stayed at the Casa Marina, but wanted to stay within walking distance to town so we chose the Westin. The Westin rooms were very clean and the grounds were beautiful and very serene to walk around and look at the boats and the ocean. The only thing that I would like to note is the cruise ships. Our oceanfront suite did have a view two of our four days of the large cruise ships that dock in front of the hotel. I knew about this ahead of time so we were prepared, but these ships are very large and the view is obstructed while they are in port. The good news is that the one ship left by 2pm and the other by 5pm, so they don't ever get in the way of the sunset. The cruiseship passengers pass by the hotel on their way to and from town and some were a bit rowdy, but they got back on their ship and went to their next destination. My husband and two sons enjoyed the hotel pool. It was not extremely crowded and had nice shade from all of the surrounding palm trees. July in Key West is extremely hot and humid, so be prepared to perspire when outside, or visit in a cooler month (we'll try that next time as the heat was pretty extreme-even the Today show when filming there during our stay said the heat index is 105 with temp and humidity. Plenty of air conditioned shops, restaurants, and the hotel. While in town check out Margarittaville, Sloppy Joes and Red Fish Blue Fish restaurant. Have ice cream and watch the sunset while walking around Mallory Square. There is a fishing village with little shops that has great seafood restaurants and manatee sightings. My son loved the Ron Jon surfshop too. Parking around Ernest Hemingway's house can be a challenge to find, but is doable. There are great supermarkets like Winn Dixie and Publix, that sell bottled water and all other necessities for great prices. Great town, great shopping and dining. The Westin and their staff were fantastic! Will definetely return.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, convenient, relaxing, exciting, all rolled into one!”
Reviews.Author: tectonicgirlWPB
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a 2 bedroom suite, which was gorgeous. The bathrooms were large, sparkling clean, and the 'heavenly' beds were so comfortable I had my best night's sleep of any hotel stay (or was I just so tired from all the partying?) This hotel is versatile because it could have been a quiet, relaxing vacation because they emphasize this mood, but for me it was 'party in Key West' and we made the best of our time. Our view was of the small marina which gave us beautiful sights of the Gulf of Mexico as it begins to meet the Atlantic. We woke to a cruise ship docked on Friday and also on Sunday, so those two days were busier than the others at the marina. The hotel is perfectly located at the end of Green Street and just one short block from Duval where all the action is. I'm sort of the independent type so I didn't have much interaction with the hotel staff, but the front desk, valets and security person I met were helpful and pleasant. Breakfast at their restaurant was just right (I'm picky about temperature and flavor!)... and I never saw the pool because I was too interested in checking out the town, which was a whole lotta fun. Hope this review helps, the Westin will be my only choice in future visits.
