Reviews.Title: “Best location and hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: PLRamirez
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in June on vacation. The location is the best in Key West and the best place to watch the sunset. We loved waking up to see the cruise ships come in and the view on our Marina side was fabulous. You can easily walk to Duval Street and all locations in Key West. Here's a tip. Ditch the car and rent a moped. It's the easiest way to get around. The hotel staff is great and the rooms, recently remodeled are fantastic. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean View "Not"”
Reviews.Author: TLynden
Reviews.Content: We booked an Ocean View room, the Ocean View rooms at this resort are based on whether or not a cuise ship is in port. The room was really a view of a cruise ship with periodic views of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “I felt totally relaxed and pampered at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: kag541
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and clean. Within walking distance of most attractions and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “renovated rooms, conenience to shopping”
Reviews.Author: doctocc
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated rooms made this stay popular with my wife. We haven't stayed in a cleaner room anywhere. We had a nice ocean view with a balcony. The sunset festival was a favorite with the kids and is right outside the hotel door. Nice pool but getting to the beach is a pain. You have to take a ferry. If you like shopping, the strip is two blocks away and restaurants are plentyful. My wife would like to go back when the weather is cooler. The kids were bored though.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SMGan
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and we wish we could have stayed many more! We took a last minute drive from Miami and are very happy we chose the Westin. The room was clean and comfortable. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant and had a terrific view of the famous Key West sunset. The food was excellent and our waiter, James, gave us some helpful hints about the local tourist spots. Our only complaint was that we had to go back to Miami the next day! I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Planning on going Back”
Reviews.Author: andycrna
Reviews.Content: I attended a continuing ed class at this hotel. All the staff we came in contact with were extremely helpful and friendly, especially the concierge. The hotel is ideally located at Mallory Square. The hotel has a nice pool area with a bar and two other bars looking over the marina and the daily sunset. The room was a comfortable size with a balcony. The rooms had showers without tubs, so no soaking. There are Jacuzzis next to the pool. I had lunch daily, outside, at the hotels resturant with good food, great view, and Key West prices. You can take a ferry from the hotel to their private beach. It was very nice, clean, and full bar and towel service. The beach excursions are an extra twenty dollars a day. Well worth it. My only complaint ---They need better AC..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: rjsnau
Reviews.Content: There are some negatives to the hotel. For one, many of the rooms do not have a very good view and face a back alley unless you pay for a full ocean view. Two, they do allow pets which results in them deodorizing your room heavily if you are unlucky enough to stay in a room after a pet. Lastly, they can be very expensive. However, with that said, the rooms were very nice and the location can not be beat! It is off of Duval enough to get away from the noise and craziness, but still only a 5 minute walk away. They are also right across from Mallory Square for the sunset celebration. When it is hot and humid out, there is nothing like being able to stop in and cool off and even take a nap. Everything on Duval is open late so you can go out for a bite to eat or have a drink and be home within a few minutes. As for the negatives, there is so much to do that the view ended up to not be a big deal. The room aired out after a day and became somewhat normal, and the cost, well, you get what you pay for! One last thing.... We had no problem with noise at all. The hotel seemed to be sound proofed very well. The cruise ships would come in early and we would not hear a thing until we opened our patio door. Then you could hear people yelling and screaming. Close the door and it was quiet again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay... loved it”
Reviews.Author: dreksfreks
Reviews.Content: The resort is close to everything. Beautiful clean rooms very spacious. Up to two dogs can be in the room for no fee they just cant exceed 40 lbs. Self parking is $20 a day. The only thing I didnt like too much was the fact that they charged us $250 deposit just in case you were to break something or as they say "get wild" without letting us know and the pool is on the small side. Other than that great hotel great location. Would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pink-polka-dots16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for my wedding last month. It was excellent! You can't beat the location. Even though I did not get married AT the Westin the staff there treated me like a Queen. Everyone there was very friendly and professional. I really enjoyed staying right on the marina and boardwalk. It was right in the middle of everything without all of the noise from Duval Street. The rooms were spacious and very clean. My entire wedding party stayed there as well and are still talking about how great it was. Thank you Westin Key West for an incredible wedding week!!!!! I really enjoyed the Sunset Key Suite :) We will be back next year for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort - Expensive but certainly worth it”
Reviews.Author: TripsterNj
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort right on the Marina. The room we got was an ocean view with a balcony and was beautiful. The whole structure of the hotel was very nice. The pool side was incredible and the hotels proximity to all the restaurants and bars made it a great place to stay in. They had told of us the renovations they were doing and we were never inconvenienced by it at all. Apart from some paint lapses on the hallways, we did not really notice anything else that was off. My biggest complaint is around service. I felt that they understaffed their pool side and only one girl was serving all the folks around the pool. It took forever to get any drinks etc. We ended up going to the bar ourselves many times. Furthermore, after paying money to go to the Sunset Key Cottage Beach, there was no one on the beach to provide towels or serve drinks/food. For a resort, that is pretty poor! I hope the service issues are temporary and I will write it off as unfortunate timing for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: CubsFan1717
Reviews.Content: We visited Key West with some friends to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. I had been a bit concerned about some of the recent reviews due to renovations, but after staying here, I can't imagine what there would be to complain about. The resort was beautiful and in the ideal location. We were upgraded to a suite overlooking the harbour, and we could watch the boats in the daytime, and sit on our patio with a drink and watch the sunset every night. It was so nice not to have to fight the crowds in Mallory Square. Our suite was beautiful, the bathroom was huge, and the beds are so comfortable you'll want to take them home with you! We could walk to all the spots along the harbour and Duval Street, which is especially nice when coming home at night. Lots of bars!! We loved our stay at the Westin, and can't wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: tennisarpmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel will spoil you! Brand new renovations make everything look and feel posh. The beds are super comfortable. The bathrooms are spotless (though the lighting in the vanity is quite bright); there is even a make up mirror! The coffee maker is wonderful with Starbucks coffee; a single cup maker and real creamer in the condiment pack. The view of the sunset from our balcony was spectacular. The salt water pool is lovely with trees all around and plenty of towels. The Concierge is very helpful; however, I wouldn't take her advice 100%. The Bistro has a great breakfast menu and you can eat overlooking the harbor. The location is super for getting around Key West. We were upgraded to an oceanview room when our request for a King bed wasn't available until the day after we arrived. Nice front desk staff. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: guswho
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went here and I wanted to have a nice place close to Duval st. and surrounding activities. Sunset Key beach was a pleasant suprise...you have to get beach passes in the morning at the concierge so be there early around 7 ;15 since the line forms around that time and they have limited passes. Check with the concierge for details. Our room was upgraded to ocean front second level coner overlooking mallory square...so we had a cool sunset party right from our balcony every night. It was great! Room Service was fast and the Sunday Brunch is loaded with great food. I'm not a buffet eater, but, this was a good choice...glad my girlfriend talked me into it. It was great waking up to the ocean breeze and torquoise water every day. The Director of operations is a good host and even though I didn't meet him I called and gave my appreciation for the service and hospitality. Robert From Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Key West”
Reviews.Author: Familyof07
Reviews.Content: My family of five kids and nanny enjoyed this hotel. I am a platinum SPG member and only travel on vacation w/my free points. If you're a platinum member you have to work every hotel. In this case, I had eight in my party w/two rooms. I was given a modest upgrade (non-suite). It helps to have five kids (9 & under). After checking in past 8pm, I negotiated for a beautiful (cruise ship harbor view) suite #422 w/two attached rooms w/kings and a middle common room. It was huge and nice! Didn't need my second room, so I got my Starwood pts. back. The a/c was already blasting to make you forget about the humidity and outside temps. The pool was great and tropical. We travel w/sound machines in each room, so we never complain about noise, not that I heard any. We drove around Key West to see the sites but the nearby tour trolley looked fun ($40/adult, 20/kids). Walking distance to Duval and main restaurants (1 blk). A must restaurant is on Sunset Key (a free 10 min boat ride across channel) is the Westin's Latitudes. We had an nice breakfast of French toast, banana nut pancakes, and the special...lobster eggs benedict (had eggs scrambled). I hear a sunset dinner is enjoyable too. We had a completely enjoyable trip, but the suite upgrade had a lot to do w/it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Good Westin Choice”
Reviews.Author: FlyRight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our son's spring break. What an awesome location. We almost stayed at the Sheraton Suites, but in the end I booked the Westin. The location of the Westin is outstandingly better. It is a block off Mallory Square where many sites are located and the evening sunset activities take place. The hotel is divided into 2 buildings, and requires use of bellmen for luggage if you are in the second building. The second building is a better choice since it has the pool, restaurant and sunset bar are located in that building. We did not use any of the facilities during our visit. The rooms were nice, and bathrooms were big. Note that the bathrooms having a sliding door, so privavcy is a but less than usual. If you are in Key West check out Sarabeth's for a meal. What a great restaurant- the owner is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: checkinoutplaces
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night / 5 day stay at the Westin and we enjoyed it. We were in room 390 which is a 1 bedroom oceanfront suite in a good location overlooking the waterfront. We booked the room as a standard room and were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to the oceanfront suite. We did request that we be placed in a recently renovated room away from current renovations. The Westin is in a great location with easy walking access to almost everything you can do in Key West. It is also located at a marina which provides easy access to watersports (jet ski's, sunset cruises, parasailing, etc.). It is a block from Mallory Square and Duval Street and within easy walking distance of Historic Seaport and many of the local attractions. There is also a CVS pharmacy down the street so you can pick up some of the items you may need for your stay. Be aware that the Westin is located at the site where all of the cruise ships dock. On several morniings, we awoke to see our oceanfront view covered by massive cruise ships but they always left before the sunset arrived. There are other oceanfront rooms that would not have obscured views so you might want to request one of those. Although the Westin does not have a beach attached to it, you can pay for a daily pass (about $20 per person) to take a boat to their sister property on Sunset Key. We went over for a day but beware that the beach is very small and you are required to stay in the beach area and cannot roam the resort in this location. Overall, I would recommend going to Fort Zachary Taylor Park which has a public beach and more public activities to do. They do have a decent fitness center located right off the pool deck. The pool at the Westin was a salt water pool (either that or it had a lot of salt in it) and is relatively small compared to the number of people using it. We were able to locate chairs when we went to the pool area. Adjacent to the pool is a second story bar area which is a great location to enjoy a cocktail while watching the beautiful sunsets. We did eat at the hotel restaurant and the food was really good and reasonably priced (at least as compared to all of the restaurants in Key West). I do understand why some reviews indicate that the hotel is a bit tired and run down in some areas but it is clear that they are in the process of updating it. The side we stayed in was already completed and was very well done. Recommendations on things to do: *Mallory Square in the evening *A walk down Duval Street *Schooner Wharf Restaurant *Jet Skiing *Drag show at Aqua (it was hilarious) *Flamingo Cafe for breakfast *Mangia Mangia for italian dinner *Upper Crust for pizza

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: Thami15
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed there hoping the the quality would resonate the Westin name. We are from Fort Lauderdale and the Westin Diplomat is beautiful so we assumed this would be similar, but it doesn't compare at all. They are remodeling. They were putting down new carpet. There were wet paint signs on the entry way to our room hallways. Our room had a beautiful view but the upgrades done to the room were below par. The contractors did not do a good job for a 4 star hotel (not that I'm an expert). The bathtub marble exceed the bathtub to the point where I couldn't put my foot on the side to wash my legs. The stainless steel toilet paper holder kept falling off. The tile floors were not cut to size near the bathroom sliding door, with the base floor peeking through by a margin of 3-4 inches. The marble tile on the baseboards were popping out. ... We paid a certain price when we reserved the room that morning, but while checking in, a potential guest walked up to ask the price for one night. The price offered to the person walking in was $50 less than what I'd reserved 3 hours earlier. Of course they did not honor the discounted price stating they usually charge less to walk ins. The room we stayed in had a beautiful view of the marina thanks to Sasha at the front desk. She was the most hospitable person working at the hotel. The Ukrainian valet parking staff were unfriendly and not very cordial at all. They seemed annoyed more than helpful. The morning of checkout, we asked to extend checkout for 1 hour and they told us no, it is on a first come first serve basis. All in all, the marina view is beautiful. The boardwalk is pleasant. The staff was unacceptable, (except for Sasha). I do not plan to ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: char51
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 8 days in Key West and stayed at this Westin. It was not our first choice as we have stayed at the Key West Hyatt and preferrred it but it was booked solid. The only positive thing I can say about this hotel is Location. It is very well located to just about everything you should want to do. I expected more quality from a Westin. We began with our check-in and a less than friendly receptionist. She told us to go out the dorr and stay to the left of the pool to find our room. Number one, the pool can not be seen until you enter the courtyard of another building up the drive and so we had to ask a tourist if they knew where to go. So we went into the lobby of this other building and out the other side to find the pool and then our room. It was pretty generic. The furniture is past beaten up and there were no flat screen tv's to be seen. The bathroom was the high point of the room. Nice and roomy. The food at poolside was good but there is no personal poolside service. You go to the bar and order and they at least bring it to you. The wharf side restaurant was very nice and watching the cruise ships come in was fun. Would I stay here again. NO way. We checked out other options while we were there as we love Key West and will return.

Reviews.Title: “I am now spoiled!”
Reviews.Author: cdblues
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for 3 days and 2 nights. I did book my room on SPG.com and got an amazing price. Check in was easy, I booked the lowest priced room and was prepared to hagel to get an upgrade. I was very surprised when they upgraded me to a ocean view room without me having to ask them. The room it self was beautiful, very clean and bathroom was spotless. The view from the balcony was amazing! We had a 157 foot 50 million dollar boat docked out side the room called ScottFree. It did not block the sunset only made it better. We stayed on a Friday and Saturday and did not see any cruise ships, like the other comments have stated. We had breakfast and a snack at the pool, the food was very good. The location is perfect, I will never stay anywhere else but at the Westin in Key West ever again. Tried to go to Blue Heaven on our last day for Sunday brunch, Not the day to go, when we got there it was a 75 minute wait, that was to long for me to wait for eggs! So we walked into a little cuban breakfast place, don't remember the name, it is on Pettronia St. about four homes to the east of Blue Heaven. Amazing breakfast, great service and cheap!! We will definitely go back next time for lunch and breakfast, our valet at the Westin told us that they are known for their Conch Fritters. My only disappointment was the Conch Republic, the service was horrible, and the cracked conch was very chewy. I love Key West and can't wait to go back, IMO the best way to get there is to drive a convertible all the way to Key West, it is the most beautiful drive I have ever been on!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort BUT room reservations aren't honored”
Reviews.Author: knoxtenntraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Key West Resort on Jan. 31 through Feb. 1, 2009. I called the resort from Miami a few hours before arriving to make reservations. We booked an ocean front room and I was assured this was what I reserved. (This being our first visit to Key West, we wanted to enjoy sitting on a deck outside our room and enjoy the ocean and the sunsets Key West is famous for). I was also told I couldn't cancel this reservation without being charged since I was reserving on the same day of arrival. I said this was no problem, we'd be there in a few hours. When we arrived, we were told there was no ocean front available but an ocean view. I didn't want the hassle of trying to find another place and then have to deal with the no cancellation charges I'm sure I would incur. We were taken to our "ocean view" room - if you stood on the edge of the patio you could see the water. We had a wonderful view of a PORTA POTTY right outside our room! As far as the resort goes, it is clean, well maintained, and most of the staff was very friendly. And one more thing, we were charged the ocean front room price. Would I stay here again? No

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: bucyguy
Reviews.Content: I am in the travel business and am also a Starwood Gold member. My wife and I checked into the hotel and they said they only had a graden room available and that we could check to see what they had tomorrow. We loved the room. We did have a little patio outside our room which overlooked the pool. The pool was not heated, but the sun was warm and the pool was quite refreshing. Yes, we did have to move our chairs a little to continue to be in the sun, but we needed the exercise! We had excellent service from the poolside staff. We ate lunch there every day and the food was great. We also went up to the harbor view bar and the staff(David) was incredible. He gave us great advise and mixed some awesome drinks. (try his frozen blueberry mojito!!!) You cannot have a better location in Key West than this hotel. Mallory Square was right next door and Duval St was 2 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of the Westin name.”
Reviews.Author: Buckismycat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a five day, four night trip from our home in Northern New York to the Florida Keys. I'm a stickler for hygiene, so I chose the Westin Key West. I'm a frequent, loyal and very happy Westin customer for stays in New York City and Boston. In fact, I just got back from a one night stay at my usual Westin Copley in Boston, and I can't believe it's the same organization as the Key West Westin. The first room we were taken to was a first floor room with a patio on a public walkway. Yikes....there were people walking 8 feet from our door. For $459 per night, we asked to be moved off the ground floor. The only other room we were told was available turned out to be shabby and not very clean. The ottoman was obviously stained, the television had drip marks down its face, and the carpet was dirty. The balcony in this second room was too small to sit on and the furniture on it was dirty, and a huge bush blocked most of the view. The worst part was the fact that the lavatory (sink) was outside the tiny commode/shower room, and the sliding glass door that separated the commode/shower room from the rest of the room would not stay on its track and was thin and did not close. Neither of us could shower, use the commode or even wash our hands without sharing the experience with the other. It was like sleeping in the same room as your toilet. The power went out shortly after we arrived, plunging the tiny room into darkness, but I don't think that the hotel was responsible for this. It didn't help our memory of the experience, 'though. There was Westin soap, Westin towels, etc., but nothing else seemed like a Westin. We checked out early the next morning -- our vacation time is too short to spend it in a room where the beds might as well be next to the toilet. I politely explained our issues to the front desk clerk, who politely explained to me that they'd have to nick me an additional $100 for the early checkout. I didn't care at that point and just wanted to be out of there. We relocated to the Ritz Carlton in Naples to finish the rest of our vacation, where for only $50 more per night, we had a room with a separate bathroom, spotlessly clean accommodations, etc. When we turned in our keys at the Westin, we waited in line behind two other unhappy, complaining customers. Apparently, it's not a good time to stay at this hotel. I live near a property, the Sagamore Hotel, which I'm told was just purchased by the owners of the Westin Key West. I hope for the best there. P.S. I will say that the food from Room Service was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “A Hilton with lipstick”
Reviews.Author: kulgar
Reviews.Content: The staff are wonderful, they were all very helpful and great to deal with. The problem is that when you think "Westin", this is the skeleton of a Hilton. The rooms for the most part have problems with noise from AC condensors, theirs or the neighbors, or there's a boat in the harbor with a diesel generator running all night. The buildout and service are great with marble and all that but the layout is Hilton with a small bathroom, one sink and you wonder if that the structural concrete with the cracks in the ceiling is coming down anytime soon. If you don't run the AC all the time the noise from the infrastructure or the drunks coming past your room until 2:30AM screaming "bleep you" at their spouse (probably too common in Key West so maybe not a fault here) will drive you nuts. The location is tremendous, the staff excellent but figure out which room you are going to get before you pay the $400/ for a room. Inside northeast (elevators on the west side), outside southwest or outside northwest appeared to be the best rooms for the lower rates. Anything Gulf side is great except those blocked by the tent for the restaurant, the cruise ships come in late and leave before sunset so don't let that bother you. You could actually pay a mint and have an inside ground floor room with a view of the hot tub pumps that run 24/7. The staff were great about moving us but look at the room, open the patio door and figure out if you can handle the ambient noise before settling down. You can put lipstick on a pig but it's still a pig. The staff were great, I can't emphasize that enough, and while they are Westin quality, the building isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Wife birthday”
Reviews.Author: harrellrw
Reviews.Content: Took my wife to Westin Jan 9-13 for her birthday,hotel was great staft was great,best location in Key West. Walk everywhere. Only draw back there is no beach and small pool. View is out standing from Westin Sun Deck. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great big disaster”
Reviews.Author: conchconch
Reviews.Content: we had booked room with OCEAN VIEW reservations told me Beautiful Ocean view from my balcony. When we arrived in our room we were SHOCKED to see that our balcony view was that of a small fenced in lot with Massive,LOUD air conditioning units. Went to tell the manager of my Dissatisfaction and after waiting for 20 minutes she gave us another room Stating that it was better room.When we went to our new room we found to our Dissmay that it was the same exact view just two rooms over. Went to speak to manager once again and after another 20 minutes on computer told us NO ROOMS AVAILABLE that we were PROMISED.We did not stay,being completely Disgusted . We had to spend two hours trying to find another hotel,LUCKILY we did manage to find one,A TRUE FOUR STAR HOTEL.This was our first westin experience and Deffinetly our LAST. Would NOT reccomend to any family or friends

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but flawed”
Reviews.Author: LarryNY
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, but i believe it barely gets 4 stars. more like 3.5. On the positive side, arguably the best location in key west. Its a lively location, adjacent to the cruise ship pier. Marvel at the behemoths, at they perch right out your door step. Watch the sunset from above mallory square at the hotel bar, or walk a few feet, and watch the street performers ply their trade during the sunset festivities. dont forget to purchase fried conch from the vendor closest to the cruise ship terminal. best conch on the island! the front desk staff was friendly and professional. Same for the bellman. however a huge minus, the other hotel staff, never greeted you. they seemed indiffirent. This is unacceptable for a hotel charging almost $500 night in high season. In addition, for this lofty sum, you get only an average size room, smallish , but modern and remodeled bathroom. The pool is nothing exciting either, and in early January is mostly in the shade in the morning and late afternoon (not sure about the rest of the day, as i wasnt around to observe sun conditions between 11 and 4). To sum up, for location, it cant be beat. This hotel, as far as im concerned is price driven, and paying anything over 250-300 night..not quite sure its worth it. as an aside, I heartily recomend a day at sunset key. the concierge can give you all the information.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased Overall with the Westin Key West”
Reviews.Author: pirnha
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Westin Key West Resort and for the most part we have nothing but positive things to say about it. The location is definitely the biggest plus. The resort is just a short walk away from most of the Key West attractions that you'll want to see including Duval Street and Mallory Square. The convenience makes for a much more enjoyable Key West experience. The facilities are above-average. The pool is cramped and didn't really make us want to hang out there. The workout room is also a bit on the smallish side. There are some decent shops that are also a part of the hotel. The rooms are comfortable and spacious enough. If you've never stayed at a Westin, the Heavenly Beds do live up to your expectations. My wife and I slept incredibly well every night (though perhaps all of the Duval Street drinks influenced that...). Our only real complaint about the room was the lack of a DVD player. Oh, and we were confronted with a huge cockroach on the wall one afternoon, but after getting rid of it we had no other bug issues. One other note on the rooms - they are very quiet and it seems like the hotel has solid insulation from noise. Our friends would knock on the wall of the adjoining room and we could barely hear it. Excellent if you're next to a family with screaming kids. Bistro 245 serves up some really good breakfast and lunch - I'd recommend grabbing a bite there during your stay since it's so convenient. I would not recommend getting drinks at the Sunset Deck, though. Sure, the view of sunset is hard to beat but the bartenders are slower than death. We had four people spread out across the bar trying to get a drink at one point and they wouldn't even look at us. The staff overall was friendly and helpful - no complaints there. We made all of our own plans so we never utilized the services of the concierge desk. We attempted to take advantage of the access to the private beach at Sunset Key but it was sold out by the time we tried to book it. We heard that it was the best beach in Key West so I'd recommend calling early to book a cabana there. In summary, the Westin Key West is an excellent hotel to stay at for a Key West vacation whether you're partying with friends or with your family.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly managed property”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMarshall
Reviews.Content: We booked a one-bedroom oceanfront suite online through American Express. For platinum members, American Express and many hotels will negotiate certain benefits such as breakfast included with stay. This is not unusual with most of the superior hotels that accommodate us for the $675/day for 5 nights. When we checked in we asked if breakfast were included and we were told it was only with the Westin Sunset Cottages on the island across from us with American Express in which we retorted they were booked and the front desk clerk simply shrugged her shoulders. Yes the previous reviews were correct. The hotel is under renovation. This hotel is sadly neglected and strange because it appears there was no construction crew working. Besides all of the other unseemly filth, the hot tub was broken for the majority of our stay. Often an organization's culture is reflected by the tone of its employees. These were not happy employees. This was the most obvious by a concierge who told us that we were unable to go to the beach at the Sunset Key Cottage resort "even if we were Starwood Platinum Preferred Guests with thousands of points." This is precisely why we wanted to stay at the Westin in the first place was because of the opportunity to take the ferry over to utilize the beach. We paid $20 a piece the next day after getting up at 8 am (wakeup call was 15 minutes late) to stand in line for tickets (got the last 2 out of 20 tickets the concierge reminded my husband) for the ferry to get across only to find out that guests at Casa Marina Resort's concierge calls in and takes the guests over for free. Not only am I certain that a Westin executive would not stay at this property, I am certain that we will never become Starwood Preferred Guests...why would we ever want to be treated so well?

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to check the cruise ship schedule”
Reviews.Author: CleveTraveler011
Reviews.Content: We reserved an "ocean front" suite and did not review it before checking in. Upon checking in we opened the window to see nothing but a huge cruise ship. Also the ships smoke stack discharge drifted into our room with a diesel smell Those cruise ships were in port out whole stay and blocked the view except when they left at night, of course after dark. They also docked a large (157 foot) personal yacht right outside our window. We requested to leave a day early because of these concerns and had to demand to be released early which they wanted to charge us for. They finally consented after going through two different persons. Our stay was scheduled for 5 days, four nights but after three we were disappointed and left. Make sure to check you room location!

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near a 5 or 4 star "resort"”
Reviews.Author: FinalTry
Reviews.Content: We stay at Westin hotels frequently and my career is in the travel industry. I was extremely disappointed with the hotel and it's lack of amenities. 1. We paid as price that would be comparable to a 5 star hotel. Unfortuantely, the hotel was going through renovations and did NOT reduce the room prices during this time period. * Carpets were worn * Furniture was distressed and in need of replacement * The walls and rooms needed painting. 2. They offered us an "upgrade" which put on on the ground floor next to the restaurant garbage cans. Our view was of the NUMEROUS cruise ships that dock right in front of the hotel. Therefore, we had no view and were awoken every morning at 7:00 - 8:00am with the "Shipboard Announcements" 3. There is no spa service -- much to my disappointment. 4. There is no Kids Club -- much to the disappointment of my 7-year old. 5. We ate a Bistro's. Very good food, but the wait staff wore dirty, pilled clothing. 6. No pool side service. 7. The pool is not heated and mostly shaded. Benefits: They are close to Duval Street and Mallory Square. Additionally, they have a wonderful front desk staff and the conceirge, Jane, is terrific. Housekeeping was very good, too. In my opinion, this hotel should be rated a high 3 or low 4 star hotel, given the lack of amenities and services. The location is not entirely a benefit, with all the cruise ships it is very loud and disappointing. I would recommend this hotel if you can get a room at a bargin basement price (less than $200), otherwise I would stay at another resort.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ddtluv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin from Oct 31 - Nov 5. I cannot say anything bad about the hotel. The hotel is in a perfect location. It is walking distance from the main action of Duval Street and the marina area is very nice. The view of the ocean is definitely blocked when the cruiseships come rolling in, but they were only there 2 of the 5 days we stayed. The rooms are kept clean and I believe most of the rooms have been renovated. Even though they have improved the bathroom, sink areas - it didn't seem the hotel thought the furniture or TVs should be updated. Every staff member we came in contact with was very friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Westin was AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: TaraLyn24
Reviews.Content: The Westin Key West was a great experience all around! Upon arrival they gave us the option to upgrade to an ocean view room at no charge. Our room was perfect - located on the corner of the hotel over looking Mallory Square with an great balcony!! We have to thank Karen at the front desk for picking that room for us!! The conceirge was incredibly informative and helpful! The only name I can remember is Diane, but everyone was great!! They helped us decide which cruises we wanted to take and gave us all of the infomation about what to check out locally!! We highly recommend the Danger adventures (including Wind and Wine and the half day of snorkling and kayaking) I read about the cruise ships docking outside of the Westin - so I was not surprised when a GIANT disney cruise ship ended up at the dock. Luckily it was only there for about 12 hours and didn't really disrupt our stay. It would have been a bummer to have one there for days thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Korin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only about 2 blocks from Duval and is beside Mallory Square where there are lots of activities at sunset. The bar on the 2nd level is the best place to watch the sunset. Rooms are what you would expect from a Westin. I thought it was overpriced as is most places in Key West. The OCean view rooms facing the courtyard have a limited view. There are also great views in the rooms that are truly ocean view with the balcony facing the water. I have stayed here several times on business and would stay here again. The Crown Plaza (La Concha) is also a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: oob2kw
Reviews.Content: We got married in KW & stayed (then it was the Hilton). Each September we go back & stay at the Westin. September is during hurricane season...the room rates are less than. The staff has ALWAYS gone over & beyond! We have stayed at other hotels in KW...BUT this is by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: erudite1956
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin Key West the last week of July 2008. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel is undergoing construction. When we arrived, we were placed in a newly renovated room, which has been remodeled to remove the bathtub. We asked to be moved to a room with a bathtub, and were placed in one of the unremodeled rooms. This room was on a wing with active construction, and when we arrived back at the hotel around noon, we were greeted with the sound of jackhammers. (You know that commercial where the guy is trying to talk to his wife over the jackhammers -- yeah, like that). Obviously, this wasn't acceptable, so we went back to the front desk and asked to be moved a second time away from the construction. The manager's response to our request was -- "Didn't you check the website, we've posted that the hotel is undergoing construction." After explaining to him that freedom from jackhammer noise from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. was not actually a luxury, but pretty basic to a hotel experience, whether or not it was noted on the website, we were moved once again. No bathtub but better than jackhammers. The next room was fine. The beds were very comfortable and the support staff (housekeeping, bellmen, etc.) were friendly and helpful. There is a ceiling fan in the room which was nice. The rooms have Starbucks coffee makers which make a cup at a time and unlike most hotel coffee makers, the coffee is very good. We asked for and were provided a refrigerator in our room at no charge. The televisions are old and reception is poor. There was a lot of static on ALL of the televisions in all three rooms. There is no real desk in the room, only a small table. The rooms have balconies with a table and two chairs. The marina shopping area isn't extensive and is very expensive. Also, cruise boats dock there so the view is blocked for days at a time. "Ocean-view" rooms, therefore, are sometimes ocean view and sometimes not. The location is excellent, most attractions and restaurants are within walking distance which is a plus because driving in Key West is a white-knuckle experience. Scooters, bicycles and pedestrians dart out in front of cars without regard to stoplights. The streets are narrow and there is little parking. If a parking place is located, it costs 25 cents for 10 minutes. Overall, we had a mixed experience. I would recommend that travelers refrain from booking at the Westin until the remodeling is completed. For the price, this hotel wasn't a good value.

Reviews.Title: “The upgrades are absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lovinthesox
Reviews.Content: We couldn't decide where to stay for our May getaway (without kids). We hesitated before cashing in our points at the Westin because we heard it wasn't worth the money/amount of points. We lucked out with one of the newly renovated rooms, and I have to say we absolutely LOVED our room, the experience, and had wonderful service. Upon checking in, our first room was a complete disappointment and what we expected after reading some of the reviews. it was on the first floor, by the pool, and behind a stairwell -- no view either side. We contacted the front desk and had excellent assistance, including an upgrade to a renovated room with a wonderful view. The upgraded room matched the Westin's superb location, excellent bar, and past experiences in other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the view”
Reviews.Author: purplehatartist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in the middle of June and very much enjoyed our stay. We had an oceanfront room, and the view was awesome. The hotel is convenient to everything, and we had no problems even though they are undergoing remodeling. Some rooms near us were under construction at the time, but it did not affect our stay. Noise was minimal, and never at night. One day I hung out at the hotel most of the day (yes, I was a bit hung over!) and we didn't leave our room until after 3:00, and returned around 4:00. During that small window of time, housecleaning had been in and done their thing! I was pleasantly surprised. Food at the hotel was very good. One night we stopped at the outside bar after our wine sunset cruise (awesome!) and had shrimp cocktail and some fruit--it was the best shrimp of the whole trip, and believe me, I tasted a LOT of shrimp! They also make a great mojito here. We were there Thursday through Sunday. The cruise ships were there Thurs & Fri, but always gone by 6:30. Didn't really bother us at all, since we weren't in our room during the day on those days. Didn't have time to enjoy the pool, but it looked great.Our only complaint was that during sunset celebration, Cat Man was right under our window, and he was LOUD and ANNOYING! If the hotel hired him, they need to get rid of him. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mandyrey
Reviews.Content: My company planned our sales meeting at the Westin Key West this year (hard life, I know...). Upon arrival, I was impressed with the place. Great location, friendly staff, lots of shopping nearby. Our room was at the end of the main building...right above the gift shop. It had a partial ocean view, and a gorgeous balcony to enjoy it with (plus another smaller balcony!). I would definitely recommend this hotel if you're planning a trip to Key West. It's right where you want to be on the island, and the grounds are very nice. I was told they were doing renovations while we were there, but I never heard any construction going on, so it must have been minimal. The only disappointment I have about my stay in Key West was the weather. It was cloudy and overcast the whole week, so I didn't get to enjoy the oh-so-talked-about sunset on Mallory Square. PS-The lobby is filled with this amazing white tea scent. I was so obsessed with it that I bought a candle! Now I get to enjoy the scent for months! :)

Reviews.Title: “A whole lot of paradise - Sunset Key”
Reviews.Author: bmcfarle
Reviews.Content: July 2008 My spouse and our two kids (16yr old girl and 10 yr old boy) stayed at the Westin Sunset Key from July 5th to July 11th, 6 wonderful nights and 7 wonderful days. We took the long drive from Orlando to Key West in just over 7 hours only to arrive very tired and hot at the Westin front desk to find out our cottage was not ready and we would be staying at the main resort. Disappointed was an understatement, I had booked this cottage on Sunset Key 6 months previously and was in no mood to NOT get the room I reserved. However, I have learned from previous stays at Westin properties, Westin knows how to recover so very well in this type of situation. To make things right, they arranged for us to stay in one of their largest and most luxurious suites in the main hotel, two bedrooms, two baths, four balconies, dinning room and a massive foyer. Plus chilled champage and chocolate covered strawberries. Next morning our cottage was ready at the crack of dawn and we were in our wonderful cottage before noon. After a rocky start, and great recovery by the management at the Westin, after a short 5 minute boat ride to Sunset Key we were greeted by the Westin concierge at the dock. He showed us the most beautiful grounds, beach, pool, dining and of course our cottage. The cottage is nothing short of gorgeous, extremely large bedrooms, THREE full bathrooms all with huge showers. Beds were the most comfortable I have ever experienced at any hotel, I looked forward to them each and every night. The decor was truly beach like, blues and yellows thoughout, nautical touches everywhere and siding on the inside walls of the living area, a very neat touch that made us feel like we were in beach house. Fans in each room kept things nice and cool, windows everywhere which made this a very bright space. Concierge was extraordinary, she (Bridget) was most pleasant and helpful the entire stay, thank you so much. Each morning they leave you with a basket of fresh baked muffins, breads and danish slices, plus oranges and bananas and USA Today. We make the mistake of buying other breakfast stuff which was a huge mistake, the breakfast basket is MORE than enough for the 4 of us. The sand and beach and water were excellent. They have two beach attendants who spent most of their time in the shade NOT helping us. Only when you asked for help, would they help, they never brought towels or chair pads voluntarily. I think their lack of help was due to the fact that we did not purchase mass quantities of drinks from them. The crew on the boat launch was great, always friendly always great to give you tips on what to do and where to eat. Speaking of eating, we ate at the Rooftop Cafe in Key West, which was excellent, highly recommended. In summary, my spouse and I, who have travelled extensively, cruised, all inclusives, hotels, rental houses, etc, etc, would say this was the best vacation ever. It was FAR from cheap, in fact it was expensive BUT everything was so beautiful and wonderful it was worth the expense and we would do the Westin Sunset Key again. If you don't have the money, you should borrow the money to stay at Sunset Key. Brent

Reviews.Title: “great location high price”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGalOrlando
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews, we were nervous about staying at this hotel. We booked an ocean front room and reading the other reviews about the cruise ships right outside your window made us question whether we wanted to pay the extra for ocean view room. We took our chances and our oceanfront room was very nice and comfortable. Out of 3 nights there, Thurs., Fri. and Sat. nights we only woke to a cruise ship Friday morning. When asked about it, they didn't expect another until Tuesday morning. I was disappointed though because I thought ocean front meant beach front. No beach at this property. Our ocean front room was over the ocean deck where beautiful boats were parked with little shops under our balcony. The cruise ship wasn't on top of us, like I thought it might be from the other reviews, but it did take away the ocean view from 7 a.m. until early afternoon. I like ocean front rooms for the view, which was beautiful there especially at sunset, the beach which wasn't there, the sound of the ocean at night when I open the doors or windows - I couldn't do that here with the shops under us and people roaming the deck. We didn't sit out on the balcony like I thought we would either because of the people being right there. For the $60.00 extra per night, it wasn't really worth ocean front. The pool area looked pretty and the rooms with balconies over that looked nice. For $60.00 less I would go with that view next time. But this hotel is expensive. Still, that is what you have to pay for a very nice place in Key West, I guess. Housekeeping was fine. We had no problem with the cleanliness of the room, but they were really loud while they cleaned the room next door to us mid afternoon when we went back for a little siesta because of the very high heat outside. Housekeeping put that bar across the door to keep the door ajar and they kept going in and out, in and out with the door banging shut loudly at least 10 times in a row! What on earth!?! Were they taking in one towel at a time or something? Why so many extremely loud bangs of that door? At least it wasn't in the middle of the night. That was our only problem with the hotel, except for concierge. A snooty lady was no help there, not friendly at all, but it was probably just that one bad person. A smile, dear. You are a reflection of the hotel after all. Red Fish Blue Fish is a great relaxing bar and grill to walk to for a good shrimp po boy or grouper or dolphin sandwich. The sunset celebration is right there. The Sea Rocket at sunset was a fast fun boat ride and the driver was fun, too. You don't get wet and you just wear whatever you have on. Really fun! The Conch Tour trollley was really good if you want to get on and off at different spots all day, which I highly recommend over the Conch Tour Train, which was excellent for just a tour of the city, with maybe 2 stops vrs. 10 or 11 on the trolley. Both had great drivers who gave wonderful narrations of the city. The Trolley went all thru Key West while the train did not go to the older part of town. Don't go to Key West in the hot summer months unless you want to rest in your room or in the pool during the afternoon hours. It is so so hot!!!! Winter is better. We'll never go in the heat of summer again, but we are over 50, so maybe you younger people can take the heat better. Very hot!!! Overall we had a great time! Lots of walking, of course. Everything is casual but some people dressed up a little for dinner when they went to the nicer restaurants. It was so hot all we wore were shorts though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! But there were issues...”
Reviews.Author: BeerSlinger
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Key West and this hotel. With the exception of the housekeeping, the service was excellent. Housekeeping was barely average. The hotel is undergoing needed renovation, but this did not cause us any problems at all. We stayed for 7 nights, and woke up to cruise ships towering above us twice. Never heard a thing during the night or day, but they did block the view of the ocean until around 4 each day. But, we weren't in the room most of the time anyway. The Concierge, Jeff, was a big help. He hooked us up with a great sunset cruise on an old but refurbished schooner, The Hindu. He then directed us to a fabulous restaurant, The Commodore, for my wife's birthday dinner. Pricey, but worth it for the special occasion. Back to the hotel itself. As a Starwood Preferred Guest, we were upgraded to an ocean view room that had three separate balconies. One overlooked the parking garage, one was small with the noise of the A/C unit, but the other was on the corner, ocean view, and was perfect, with two rocking chairs and a small table. The room was large but the bathroom was small. I am pretty sure this room has not been refurbished yet, but was still in pretty good shape. The pool is small and the pool bar very plain, but the food from the bar was fantastic! We had one of our most memorable meals at the pool! I had the Grouper Sandwich and my wife had the Veggie Wrap. Both were outstanding! Since it was the middle of June and neither my wife nor I are "sun worshipers", we enjoyed lounging at the pool, in the shade - I just wish there was more of it! Only about a dozen lounge chairs that stayed shady most of the afternoon and they were prime commodities. The location is perfect for Key West. Only a block over from "Lower Duval St." and all of the activity. No need for a car. But the bikes we rented were helpful. We will return to Key West and this hotel. It will be a few years, so the renovation should be complete by then.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever - Definitely not Westin caliber”
Reviews.Author: MelisM
Reviews.Content: I wrote this in response to the survey I received from the Westin about my stay. I figured I would just post my response to them here. An additional note, the hotel is undergoing construction through October. This hotel was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The hotel was not westin caliber. It was a cheap hotel with a westin name stuck on the front door. The hotel was undergoing MAJOR CONSTRUCTION. As a guest on vacation I want to relax. this was not possible. First, I was not told about the construction until less than 2 weeks before my arrival - this is unacceptable. This should have been on the website and guests should be told of this when booking. When I received the email from the westin about the construction, I emailed the hotel to tell them that I was very unhappy and that I want to be sure that my stay was not affected by the construction - I DID NOT RECEIVE A RESPONSE. I then called the hotel and spoke with someone who told me that my stay would not be affected and that it was "just a few rooms" that they were renovating. I specifically requested to be kept away from the renovation. I was told that she could "put a note in my file". When we arrived we were upgraded to an oceanview room - this should have been the first warning for us. We stayed on the second floor of the building adjacent to the lobby. We were one of 3 rooms on the floor that were not undergoing MASSIVE CONSTRUCTION!! There were holes in the hallway walls, construction workers all over the halls, crumbled drywall everywhere (in the carpets, stairs, elevators), the smell of paint from the rooms, tarps, stain, DRILLING, POUNDING, HAMMERING, SAWING all day!!! It was absolutely appalling. The rooms was dirty and old - rug was stained, wall paper was peeling off of the walls in the bathroom, rust on all of the hinges and faucets, dirty bed skirt, slider didn't open well, etc. The bathroom was so small you could barely get in - you had to go behind the door in order to shut the door - same with the balcony (2ft by 3??). Cruise ships pull up every day in front of the "ocean view" - which by the way is a harbor view not an ocean view. There was no pool service (get you own towels, drinks, food, etc). The pool bar was atrocious - I considered taking a picture of it to put on trip advisor because it was so bad - it looked like a bar that someone set up in the corner of their backyard deck -bar stools from the 70s, rusty paper towel rack on the wall, box fan blowing, and $11 drinks! I don't mind paying $11 for a drink, but 1) it was 6 ounces and 2) it was in a dump. One night we came back late and asked the front desk if there was a vending machine that we could get bottled water from. We were told no and that we should use the minibar. I told the night manager that I did not want to use the minibar and that I found it hard to believe that a hotel of this size did not have a vending machine. I was told it didn't. We drank the $5 waters from the minibar and then found the vending machine in our building (2 floors up) the next day. Had we not had been using Starpoints to stay 2 nights for free, I would have checked out immediately. We did pay for the first night $422.00, which was the biggest rip off ever. To stay in a place, not undergoing renovation, but undergoing construction!! during our stay was unacceptable. Even the hotel staff commented to us when we complained that they thought that the building we were staying in should have been closed during construction because it was such a mess. This was by far not only my worst Westin stay, but my worst hotel stay ever. To call this a Westin (and a resort!!) is deceitful. By the way, we stayed at the Marquesa Hotel during the first half of our trip and it was wonderful. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be enticed by the location, give the hotel a miss”
Reviews.Author: UKGlobetrotterUK
Reviews.Content: Last November my wife and I visited Key West and called in at the Westin. In the past we have always been very pleased with Westin hotels but not this time. Whilst there my wife had what was supposed to be a hot cooked Turkey and Bacon sandwich from a concession on the property. It was dreadful still partly frozen! Unfortunately she had eaten part of it before making the discovery. Not surprisingly she was later diagnosed as suffering from acute food poisoning. Despite complaints at the time and subsequently we have had neither satisfactory recompense nor explanation. The staff at the hotel were less than interested and it just seemed like barriers were put in our way if wanted to pursue it. We have tried but they are just not interested. Key West is a busy place and the Westin is in a superb spot. They probably have plenty of demand. Unfortunately this may colour their attitude to service â€“ we wonâ€™t be returning any time soon. Westin is normally a great franchise but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: exumabahamas
Reviews.Content: The Westin Hotel is great, if you have a lot of money to spend. The rooms are simple at best, yet the staff is incredible. If you do stay there (and happen to get a great rate as we did), make sure you get over to Sunset Key. It was incredible. The 5 minute ride by boat was fun, and then you're on your own tropical island being waited on hand & foot by your own cabana boy. What a great time. Everything about this place is incredible. The food was fabulous, the drinks were tropical and fruity. We spent the entire day there and felt like royalty. We were pampered from start to finish. Here's a tip - tip the cabana boy (the one who gets your food and drink). We gave him $20.00 (I think he deserved at least that much for all the running around we made him do). My husband and I and another couple were the only 4 people on the beach. What a great day, and then we topped it off with a sunset dinner cruise (see my review under Key West sunset dinner cruise). The hotel pool is nice, but it was too warm to go into. We did hang out there though. The sunset bar on the second level is also fun - to watch everyone down on Mallory Square and the great sunsets. Yes - if you have an oceanfront room (like we did) - you're view will be obscured by cruise ships during the day. The room was extremely quiet & clean. We were in room 104 (king size room). The property is quite large so plan on walking around. The great thing though too was, it was only a 5 minute walk to Duval Street where all the action is. The heavenly bed was just that - heavenly. Everything about the hotel is great. I would definitely stay here again if I got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Location awesome”
Reviews.Author: hepburntracy
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights May 3 & 4 this past year and had a great time. The room was very small but beautiful, all white with a plantation theme. We had booked a garden room but ended up on the side facing Mallory Square and had a corner view of the ocean, very tiny balcony. The best thing about the hotel is the location. There are only a few hotels/resorts like this right on the water on that (fun) side of the island. I would definitely not risk booking an ocean view due to the cruise ships. There was a new one there every day that would block your view. However, you are right next to Mallory Square and every night can just walk down to watch the performers and have a drink. There's a great Cuban restaurant right next door also. We didn't spend too much time in the room, but just being down by the water, "tottering" distance from the bars on the western end of Duval Street made the higher room rate very worth it for us. Plus the room was very clean, fresh and comfortable. The staff was also extremely friendly and helpful, we got an early check-in for no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, understaffed, underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Greenblat
Reviews.Content: If you took away the 'Westin' branding, you would never think about staying at this property (let alone paying the rates they charge). This property was not up to scratch and was so unbelievably overpriced for what it was. THE PROPERTY Westin "Marina and Resort?" Marina? - well it is on the docks where cruise ships release hundreds upon hundreds of tourists each day to hang around the commercial areas of the hotel (and yes, as per previous posts, the cruise ships do obscure the "ocean view" until about 6 p.m.) Resort? - hardly. The property layout is ridiculous. There are two buildings spread out across public areas of the Key West marina (think hundreds of college students walking around drinking beers and street performers). There was only one restaurant (which was very poor). A very small hotel pool (which was equally poor). If you have every stayed in a great beach resort, think of the things that made your stay great (beautiful rooms, great food, friendly staff, amazing pool, near the beach etc.. etc...). Now imagine the exact opposite - bingo Key West Resort and Marina. ROOMS Tired. So very tired. Cracked tiles and roof. Dents in the plaster. Broken safe (the bolts "securing" the safe to the cabinet were stored inside without being attached to anything - you could carry the safe with you). Beat-up old tub. Uncollected dishes outside rooms. Room service carts everywhere (and trolleys full of sheets ets randomly placed around the halls). Half of the floors was being renovated. Housekeeping was also poor. Each day our room was not made up until 5 p.m. No evening turndown service (normally I wouldn't care, but at $400 per night... come on) STAFF Where were they? Normally a large beach 'resort' would be buzzing with staff. Friendly staff who greeted you when you walked around. When you saw a staff member, they didn't even acknowledge you. Bell desk was understaffed the entire time we were there. We waited for our bags for 25 mins when checking-in and about 30 mins when checking out. The valet was clearly overwhelmed by the number of cars being called. The property seemed to be trying to save costs by reducing staff numbers. The result - poor service. The front desk were all smiles at check-in. Go to them with a special request or a problem, and they couldn't be bothered. OVERALL This property was a waste of money. Don't be fooled by the Westin brand - it is lipstick on a pig.

Reviews.Title: “yikes.....under construction”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiTravelmom
Reviews.Content: wow...went for Destination Wedding......this is hardly a resort, rooms were old ,dated old motel bathrooms, broken furniture, upon arrival per email from hotel they announce "under Construction"..........the dishes from the previous occupant were in the hall in front of our door upon arrival and stayed until late Saturday night............and I did not call the front desk......I am not spending real money to police the hotel.....I had more expectations from a Westin property..

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some not so good, but adequate overall.”
Reviews.Author: newtomd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 3 nights and the Hyatt for 1 night, while in Kew West. We stayed at the Hyatt first, which was a spectacular boutique hotel (the walk in shower at the Hyatt was larger than our entire bathroom at the Westin). However, while quirky and older, the Westin had some pluses. There are two buildings at the Westin, the Marina Building (which has the front desk) and the Main Building, which has the pool and restaurants. We stayed in the Main Building on the second floor. About a third of the second floor was being renovated during our stay. There was some noise during the day but it was not overly intrusive. I did see inside one of the rooms being renovated and it was totally gutted. The rooms will still be small, but I expect they will be modernized. The cruise ships that others mention tend to park in front of the Marina Building, rather than the Main Building, but due to configuration, there would be minimal direct Gulf view rooms in the Main Building. Our room had obviously not been renovated and it was dated and dinged. The view from our room was horrible as was the noise was unbearable on the patio from the AC system outside. However, we had a great deal on the room and did not complain (kinda expected one worst rooms based upon our price). The beds as usual were comfy and inside the room it was quiet enough. Maid service was inconsistent at best. We broke a glass on the patio and left a note for the maid to clean it up. Not sure if there was a language barrier or not, but she ignored the note and left the broken glass on the patio. Additionally, the same day our toiletries were not restocked and all of out towels were not replaced. The pool was nice, clean, and relatively quiet, mostly adults but a few families. Some of the families were more courteous to the other guests than some others who let their kids run wild despite having the only kids at the pool (not sure why anyone would bring younger kids to Key West in the first place but that is another issue). They came around occasionally with fresh fruit at the pool, which was a nice touch. The food and beverage at the Westin was excellent. I can honestly say that I had my best meal in Key West at the pool bar for lunch (a fish sandwich), and we went to some relatively expensive meals at well regarded restaurants. Additionally, the bar service was very good at every bar and every time of day. Dale at the pool bar was a master of the mojito. The location is great, right on Mallory Square, close to everything on the busy end of Duvall. All in all a nice stay, not the best rooms, but an adequate hotel with some pluses. If you can get a renovated room, it would likely be better.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort”
Reviews.Author: marklar2008
Reviews.Content: No complaints - had the best suite in the hotel. We'll definitely go back! Perfect location, great staff though the pool could be a little larger and not surrounded by the hotel itself. You dont get as much sun and have no view other than that of the surrounding rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanfront - Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: Rhubarbmaster
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin Key West Resort & Marina, from April 20-26th. We had booked online at spg.com for Starwoods Preferred Guests and had booked an Oceanfront Room and specified, "true Oceanfront Room with high floor" On arrival we received a fairly friendly welcome, once we arrived at room we ventured out onto a puny balcony for our "Oceanfront "view of a marina and view of a large berthed Yacht and an even larger Cruise ship, no Ocean View and definitely not Ocean "Front". A quick trip back to the front desk, resulted in being offered an alternative room, that was truly oceanfront, Suite 163, that while on the ground floor, provided a superb Oceanfront View, twin rocking chairs on a large patio and a great vantage point for the daily "Sunset Celebration". The pool area and pool are quite compressed, but we never had difficulty in finding chairs to hang out there. We had breakfast twice and dinner once at the Oceanfront Bistro 245, and both the food and service were very good. We took advantage of the Sunset Key Island on three occasions across the Harbour and accessible by launch. This is an excellent guest feature that you should check out and is well worth the $20 per person fee. Although the description of the fee as being "nominal" (dictionary defined as: "being trifling in comparison with the actual value") is not really accurate. Twenty bucks is a lot of dough and I encountered several guests at the concierge desk who were "sticker shocked" at the fee. Get to concierge desk before the 8:00 opening. I discovered showing up at 9:00 that they had already sold out the beach passes that are apparently capped at 40 per day. Even then you should take the first boat out to the beach at 9:15, as after that time the lone beach attendant is scrambling to secure chairs for everyone. We had both lunch and dinner at the Latitudes restaurant at the Sunset Key Island, which featured outstanding food and service, and an unbelievable setting. You must check this place out. The overall staff experience was top-notch, very friendly, courteous quite attentive and responsive. The only exception was a very negative experience when we made an inquiry at the front desk of the Sunset Key Island adjacent to the Latitudes Restaurant on last Wednesday after lunch. Given that we were essentially paying a daily $40 premium to visit the Beach there, we were curious on the price differential between an Oceanfront Room at the Westin and a One Bedroom cottage at the Sunset Key, if it was minor we would've upgraded and stayed there for the balance of our stay. The receptionist there, dismissively babbled out the Westin website address and suggested that we check out room rate availability and pricing there online and advised that she did not have any pricing information as they were in the process of changing the rates. None of this response rung true it appeared that we were getting the "not subtle at all" brush off by this brusque individual. When I advised that I was well aware off the website and we had booked our reservation there initially, and I was quite serious in my inquiry. She responded that if I we were "really, really, really, serious" that she would look into this. Finally, she quickly advised that there was no room availability on the Friday in any event. Her unpleasant treatment was the only exception to otherwise excellent customer service that we had encountered. This particular employee is better suited to a back of the house role, versus front of the house role -- one far removed from direct guest interactions. My other observation would be on the housekeeping, that I would describe as a cursory "once over" only versus a thorough room cleaning process. Also, our room was near a staff lunchroom and we had to, on more than one occasion, run a gauntlet of staffers hanging out in the hallway adjacent to it, and once immediately directly in the alcove in front of our door blocking access to our room. While obviously staff need to have their lunch and rest area, management should advise and attune the staff on the poor guest optics of congregating and loitering in spaces adjacent to guest rooms. We also once encountered a staff person having a post lunch siesta in the shade of a palm tree immediately adjacent to our room patio. Advice: Be insistent on getting a true Oceanfront room at the time of check in. Management's definition of this and a reasonable guest's expectation vary greatly. During our short stay I overheard numerous guests complaining about this fact. Westin should differentiate between an Oceanfront and a OceanView/Marina View and price accordingly. Their current pricing practice is quite dubious at best. Overall though an top-notch vacation and the Westin Key West Resort is clearly one of, if not the best, properties in the Key West area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: JimfBearDE
Reviews.Content: We spent a week @ the Westin 4/9 to 4/16/08. An early check in was possible and went smooth with no problems. The staff was friendly and courteous. This was our seventh visit to Key West and are familiar with most of the hotels. The rooms at the Westin are nice and comfortable and above average for Key West. They are however in need of minor updating which we noticed was ongoing. Cruise ships do block the view of the Gulf when they are in port, but we spend little time in the room so this did not concern us. Starbucks coffee in the room was a plus. Room service was quick and polite. The bars are also staffed with courteous and attentive staff. If you get a chance visit Sunset Key for lunch or dinner. It's expensive but worth it if nothing else other than the view . All in all a fine experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: kaperin0
Reviews.Content: Just back and still excited about our first visit to Key West. This hotel was a great experience from the moment of arrival to departure. The staff was accommodating and a pleasure to deal with. We requested connecting King rooms with another couple and when my birthday was mentioned we received an upgrade to a suite. The living room bedroom combination had four small balcony's for two with an ocean view. Sunsets are spectacular there with easy access to the pool. the concierge was helpful and accommodating. We were to dine at Latitudes for my birthday but canceled due to high winds and a cold front. They graciously accepted the cancellation and made certain the reasons were known to accommodated us as necessary. We ate at Kelly's and had a great Happy Hour there. Blue Heaven for breakfast is a must. You can walk everywhere from this hotel if in relatively good health and have comfortable shoes. The Ghost tour was fun, and the Conch train a nice ride with some history of the island............The hot tub here was clean and the rooms were spotless. Look for the hair dryer in the closet!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best of westin”
Reviews.Author: dpuck1998
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is not the best Westin I've stayed, it was a fine stay. The grounds are very nice, but the rooms leave a bit to be desired. I guess its true that its about location because the location is hard to beat. The price was high but the stay was fine. Our room was more of a motel, but that seems to be the status quo for Key West. We were steps from Mallory Square and LOTS of activities. I would be inclined to stay elsewhere next trip, just to try something new but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, view is amazing one day, horrible the next”
Reviews.Author: dcs194
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in mid-March. I have to say I was impressed with the rooms, maybe a little below Westin standards, but still nice. I have stayed at nicer Westins in Chicago and New York, but this by no means is an average hotel. The views were amazing on two of the four days we were there. Be mindful of the cruise ships. Most of them leave by sunset (city rules). We stayed in a room on the second floor with a side view, which has more privacy, but still has a great ocean view. The best reco. I can give........use the Westin to your advantage and go to Sunset Key for the day. They charge you $20/person/day to use the beach, but it is worth it. If you are looking for a quiet beautiful beach in key west, this is the only place to go. They only allow ~40 people from the Westin over in one day, no one is allowed on the island unless you have a house, are going over for lunch opr have beach passes. Get your passes early. We went over there for a day and felt like movie stars, maybe 15 people were on the beach with us all day long, the closest couple to us was about 100 feet away, total privacy....only drawback was that they close the beach at 5:30PM....we stayed for the sunset anyway....

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Westin Key West”
Reviews.Author: Yankees21
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed in a suite at the Westin Feb 19-21st. You couldn't ask for a better location in Key West. The hotel is right near Mallory Square and has a beautiful deck for watching the sunset if you don't want to be in the middle of all of the Mallory Square action. We sat by the pool during the day. The pool is nice, not fantastic, but nice. I do think that someone should be around to tell children to get out of the hot tub. We had breakfast on the property one day. It was good and what you would expect from a Westin property. The front desk was helpful and accomodating. This hotel is within walking distance of all shops, bars and restaurants in Key West. I spoke to a man at the pool who spends a week here every year and has been doing so for 10 yrs. I hope to return someday too.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Is Great”
Reviews.Author: PANAV
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Westin in the Florida Keys on Thursday and Our room was ready great view you could see the water and the beds are Heavenly. That would be were they get Heavenly Bath and Bed. WE have stayed here before so we knew what to expect. It is a little expensive, But I love the location. Mallory Square is right out your door. The Beds are great everyone that we encountered that worked there were great. WE will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: frickypa
Reviews.Content: I booked an Ocean-front room a few months in advance and as expected, paid a premium. The room was ocean-front, very clean and comfortable. The balcony was incredibly small and there was a different cruise ship blocking the entire ocen view for at least 4 of the seven days that I stayed there. In addition, the view from the balcony was partially blocked by 2 large bushes. I unsuccessfully requested a room upgrade or higher floor, as a Starwood Preferred Gold member. The bed was very comfotable. Housekeeping did an excellent job. Since I only had an ocean view for a very limited time, I believe the room charge was excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Westin is lucky they have the best location”
Reviews.Author: bayemerald
Reviews.Content: I am lucky that I am a starpoint member and had my entire stay for free and the Westin is lucky they have the BEST location--can not be beat by anyone else, HOWEVER even with all that the stay was a 2 on a scale of 1-10, VERY dissapointing. The Westin refuses to renovate because they have the best location and get the crowds so they figure why bother. Paint chiped furniture, clogged toilets, slow service and tood that was just adequate! The worst was the pool, PAINFULLY COLD WATER. They say it is heated but even after a day of sun beating down on the water and the air temp being 85F it was still freeezing cold!

Reviews.Title: “loved the westin”
Reviews.Author: ryno26
