Reviews.Content: This hotel may be a little more $ than others, but if you want : comfort, good service, and a great location, then this property cannot be beat in KW. fyi: I think some folks here who had a bad room stayed in just that, a bad room on the first floor; I noticed there was a general smell/dampness to that first level We had a 1BR suite on the 4th floor and it was truly awesome, so if you can swing it, go to a HIGHER level!; the view was incredible as well!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel, subpar Westin”
Reviews.Author: jscdjjk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near lots of tourists' attractions and is right on the marina. The pool and the fitness center are quite nice too. We stayed in a one bed apt on the fourth floor with ocean view and a double balcony. It was so noisy outside that we never used the balcony. The room was disappointing and needed renovation and more furnishing. The bathroom was tiny, smaller than bathrooms in standard rooms. Although we had a 'kitchen" it was not outfitted and there was only a fridge and a tiny sink, and the rest of the room was bare. The service was also quite inadequate. One elevator did not work during our entire stay of 5 nights, and the other working elevator is very slow and out of date. When we complained that the wireless internet did not work, no one (except the manager) wanted to hear about it and we were told that since it was complimentary, we should not have expect it to work! Overall, we thought a Westin should be a safe choice but was disappointed by our experience in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not My First Choice...”
Reviews.Author: Bliss914
Reviews.Content: Our room had various issues, the toliet leaked, the bathroom door had rusted hinges, the bathroom sink wouldn't drain...I don't know who calls the sheets "heavenly" - they obviously don't know high quality bedding. The service at their resturant Bistro 245 was horrible - food was average. I think travelers could find a lot more elsewhere for their money. Despite what lacks in the hotel, the location is wonderful - it's close to everything and walking is a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Family stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: lifeisgoodtome
Reviews.Content: My family of five - hubby and I and our 3 kids - stayed at the Westin for 5 nights starting January 1st. We really enjoyed our stay despite record-breaking cold weather (hey, it beat shoveling the record-breaking snow back home!). I'm a hospitality consultant who breaks everything down to particulars so here are my thoughts/observations: Service - I experienced nothing but very good to excellent service throughout the hotel. The front desk people upgraded us from two requested adjoining rooms to a 2BR suite (K/QQ/Living area with three dormer balconies as described in another recent review). Because of the weather we ended up spending more time in the room than usual and the extra space made a big difference. Every trip to the front desk was quick, friendly, and efficient. Top notch attitude, even when they were slammed at check in/check out. A+! Housekeeping was friendly and accommodating to our changing requests on when to service our room. The turn down staff caught on and started leaving all the chocolates in the kids' room. Room servers were great and all of our orders were timely and correct, same with poolside servers. Pool staff always had clean towels and picked up the ones left by guests. Restaurants- Here is a really great thing about this Westin: they have an awesome kids menu( the Kids Club menu). Real food like french toast, salmon filet, and creative kids desserts and I don't think one item is over $4. Hands down the cheapest and best food for the kids we found on the island. I could feed my kids, including dessert, delivered to the room for less than $20 including tip. The same menu is available at Bistro. That's a deal! We ate at Bistro 245 twice. Our meals were very good and one was excellent. We were happy with everything. Our food was slowed a little (we ate during sunset rush) but our server was great. We had drinks at the Sunset Deck and down by the pool. Whatever that green slushy drink is, it's tasty and goes down quickly and is made even better with an extra shot on top. ; ) Bartenders were attentive. Property - This location can't be beat, even with the cruise ships docked. Central to everything, walking distance to everything (maybe not Smathers Beach). Because of the weather we didn't get over to Sunset Key beach, but we took a boat around the island and it looks fabulous. Overall I thought the property looked very good. The landscaping is beautiful throughout the hotel. There are some minor maintenance needs, but the common and public areas were clean and attended to. Poolside chaises were thickly padded, clean and really comfortable. The Sunset Deck seating could be updated but it was not damaged or in disrepair that we saw. The lobby looks great. They serve orange juice through most of the morning...nice local touch. The business center was small but just what you need: internet, MSOffice, printer. The free wireless internet service in our room worked great, I never got dropped even when moving from room to room or onto the balconies. The hallways were in good shape. It looked like newer carpet, at least on the 4th floor (SPG floor). I really liked the balconies off the elevator lobbies, how nice to have sunshine and open air in the hallway. Our rooms were really nice. The bathrooms were updated - bowed shower curtain, premium Heavenly Bath accouterments - but I would have liked more counter space. Ah, those Heavenly Beds! I love love love love them and wish all hotels had them! Starwood absolutely wins the bed wars with those sweet things. There were desks in each bedroom, both of which had some of the finished chipped off. There was a Hemmingway-esque, weathered look to it but I'm not convinced that is intentional. There were no dressers. Drawers were in the nightstands (2 in the K room, 1 in the QQ room) and there were shelves in the TV armoire. KW is an almost entirely casual place, so I'd think more guests would use drawers than the closet. We had room for all of our stuff, but it seemed kind of awkward. This was bad -- the upholstered furniture must be replaced. The couch in the living room was so stained and torn I can't believe it was in there. I would have complained had I been paying the $1000+/nightly internet rate. The chair and ottoman in the QQ room was also worn and stained. The one aspect of our stay that truly disappointed me is that this Westin advertises that is has "scheduled and supervised children's activities" and it doesn't (not even during peak season). We love Kids Club! It's a huge thing for us, given our kids' ages, and a primary reason we chose this property over another. They list it on both their corporate and rogue websites, and in three places in their in-room amenities book. The reason two staff people gave is that this property isn't really a "resort" hotel. Considering the physical layout and public accessibility of the property, I kind of understand that. But then they should not list resort amenities like Kids Club in their advertising or call it a resort. That is completely misleading. Setting that "resort" expectation is probably the root cause of disappointment noted by some of this Westin's guests. As a hotel, I think this is a great place and Westin quality. But I expect something extra from a Westin resort, and this hotel falls short of my usual exceptional Westin resort experience. Despite my disappointment we all had a great time and loved the hotel. We'd return to KW and choose this hotel again. Service was fabulous and that's very important to me. The location just can't be beat. I'm buying one of those beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sugarmagnolia8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Key West for New Year's Eve at this Westin. It wasn't our first choice but Island City House was booked. This hotel was a very nice place and a wonderful location. We used the hotel website to book the room(s) and I guess due to the holiday it was extremely expensive for a 2 bedroom suite. The suite was called the Simonton Suite and it overlooked the pool on the 4th floor. We had 3 balconies so that was really nice. The balconies are big and have a table/chairs on them. We were supposed to have "Ocean View" which is really "Pool View" which is "Ocean Liner View" if you look to the left ...you often can't see the ocean due to the cruise ship parking. The room consisted of a vestibule and then a door to a very large sitting area (with pull out sofabed), tv, refrigerator and minibar. That room was in the center of the two bedrooms - each could be reached via the vestibule or the living room; one room had a king bed and one room had 2 queen beds - both had a full bath. The beds are "heavenly" as is the shower but the bathrooms are not very luxurious at all. Overall, the room was very large and comfortable but not really Westin-posh and since it was like essentially 2 rooms in one, the price was more than you (or I!) want to know. We got room service quite a few times as we were there for 4 days, and given that the hotel is sort of spaced out along the waterfront, the poor servers are unable to use carts and must carry all the trays. This led to them forgetting a lot of things - probably because it is so much to carry. Room service prices, fare, and quality were just typical. I am not sure what to suggest as for your room requests because it was difficult to ascertain which rooms would have a good view due to the configuration of the hotel. The lobby and ballrooms are in another building entirely, for example. I did not see the fitness center. The business center is fine. There is free wireless internet in the room. The proximity to Duval Street and to the Mallory Square sunset festival cannot be beat. The valet parking was high priced and we drove from Fort Lauderdale but never used the car again , so think about one-way car rentals if you drive, or renting scooters if you fly. They did have a complimentary stroller for our young child so that was very nice. Ask at the front desk if you need. The pool was nice but it was hard to get a seat by it. Many people had taken to running out early in the morning and putting their items upon chairs to "reserve" them as it fills up quickly and very fully. The pool is on the small-ish side and the hot tub is "just ok" (and not really very hot). Poolside bar service is a nice touch however! We tried to buy the (expensive) passes to the beach which is a Westin private island offshore (reached by their boat) but were unable to get any. Apparently they start selling them at 8 a.m. (I wonder how many people woke up on New Years' Day for that?!) but even getting in line for the passes at 7:30 as we did one day does not mean you will get a pass...the consierge said there were only 40 slots available. Overall, it is, as others have stated here, not up to Westin standards (yet?) but a good , albeit quite overpriced, hotel in an awesome location. You will probably have a fine stay if you read the reviews here, follow the tips and know what you are getting into ahead of time. Enjoy the Conch Republic!

Reviews.Title: “Waste of hard earned money...”
Reviews.Author: ajricca
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend this pretty run down hotel. Ocean view really means cruise ship view. Paid $80 to use their private beach!!! Beds were very uncomfortable, the bathroom smelled like dirty feet even after the daily cleaning, plumber had to come twice to unclog the toilet, the air conditioner was very noisy and did not keep the room cool especially during the night, the ceiling fan made more noise than the air conditioner. Sunset Deck was dirty and very trashy looking. The hotel location means nothing because all you do is walk around the Duval Street area anyway. Spent a day at the Hyatt and it seemed so much more upscale with real service (and cleaner).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, ocean view can change to an ocean cruiser view”
Reviews.Author: Axeman21
Reviews.Content: It's the perfect place to stay if you want to see the sunset at Key West. And to see the sunset you either go in front of the hotel or take an ocean view room. But you have to be cautious - you could wake up in the morning and see nothing else than a huge cruiser in front of your room. With the cruiser the ocean view disappears! I had that situation on every morning (I've been there 2 nights) but I had so much luck they moved away at 4pm so I had the chance to see the sunset from the balcony. There is no guarantee they move after just one day one of the hotel staff told me... The hotel itself is nice, good location to walk to the tourist area of the city. Since I don't like the places where the drunken tourists are I can say, I've been to Key West and I've seen it now - but there is no need for me to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganSue
Reviews.Content: The Westin is in a fabulous location. Close to restaurants, the old town section, waterfront, and many attractions. We booked a ocean front room and like other readers, found our view blocked by cruise ships. We were there four days and had two glorious days with fabulous unobstructed views. Then the cruise ships arrived and we saw cruise ship bows and hulls the next two days. The location is still great and I would still recommend this hotel. Just be forewarned. The room itself was very large but actually needed more furniture. The room also needs a little mtce with the wallpaper peeling in the bathroom and the carpet a little stained. Service throughout the hotel and the adjoining restaurant was great. We ate in the Bistro 245 quite a few times and found the food to be pretty good. The hotel is overpriced but I found most hotels in Key West to be overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BobCNewJerseyUSA
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I just returned from Key West where we attended Fantasy Fest 2007 which in itself is another story. We were staying at another location in KW when my son checked availability of the Westin. The Westin had some last minute cancellations so we were able to move there for the last 2 nights. If any of you have ever been to Fantasy Fest you know you want to be close to Duvall St as possible yet probably not on Duvall. The Westin was perfect. The room was fine and clean, the pool area was great as was the outside bar where you can watch the Sunset. We found the staff to be very helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: LynetteRZ
Reviews.Content: The "deluxe" King oceanview was certainly not deluxe by ordinary standards. The room was very small - not even a desk or chair was in it. The service was very disappointing - the cleaning staff didn't remove used glassware or replace tolietries (and this is when I was dumb enough to leave a five dollar tip on the bed!). The tub didn't drain properly and I was left standing in 2 inches of water every shower. We called to the manager to complain and it took her over a day to get back to us. We stayed here five nights and for 2 full days our oceanview was completely blocked by a cruise ship. What a waste of money - I wouldn't return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: indygirl06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin recently for a friend's wedding which was also at the hotel. We had a wonderful stay. The only minor hiccup was that we had requested a king bed but they only had two queens available. Also, they originally put us in a room which overlooked the a/c units and was very noisy. Upon our request, they moved us to a great room facing the pool. All of the staff was great and we had a wonderful breakfast overlooking the marina. Last, the wedding we went to at the Westin was absolutely beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pamaha
Reviews.Content: Spent last weekend at the Westin. Perfect location, steps from everything and yet its location back along the water is very quiet. Right on Mallory Square although the nights were too cloudy for sunsets when we were there :-(. The service from the entire staff was exceptionally good. Very professional, very gracious, and informative. The pool area is great - with a wonderful pool, nice lounge chairs, and poolside service. Lenny at poolside kept the rum runners and margaritas coming! The restaurants are very good. Our room was wonderful - two queen beds - and very spacious. We had a partial view of the water and it was just fine. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: cfo123
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful. The room had two large beds as requested. Nice bathroomn and balcony. The pool was a great place to be. The best was the view from our third floor room straight out over the pool and the water and harbor, where huge cruise-shipped docked at times. Breakfast was great and pleasant. Maid service was fine and this is the best location in Key West. Safe and quiet. We stayed three nights and would return again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Westin”
Reviews.Author: cuddles21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend at the Westin and we had a wonderful time. The service was great. The food was pretty good too. Try the Lobster quesadilla in the Bistro! Dinner at LATITUDES is a must. Its pricey but well worth it. Its on the Westin's private island overlooking the beach. The food was stellar, I mean the best meal I've EVER had...and I've been to some great restaurants. The service there was of course top notch. The room was adequate, on the small side -- we had 2 queens facing the pool. The bathroom was small also. They really need to go ahead and put the money into redoing the bathroom tile because although its in good shape it doesn't match anything and the black and white tile makes the room seem really outdated. The heavenly beds were, which was all I REALLY had to have in my room. Saw little ants consistently in the room and bathroom- I tried to overlook them though. The Westin is fairly quiet, but its best attribute is that it is located right at Duvall street -- the Key West "bourbon street". Shop around for keepsakes theres a wide variety of pricing out there. Everyone is very friendly. The pool is pretty small though. I think they are building another one across the street though. I Recommend the sunset cruise -- just beautiful and very relaxing (be sure to eat before you go though b/c no food on the cruise just beer/wine). We rented electric powered mini cars to get acquainted with the island. This was a lot of fun. Mallory square nightly is not to be missed either. We only saw 1 cruise ship which blew its horn a few times then departed so it didn't bother us. The outside bar was great; good food, drink and great view. I highly recommend the Westin and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose the Westin”
Reviews.Author: darlsay
Reviews.Content: We flew into Miami around 12:30pm and arrived in Key West around 7:00pm. The drive takes 3 hours but with rental car time and stops along the way it took us closer to 7. Our best bar stop along the way was Lor a leis (spelling)? and No Name Pub (my favorite) which is in Big Pine Key. We even saw 4 key deer - bucks, it was wonderful.... Arrived at the westin very tired. Went to our room 140 pool view king room. Room was very nice, not the best view but wouldn't mind getting this room again. We went to the restaurant for dinner and had such a wonderful meal we went there the next night as well. For any entree you can add a lobster tail for an addt'l $10. It was a delicious large tail that I had and the husband had the filet that was great. I highly recommend it. The hotel is really in the best location to everything. We had returned our rental car when we arrived in key west and were so glad we did. You really do not need a car if your staying in Key west. We went on a snorkel/sunset celebration excursion with the Fury boat and had a great time. Water was rough so it wasn't the best snorkeling but being out on a boat with a fun crew was a good time. When returning to Key West we will only be staying at the Westin. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: eye2eye
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, very central. When you step on to the property the grounds are very well kept. Staff quite nice as well. The rooms were well done and although a bit old, it was still acceptable and didn't give you the feeling you that creeped out feeling. It is a step away from duval street which is good because it has a lot of drunk and rowdy teens at night. Ok to bring the family if you kids are older, but I didn't see anyone with a baby stroller in key west. Diving is also really good here.

Reviews.Title: “What a great way to relax!”
Reviews.Author: schmallison
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from Key West after a five night stay, and the resort was one of the most wonderful parts of the trip. The staff was so kind, and all the amenities were great. It's in a perfect location, and when we go back we'll stay there again. Some of the details weren't so fabulous--stains on chairs, that kind of stuff--but the views, pool, staff, and shower made up for it all. I would pay the extra money to stay so you could see the water, and you don't have to make the trip to Mallory Square for the sunset because the resort has the most beautiful west facing views with a pier on the water, hammock, and sofas. Even though their gym isn't finished because of the remodel, they give you a pass to go to the gym of another closeby resort. I also suggest renting a moped so you can get to see some of the other parts of the island. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room...Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: BRoerig
Reviews.Content: From the check-in with Frank at the front desk....to Adam at the Bell Stand, it was first-class all the way! They have the top two floors of the second building for Starwood Guests, and it showed it. Clean rooms, great beds, courteous maid service. It gets 5 of 5 stars from us. Spent five night there July 11-16. And be sure to check out the drag show at Aqua every night at 9pm. GREAT show and a nice walk to the hotel. We'd call Adam for a cab and within 5 minutes someone was there for us when we reached the front of the property. Dinner at the restaurant there looking over to Sunset Island was also great...had the hamburger - reasonably priced, based on the view and ambiance of the place. Highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: jrrbin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property June 25-29, 2007. Having read some of the negative comments posted by prior guests, I must admit that we were somewhat nervous and anxious about what to expect when we arrived at the hotel. In fact, we had toyed with the notion of cancelling our reservation and staying at another property. I am so glad we didn't! We thought the property was absolutely beautiful and we couldn't ask for a better location! Housekeeping did a fantabulous job with keeping our rooms clean. We did however, run across a few little critters in the vanity area. We weren't really sure what they were, but they looked like little bitty ants?! They were harmless and far from a nuisance or anything. In fact, we never informed the hotel staff - they were that insignificant. The beds were definitely "heavenly" and the linens were above average quality. Our room overlooked the pool area and just about every day there was a cruise ship docked outside the hotel - which didn't bother us at all. In fact, we thought they were very fascinating...and it was neat to see the various types of ships! We had talked about possibly going on a cruise in the past - so, it was nice to put a "face" with the names of some of the ships we had researched. The hotel is located right on Malory Square which is fantabulous! Oh, and each evening, housekeeping would leave candy and bottled water along with a card that gave the forecast, sunrise and sunset information for the next day! The only negative experience we really had with the hotel was with one particular concierge - and we think she was rude because we didn't book a particular outing with her. Otherwise, we would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: mamagoos
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West to see about having a destination wedding at the Westin next spring. The location is perfect. The staff were friendly, polite and responsive to our requests. This was a short trip, but pleasant in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: beckywes
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that Cruise Ships are not an issue! We arrived on Saturday, June2nd and did not see a cruise ship until Monday morning. Yes they do obstruct your ocean view but they are gone by 2pm. I was a little worried about this issue because there were so many bad reviews because of this. Since we used Starwood Points for our stay, we weren't paying extra for the Ocean Front Room. I suppose if we were paying extra for the view, we would have been disappointed. The staff was pleasant, the poolside drinks YUMMY! The rooms were roomy, the bed was "Heavenly". What made our stay most enjoyable was the location, we were a short walk from all the excitement. I can't say much about the restaurants because we never ate at the hotel, but the drinks were great. Try one called "The Green Thing", kinda tastes like a Keylime flavored Colada. We chose not to bring the kids to Key West because we wanted to enjoy the night life. Lots of fun, lots of late nights! If you would like to hear about the restraunts, etc..I plan on doing an official "Trip Report" you can find in the forums.. My husband and I will DEFINITELY be staying at the Westin Key West in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthMiami
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with new rooms and you can't beat the area. Park your car and you don't have to retrieve it again until you leave. Plenty to do. Great views of the harbor and two steps from everything.

Reviews.Title: “much better than reviews”
Reviews.Author: spencer2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin during Easter week and we were pleasantly surprised that it was a lot better than the recent reviews on this site. The staff was helpful and very polite. Our room, which was in the building by the pool (which you should definitely ask for) and on the 3rd floor (SPG floor) was very clean and similar to other Westin properties that we have stayed in resort areas. I would suggest a room that was on the side of the hotel (not oceanfront), since there are cruise ships docked almost every day. This way you get a partial ocean view. The rooms are not huge, but the rooms are very nice with a balcony and I loved the heavenly bed for sleeping. The location is perfect. We went to the bight every night and used the many coupons in the "See Key West" booklet. Kelly's on Whitehead had great margaritas and wings at happy hour. Walk to Blue Heaven for breakfast or a stroll down Duval. I would like to say that there is a$12 charge for valet parking (you can come and go anytime) or a $9 per day charge to park (can only leave once). We opted for the $9 and planned our outing once a day, then parked on the top floor that connected directly to the Westin where the lobby was located. I did smell an odor of carpet deodorizer in that building, so again request the pool building where the very helpful concierge staff is also located. The pool area is OK, but chairs are closely put together in rows which I don't personally like. The pool and pool area looked clean and well taken care of. We were using SPG points, so we were very happy and thankful to be in Key West and enjoying the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a Westin”
Reviews.Author: Rufus100
Reviews.Content: This hotel was only recently transformed into a Westin, from a Hilton. The truth is that it's still a Hilton. As of March 2007, the only apparent changes during our week-long trip were the beds (which are very comfy) and the showerheads (again,very nice). The staff told me that the hotel will not be fuly converted/renovated until the end of the summer of 2007. That being said, I would be disappointed to pay Westin prices for the service and quality as it currently stands. Still, it's probably considered the best hotel in Key West because of its great location and access to the private island 5 miles offshore.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Westin in the entire chain.”
Reviews.Author: sphill_0967
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I am always careful of reading bad reviews of hotels for a spectrum of reasons. Mostly, I am always suspect of the reviews where someone is clearly out get retribution for not being given a complimentary room for bad room service, or something that always seems insignificant to me. This review simply to point out this hotels shortfalls and what I believe to be misleading representation of itself. Also, before going further, I want to point out that I am in the hospitality industry, mostly through the financing of hotels and the disposition of them. I have worked for a hotel investment-banking firm now for six years and predominantly deal with Starwood (Westin is part of the Starwood Hotel Group), Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt, and IHG flagged hotels. We have a North American office and a new office in London, that covers much of Western Europe. I share this in an effort to qualify my remarks regarding the Westin Key West. I know much of what the franchises expect from their flags/hotels. I booked a suite at this hotel from March 22nd-25th, for weekend fishing trip with two friends from home. Hotel accommodations were important to us, but not the most important for this trip, as we would be spending a great deal of time on the boat fishing during the day. However, a nice, clean and comfortable room was something we all agreed would be nice. So, when I saw the Westin on expedia.com, I thought it would be perfect fit, albeit the $625/night cost of room, which I assumed was due to spring break rate increases throughout the island. Plus, Westin has done a great job keeping the brand up to date and creating a hip feel to their hotels. We arrived and immediately were blown away by the fantastic location! Without question, this hotel is wonderfully located in the heart of Old Town Key West. You do have cruise ships that park in front of the hotel during the day, but they are gone before the sunset celebration, which is a lovely experince. We were fishing all day, so the cruise ships did not bother us at all. What was frustrating to my group, was the fact that this hotel was originally a Hilton Hotel and looks/feels like a Holiday Inn. Apparently the hotel â€œconvertedâ€� to a Westin recently, but other than the name being changed there is no difference. I admit they have upgrade to the standard Heavenly Bed and Heavenly Shower, which are Westin requirements, but that is it! The carperts looked as though they may have been from when the hotel was originally built. The TVâ€™s were from the 1950â€™s and BOTH of our controllers did not work. Our bathrooms were modeled from a Days Inn Interstate motel. They were old vermica countertops with a slab of reflective glass as a mirror. The tile was filthy were the grout was originally laid (something a PIP will kill this hotel on). The elevators were paneled with multi-color confetti paneling and slow. The staff(at least in the lobby)were all dressed in their personal shirts that ranged in type, but all had on Westin name tags. On Saturday, we had lunch at the bar upstairs, overlooking the water. We ordered fish dip for the 3 of us to share, each a salad and an entrÃ©e. The whole order was brough at one time, where we pointed out that we no longer wanted the appetizer then. At that time the server stated, â€œwe should have told him that we wanted the dip first.â€� What??? The fish dip was offered under â€œappetizersâ€�! In any case, the dip was aweful, our salads were warm and my grouper sandwich was â€œwetâ€� or raw. I also need to mention that the NCAA bball tournament was on TV, but we were unable to watch because they have two TVâ€™s facing one another that are positioned for the bartender only (minor detail, but worth pointing out)?!?!? On Sunday we went to have brunch at the hotels cafÃ©, wich I must say is a decorative nighmare for a Westin hotel. We asked to order off the menu as opposed to the buffet that was spread throughout the room with no rhyme or reason. We sat for 15-minutes before being asked what we would like to drink. No joke, we actually timed this as we figured something would go wrong. After laughing at the time this was taking we got up and left the hotel for another place to eat. I became aware that this hotel was originally a Hilton when I noticed, by the pool a sign that had Westin on it with tape. Upon another look you can see the word Hilton below the tape. After noticing this once, I noticed it several more times throughout the hotel, none more apparent than one of my towels having a Hilton Hotels label on it! So after rambling on here, let me make it clear that I understand things happen, but charging me over $600/night for Holiday Inn product and service is ridiculous. To anyone that is used to Westin standards, you know why we chose this hotel. Westinâ€™s are traditionally wonderful hotels and worth the rate. This however was the most horrible Westin I have ever, seen, much less visited. I should also mention that I did not make my gripes apparent to the hotel management, as I am one who believes you get what you sign up for and complaining does no good. It is unfortunate though that this hotel advertises as a Westin when it is not even in a Sheraton by Four Points league! Great location, horrible hotel. I have stayed at the Casa Marina in Key West before, and for a comperable price, it blows the Westin out of the water. FYI...I walked into the Pier House just to see the hotel and their rooms are the same as the Westin's for $300/night less!!! By the way...we caught 7 sailfish with Capt. Ken Harris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cruise ships”
Reviews.Author: billiard87
Reviews.Content: My Family and I booked a week stay at this resort last year and we only ended up staying one night due to the Hotel's awful service and disappointing views. We picked this resort based on it's rave reviews and great location, but were also promised a beach and relaxing atmosphere. IT HAS NEITHER. The beach is ticketed and in order to get tickets you have to wait in line early in the morning and it's first come first serve. The WORST aspect of this hotel is that it is next to a HUGE marina and every morning cruise ships dock less than 100 yards away from ocean view "suites". We left after we awoke to hundreds of cruise passengers milling around below our balcony. It was awful. the staff was snotty, the room overpriced, and there was nothing deluxe about our suite. Do your homework if you want a beach and good view!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly lovely.....”
Reviews.Author: MeloKacey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Key West for a few nights in February, despite the mixed reviews I read here. I have to say that I was completely satisfied with our experience! Our room was spacious and clean, and we were fortunate enough to have a view of the water and Mallory Square, which was worth every penny we paid! Every evening we celebrated sunset from our balcony with mango mojitos in hand, and watched the wonderful circus of performers and revelers unfold before our eyes. The location is exceptional. The Westin provided us with a little haven of cleanliness and relaxation just a few hundred yards from the booze -fueled frenzy of Duval Street; a pleasant balance for our vacation. What no one told us on Trip Advisor is that the Westin has a private island with homes and rentals called Sunset Key. For a small fee, you can purchase tickets from the concierge and board a short ferry ride to Sunset and spend your day enjoying the finest beach on Key West, exceptional chair-side service, and wonderful food at the restaurant. You can't explore the island because it is private, but our mellow day on the beach (more mojitos) was one of the highlights of our trip. As for the cruise ships parked outside? Besides the inevitable surge of annoying curisers they expelled, what's the big deal? We thought they were interesting, and they never stayed around long enough to interfere with sunset views. The pool? Sure, it's small and rather enclosed, but given the location of the hotel they've made the best of the space and we enjoyed it (more mojitos). We wouldn't stay anywhere else if we returned to Key West. The Westin was perfectly lovely.

Reviews.Title: “location great but rooms need refurbished”
Reviews.Author: polar1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Westin from 19/1/07-22/01/07 in a one bedroom suite (room 416). Location was great, right in the centre of things, overlooking the marina and surrounding small shops. Other rooms overlooked Mallory square and would generally have been noisier at night. On our first night, ESPN had a boxing event in the square which generated a lot of crowd noise. This hotel has recently been taken over from Hilton by Westin and is in need of refurbishment. Our bedroom was ok but the lounge area needed a complete overhaul.(carpets badly stained etc). Westin operates as a non smoking hotel, but our room must have been a smoking room in the past. This was very unpleasant for my wife who suffers from asthma and within a short time needed to take her inhaler. We contacted the front desk, but rather than move us, they got housekeeping to put an ioniser into the room. This only masked the problem, but we decided to put up with the room as we loved the location. My advice to Westin would be to refurbish the former "smoking rooms" first, as you cannot remove the smell of smoke that is embedded in carpets and walls. Plus points of the hotel were the staff, who were very friendly, the bed which truly was 'heavenly', a fridge in the room and the nighty turndown service with a bottle of water and chocolate was lovely. I dont think i would hurry back to this hotel unless i could be sure the room had been refurbished because although the location could not be better it was very expensive for the present standard of accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience; probably wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: quintshark
Reviews.Content: OK, let me just start off by saying I am not a picky person. But for the money my husband and I paid, we would not stay here again. The Westin's most redeeming factor: the location was very nice (not too close to Duval but within a quick walk to most restaurants) However, we were specifically told we would have an ocean view, but a huge private charter boat was right in front of our second floor patio the entire time. I mean, when I went out on our deck in the morning to sit back with a cup of coffee, there were people on the boat that were able to look directly into our room. I never wanted to open the drapes! The first night I asked the concierge how long the boat was scheduled to be there, and her response was "we don't have that information, but they don't usually stay longer than a day or two". Well, I was told by several business owners that information is public knowledge and posted on several local websites. The Westin never offered to move us so there we stayed. I was told later by someone on the return flight home that the same thing happened to them at the Westin, and they had some of their $$ reimbursed. I guess I didn't talk to the right people. Moving on, the walls in the hotel hallways and in the room needed a coat of paint - they were dirty and "marked on". And the housekeeping staff could have done a better job cleaning the bathroom (and this is coming from someone who is not a clean freak). The Westin did post a notice saying they would only clean the bed linens every third day, in order to conserve water, energy etc. I have no problem with that, but other people might. In walking around Key West for the first time, there seemed to be other places that looked appealing for half the $$. (e.g. The Southernmost Hotel, a handful of B&Bs) Being directly on the water was just not all it was cracked up to be, so we'll be staying at one of those places instead. I'd stay at the Southernmost just for the close proximity to Louie's Backyard - best dinner we had!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: julieinwinchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a Carribean cruise for New Year and I for one was delighted to see cruise ships outside my window unlike a previous reviewer. I originally booked this hotel with Hilton who forgot to tell us they'd sold out. We were somewhat confused after our 4 hour drive from Fort Lauderdale as to what had happened to the Hilton. Anyway, we had what we paid for a bedroom with sea and sunset view, unfortunately we had a tree outside are room, so couldn't really see it, but never mind we went to the outside terrace for a sunset cocktail! If you ask for the 3rd floor you should be OK but you might have to pay even more for that. It wasn't cheap so probably wouldn't stay again. Everythings was clean and tidy so no complaints at all. Didn't use the restaurant, figured it would be pricey. Found a fantastic place close by called Two Friends for breakfast. Check it out. We did the Ghost Tour which wasn't that good but we did yell 'You're Doomed' at loads of hecklers which was fun!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: jrnyman6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Key West from December 7-11. If you're going to make the trip, the Westin is one of the best possible locations. The hotel is walking distance to all of the Duval Street bars, restaurants, etc. You are also right on Mallory Square where the daily sunset activities take place. Westin is in the process of renovating this hotel which will make it an even better choice in the future. Our room was very clean and spacious. We had an oceanfront view so we got to enjoy the sunsets and street performers from our balcony. The cruise ships do get in the way, but they are interesting to watch pulling in and out of port. They are also only there on certain days, so don't think your view will be blocked all the time. I thought it was funny as well that the street performers put on the same exact routine every night (word for word) since most people only see them once. While we enjoyed our trip, we found Key West to be lacking variety. Plenty of bars and souvenir shops but little else. If you're looking for a casual, relaxing destination with lots of nightlife this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but watch out for cruise ships”
Reviews.Author: janeymcp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a UK family with a 6 yr old son. Booked a room with sea view which was great, overlooked Mallory Square and a private view from our balcony of the sunset. (and the famous Catman) ...for the first 2 days. .....(PS make sure you get a high floor room, ground floor terraces are really on the pavement) Unfortuately then 2 huge cruise ships pulled in and limited our balcony viewing to watching hordes of cruisers disemarking from the huge white ships blocking our view. We didn't feel that the Westin website made this clear and we checked out a day early. Apart from this, location of the Westin is excellent, straight out of the door to all the restaurants but still quiet at night. Housekeeping was a bit hit and miss too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Maxidog
Reviews.Content: I have to say that after reading the previous review, I am wondering if the person actually stayed at the Westin. The first thing I did was go on an upper balcony to look at the pool since it was described as the "filthiest pool area" ever seen. I actually thought it was nicely kept. Big thick chair pads on the lounges, bar and grill area, hot tub, plentiful thick towels, pool boy kept the area straightened up during the day. Water was nice, though cool (unheated). No complaints and we are major pool people. We had an oceanfront room, first floor, right on Mallory Square. I would have preferred a room on the upper floor, but this was fine as we enjoyed our patio (free wireless worked out there!). Cruise ships not a problem, in fact, my boys and husband enjoyed seeing them dock and leave each day. They were always gone by sunset. The room was large and had the most comfortable bedding. While the carpeting did not look too worn, it was damp, I believe because of the proximity to the ocean air. Maid service was hit or miss-- seemed like we had different people each day, so no pattern. We always had to request more coffee (Starbucks) and cups. We enjoyed the hotel and it was pricey because of the Christmas season. Prime location, friendly concierge and front desk people. Valet parking attendants quick and courteous. Did not try restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: OhioStateBuckeye
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! From the moment we checked-in we were greeted by a friendly staff. Our hotel room was on the third floor with a pool view. The room was very clean, large and updated. Absolutely no complains. The location of the hotel could not have been better! If you want to be steps from all of the Key West action (bars, shopping, sunset pier) you can't beat the Westin! Although you are near the action, the room was quiet and relaxing. The Heavenly Beds can't be beat! The pool and hot tub were nice. The pool was cold. It could not have been heated. The sun chairs around the pool fill up quickly. Get to the pool before 11am to insure you get a great tan before you leave. The hotel offers a short boat ride to a private beach. It was $20 per person so we didn't go. Don't miss watching the sun set outside the hotel on the pier!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with thw ocean view room”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuff72
Reviews.Content: The reservations were all messed up, spent about 30 mins trying to fix it. Don't bother getting an ocean view room, because there will be a cruise ship obstructing your ocean view. Restaurant was overpriced and slow. Otherwise the hotel was in a great locaction/

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lot418
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days in Key West staying at the Westin. Overall it was a very nice hotel. When you add in the tax and parking it was $300/night. Was it worth that - yes and no. You are right on Mallory Sq. and you never need a car if you plan to stay in Key West the entire time and yes there was a cruise ship in port every day and our room (220) look direcly at them. But i thought it was kind of neat to see. The pool was nice and quiet and small. The hotel restaurant did not look as good as the other options around so we never at there. One day at the pool there was a lot of construction noise - but it did not appear to be at the Westin - it might have been from Mallory SQ or another hotel? The room was a good size - coffee maker - tv - small bathroom - no hair dryer - remember the cruise ship view (not a bad view). Over all I would stay there again if I could get a better price. Also I would rather fly directly into KW vs. drive down from Miami area. I would recommend renting a car (maybe for just 1 day) to explore the upper keys and Bahia Honda State Park (Sandspur beach is the best beach in the Keys).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, still needs some upgrading to be called a Westin”
Reviews.Author: EventBiz
Reviews.Content: Just recently got back from our 10th anniversary trip at the Westin Key West and also had the opportunity to do a tour of the hotel with the Sales staff since I am in the event/conference business and prefer Starwood properties. In the past three months the hotel just recently changed hands from a Hilton to a Westin. Immediate upgrades due to the change include the Heavenly Bed, which is very comfortable and some of the Heavenly Bath ammenties. I stayed in a king partial ocean view room. Even though we had an ocean view, two out of the three days we were there a large cruise ship was parked right in our view. Rooms were clean but the carpet, drapes, and furniture in our room were a bit dated and in need of repair or replacement. I have been told by the Sales staff that a a scheduled renovation in the rooms will be completed by December 1, 2007 as per their new Westin contract. This will include furniture, carpet, bath vanities,etc. in the rooms. This will greatly improve the hotel rooms which still has the older Hilton feel. The staff was very accomodating and the concierge was great. The location is a definite plus, everything is easily within walking distance. You will not need a car. We had a great time at Sloppy Joes and Irish Kevins. Would also suggest the Commodore for dinner, an excellent recommendation from the Concierge. I would recommend this property and look forward to returning to see the new updates.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: travel_lover16
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many very nice hotels through the years, and this one is right up there. It is not an overly fancy hotel, but it is clean, updated, and stylish. Our view overlooked Sunset Key, to which the hotel provides hourly water taxi rides for hotel guests to use the island's private beach. This hotel is within walking distance of almost everything. I would certainly tell anyone I know to stay here without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, THE best location in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: darrin401
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days, loved this property! We found it to be clean, comfortable, with a very nice staff, particularly the concierge staff, it was our 1st anniversary, and they even sent us Champagne and Chocolate covered strawberries one evening. Back in July in was a Hilton property, but I was told not much would change in terms of amenities or staff, Westin is usually a step or two up from Hilton resorts, so it may even be better now. We would highly reccommend this hotel, and you absolutely can't find a better location in the heart of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: tmahin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Sept. 18 & 19. This hotel was absolutely wonderful. We had a king suite with a heavenly bed (this is a Westin feature) with an ocean view. We had a corner room with 2 balconies, one off the living room area and the other off the bedroom area. These looked out onto Mallory Square and the ocean. The heavenly bed really is a heavenly bed. We both got a good nights sleep here. A nice touch was late afternoon, a bag would be left on the door with a bottle of water and chocolates for the night. When we pulled in the valet asked if we would need luggage assistance. Itâ€™s a good thing I said we would because our room was in a different building from check in, which we didnâ€™t know. Without assistance it really would have been a lot of work for us getting our bags and excess stuff to the room. We also valet the car so I donâ€™t know if there is self parking or what that would be like. We didnâ€™t use the pool, but walked by it to get to the restaurant and it was a very nice area with plenty of chairs. The restaurant also looked out into the ocean, and the meals were very good. They have a sunset deck with a bar on the second level for viewing the sunsets. Quite a few people were already there when we got there, but getting a good seat for the sunset wasnâ€™t a problem. This place was expensive but I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: KariBeth
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our weekend in Key West.. This hotel location was excellent!!! Right in the middle of Mallory Square. I do not suggest the ocean view room you'll be disappointed for the price. We down graded to a pool view after we arrived and saw the view. But the room they moved us to was HUGE!!! Bed is very comfy loved the round pillow. No problems moving...everyone is very laid back..my type of town..Jane our concierge was fabulous. Have her book your dinner reservations when you get there. L'attitudes restaurant is a rip off...way over priced when there are lots of other excellent choices. A&B Seafood just three blocks up the street on the marina had the best lobster oscar I've had in a long time. Take a sunset cruise instead of going to L'attitudes. Never ate at the hotel restaurant too many good local places. Cheeseburgers was good for lunch, Commador excellent clam chowder. Try Pepe's for breakfast..must have the Mimosas (but remember no booze until 11 on Sundays) so go on another morning. You may need to take a cab or scooter to Pepe's...pink cab rides are always fun...for t-shirts hit Stitches next to the coach outlet ask for Kevin wild man....yes ladies there is a coach outlet.....great prices I went back 3 times.....for snorkeling go with Fury right off the dock at the Westin....crew was excellent and all the beer you can drink .....after snorkeling of course. the crew is sooooo nice...Big thanks to Harrison who stayed with me the whole time taking me out to the reef and diving down to point at cool things!!! By the end of the weekend we had made so many new friends...we'll go back many times...you won't really spend to much time in your room, really it will be 3 am before you know it. Key West is really more a 21 and up type of place though. Favorite bar was a toss between Irish Kevins and Sloppy Joes. FYI 3rd floor of The Bull is clothing optional....Enjoy all the live entertainment and play tourist with taking lots of pictures....Just have fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Resort!”
Reviews.Author: UCFTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel a few months back when it was a Hilton. I was pleasantly surprised when I get the e-mail with the name change. This hotel on all fronts is wonderful. We stayed over Labor Day weekend and payed $269 per night for a pool view room (in doing my research this rate was actually one of the lowest in all of Key West for Labor Day weekend). It is a typical Westin Resort - entire property no smoking, great customer service, and the heavenly beds. The location cannot be beat - directly on the marina, adjacent to world famous Mallory Square, quaint shops within the hotel on the outside boardwalk, and just 2 blocks to Duval Street. Check-in was quick and efficient. The girl checking us in was knowledgeable, professional, and friendly. While I was working with the girl checking us in, my friend was asking another front desk associate what time the bars close. She had no idea. I was surprised. That is something basic she should know. The room was large and very comfortable (beds were "heavenly," water pressure and shower temperature were great, sink is located outside the bathroom (very convenient when friends are trying to get ready at the same time), AC worked very well with a nice ceiling fan in the middle of the room, pool view from our balcony was fine). Parking rates are standard (actually lower than inner-city hotels) - $9 per day (self) and $12 per day (valet). I would stay here in a second and would recommend anyone to as well. The price (comparatively with other Key West properties), location, customer service, and luxury cannot be beat. This property is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time but too short”
Reviews.Author: Skycop
Reviews.Content: The Westin hotel in Key West was wonderful. The front desk staff were professional and helpfull. The hotel is clean, the beds and pillows were very comfortable. We loved it. The restaurant was outstanding (We had breakfast and lunch). The location and the view from the hotel it couldn't be better. We can't wait to go back an eat at the Lattitude Restaurant. The whole experience was wonderful, the only regret was that we were evacuated too soon from our vacation by the Key West authority due to possible hurricane Ernesto. So we have to cut our vacation short. The hotel did not charged us for the rest of our vacation. That was very nice. We can't wait to go back. We highly recommend this hotel. Our overall experience was excellent !

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the restaurant!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can not comment on the hotel but the restaurant is one of the worst dining experiences I have ever had! We thought we had a great place to sit, eat and watch the great Key West sunset. Well, we sat and did get to watch the sunset. Once the sun was down and we were contemplating our 3rd round of drinks we began to wonder just where our food was. It was difficult to catch our waitress as she was the only person servicing about 20 tables. An hour after our order was placed one of our friends went looking for our waitress and found the manager. She asked what the problem was and when told she informed him that was impossible because "all food comes out within ten minutes". Never did she say "Let me check on it for you" or anything like that. She was later also extremly rude to my wife, even putting her hands up in her face and telling her that "they never take that long to serve food." It is in a great location. One can only hope that someone else takes the place over. As for now just keep walking down Mallory Square and find someplace civil to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time”
Reviews.Author: txtvsales
Reviews.Content: After reading all the ho-hum reviews on the Hilton in Key West, I was hesitant to stay there. Sure glad we did! We spent 7 glorious nights at this resort in June and everything was top notch. Room 263 is the best room in the complex. Great view (not blocked by cruise ships) and great balcony. Spacious, clean and the beds were great. Even greater were the pillows! Maid service was good, and food was great (yes, it is pricey). Highlights of this hotel - location, location, location! What more could you ask for than a hotel that was within walking distance of everything, overlooked the blue of the gulf, and every evening you could watch the beautiful sunset and the celebration that went along with it. In addition, we got brand new beds while there! Not to mention, access to Sunset Key Beach - which was beautiful. The best thing about this beach is the privacy and lack of people! What a great way to relax. However, the most important amenity was the conceirge service. Adrian and Jane Emma were the absolute best conceirge's I've ever experienced. They directed us to great restaurants, great entertainment and set us up with snorkeling, the Ghost Tour, the Conch Train - and they did it all with a smile. One day our mini-bar didn't get re-stocked and they even took care of that. They gave us directions - they made our trip hassle free. I would highly recommend this property to anyone staying in Key West. It's pricey, but as we found out, everything is in the Conch Republic! We had a vacation to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every peney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is the way to go when you visit Key West. The hotel has the best location to everything! We had a standard room but upon arrival they upgraded us to a partial ocean view in the main building. The room was HUGE! Yeah on a few occassions we woke up to a massive cruise ship, but to be honest those things are amazing to watch coming or going. The roof top bar gave us a great view of the sunset and then a short walk to Duval street for a night of fun. The Sunday brunch was expensive, but the selection they had made it worth it and the added bonus of getting to watch a cruise ship dock really added to the experience. If you are looking to take a jet ski tour around the island, try to find another location. Our tour was fun and fast but we did not get to go into the little hidden spots I was expecting. Our tour guide was somewhat knowledgeable when we stopped for a break but I was more interested in going fast on the ski. I know this review is about the hotel but for drinks, anywhere you go is great. Live music in every establishment, but if you need a break from the heat Irish Kevin's is the place to go for AC and good music. After cooling off Sloppy Joe, Dogs Breathe, Whistle, Bull and Captian Tony's are all good bars. For food The Counch Republic on the water was great not only for food but also for thier bar. The hidden jems of the vacation is Pepe's for dinner, make sure you sit outside under the trees, great ambiance. And if you like buffalo wings, I know we are in Key west but PT's bar right down from Pepe's are the best I have ever eaten. Nice locals joint but that is half the fun of going on vacation. Overall Great experience and I can't wait to go back. The room and location was so great I would request the same room the next time. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & The Best Location in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Fool for the Beach
Reviews.Content: My wife, infant, and I stayed at the Hilton Key West for a couple nights the last week of May. We had a wonderful time there. The hotel was very nice, and the staff were extremely helpful. Right from the start the Front Desk and Bell staff were very helpful and courteous. We did not find a single person in the hotel that did not want to go out of their way to help out with anything we needed. We were given a partial ocean view room that looked over the marina. The room was clean, and neat, but a little on the small side. That was not a big issue since you don't spend much time in your room anyway in Key West. We called housekeeping a few times for extra towels etc.. and they were right there within (5) minutes each time. This was a holiday weekend, and we still received excellent prompt service! I was a bit disappointed in the "crib" that was brought to the room. It was a well worn "Pack-n-Play". Our son still slept fairly sound in it, but I had expected a "real" crib. You can not beat the location of this hotel. It is right in the middle of the action in Old Town. The only other large hotels that have this convenience would be the Hyatt or the Pier House. The hotel is right on Mallory Square where they have the most beautiful sunsets and events every night. I mention to be warned if you have an ocean view room, you may have a cruise ship parked in front of your view for a day or two. This did not effect us, but I know it really bothers some people who pay extra for that ocean view. The pool area is very nice as well. You need to get there early if you want a seat, they are limited. We went to the pool after lunch, and could not find a chair anyplace. Fortunately someone saw us with our infant looking around for a seat, felt bad for us, and gave their seat to us so that we had a place to put the baby down. There are so many places to eat. We ate a Kelly's, which was superb, and has a great courtyard under the trees. We also ate at Big Daddy Conch's. It was not much to look at from the outside or in, but the food was very good. We ate the Sunday Brunch at the Hilton and also found that to be excellent. It was very $$ at $80 for two, but the selection was out of this world, and worth it (huge raw bar, crab legs, shrimp, breakfast foods, prime rib, sushi, etc... To sum it up: Pros Attentive & Responsive Desk, Bell, and Housekeeping Staff Updated & Clean Rooms The Best Location in Key West Sunsets on Mallory Square Pool Area Clean and Pleasant Cons Cribs were "Pack-n-Plays" Cruise Ships Get to Pool Early $20 charge per person to go to Sunset Key We will definitely stay here again. We have stayed at the Hyatt before which is also great, but found it less expensive at the Hilton

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our Honeymoon in Key West, and we absolutely LOVED our stay at the Hilton. The room was very clean, the king-sized bed was extremely comfortable (sheets were soft and clean; pillows (6) were soft and had a down feel) on which we slept like babies, and the service was impeccable. I can see how some people who stay there complain about their rooms facing the bar or pool area, but the hotel in general was excellent. Our room was in the main building overlooking the marina and the docked cruise ships. If you are looking for privacy, then this is not the hotel for you. There are plenty of other â€œResortâ€� Hotels there that are more private, but Key West is not a place to go to hold up in your room. Itâ€™s a place to get out and have some fun. See the sights! If you are thinking of going to Key West for a family vacation, you may want to consider Sunset Key or some of the Resorts on the south end of the island. That is were all of the beaches are, however, Key West is really a 21+ vacation spot. We recommend Fury Watersportsâ€™ â€œUltimate Adventureâ€� package with the Sunset Sail. We had a blast. $115 per gets you a 2 hour sunset sail (all drinks included) and a 6 hour Ultimate Adventure sail (snorkeling on the reef, jet skis, parasailing, kayaks and swimming plus all the food and drinks you can handle included). Hemingwayâ€™s home was excellent as well as the Customs House museum. And if you stay in the Hilton, you have to take a day trip to Sunset Keyâ€™s beach. Just bring some water shoes, the beaches have smooth coral rocks. As far as bars and restaurants go, Blue Heaven was a great dinner and their Key Lime pie was the best we had. Sloppy Joeâ€™s is a great experience, and I recommend the Sloppy Joe and the Conch Fritters. Pepeâ€™s is the best breakfast in town, and Alonsoâ€™s Oyster bar had the best seafood. Margaritavilleâ€™s food was pretty good, and they have a great Conch Chowder. Hogâ€™s Breath was OK, but itâ€™s worth visiting. Stay away from Big Daddyâ€™s Conch House. The food was terrible and the music was just as bad. If you have never been to Key West, there is plenty to keep adults busy for an entire week. Between the bars, restaurants, charter boats, sail boats, museums, shops, sight seeing and just plain walking around you shouldnâ€™t get bored, but your under 21 kids may. Donâ€™t plan on driving anywhere once you get there, but I do recommend renting a scooter, bicycle or electric car (although the electric car is harder to park). A good portion of the tourists get scooters, and they are just as much a Key West icon as the Roosters, Chickens, Sport Drinking, Sunsets and Key Lime Pie. One other noteâ€¦ While the Butterfly Conservatory may look like a good idea, unless you are just crazy about butterflies itâ€™s not worth the admission price ($15 per). Itâ€™s small and crowded. The Tennessee Aquarium has bigger and better one plus two aquariums for the same price! With that said, bring plenty of spending money, everything is expensive, but you probably already figured that! Whether you stay in the Hilton (which did love) or somewhere else (plenty of other high quality resorts, hotels and B&Bâ€™s), just make sure it's on the west side of the island within three blocks of Duval St. The northwest corner is the best to be in the middle of it all, but the southwest is a lot quieter and still close enough to walk to everything. We will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Skip it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean enough, but the pool area is cramped with no views. When we arrived, our 'ocean view' room was dominated by a 10 story cruise shipped parked right in front of our room. One of the bars looked into our room, the airconditioning was really loud, and the room needed renovation. There was midlew in the shower, the rug was stained, and the paint was scuffed up. Rooms facing out from the courtyard, on the third floor, have tiny windows - unlike those shown on the website. The lobby is tiny and does not have any Key West charm. It certainly does not have a 'resort' feel. For $380 per night, I expect a lot more. Don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Hilton”
Reviews.Author: NYCVISIT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights on a family vacation. Hotel is expensive but you are paying for a great location. While not luxurious, rooms are clean, spacious, comfortable and virtually soundproof. Hotel is very well run. One complaint: it now costs $20 per person to go to Sunset Key to use the beach (and the pool on Sunset Key is only available to guests staying there). If you want a beach, try Fort Zachary State Park for a nominal fee instead. The Hyatt has a similar location so it might be worth comparing with the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the privacy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Key West may times in the past and wanted to stay in the nicest resort I could find, so I checked trip advisor for reviews on other guests experiences, I am very glad that other people took the time to rate this hotel, my experience was great, although it was quite expensive I would have to say that it was well worth the money, we stayed in the three bedroom poolside cottage, after viewing both poolside and oceanfront, the poolside was the better choice being that there is not a clear view of the ocean (from the 3 bedroom cottages at least), I was a little disapointed in "Latitudes" which is a restaurant on the island, there are so may other nice restaurants in Key West I will not be eating at "Lattitudes" again, although the ambiance was second to none the food was not that great, I live in Buffalo NY and I have a friend who lives in Ft. Lauderdale that met us there and we are making this our annual get together spot

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Keys”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful thanks to the staff of the Key West Hilton. They were most kind, and most efficient!!! The hotel was truly Key West and beautiful, the rooms extremely comfy, the restaurant cuisine most impressive, and the close proximity to Mallory Square and Duval St. most enjoyable. A definite must for the Key West visitor!!! Sincerely, K. Cunningham & T. Baran

Reviews.Title: “Hilton was a Solid Location”
Reviews.Author: friar89
Reviews.Content: Greetings! Just returned from a few days at the Hilton and wanted to leave a review. My wife and I have been to KW 5x and have stayed at the Ocean Key, Casa Marina (when it was a Wyndham) Hyatt and now the Hilton. It was a solid hotel - room was clean, location great, pool OK (the first day it was closed for maintenance), service was acceptable. Not a bad place - not a WOW place. Its best attribute is its location. If faced with a choice (which we do every year or so) we'd go back to the Hyatt Hotel (next to the Pier House) for the money, its got the best attributes, service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is in charge”
Reviews.Author: YongeEgTripper
Reviews.Content: We didn't get the beds that were no problem. Price is 329.00 which is lots for a large but ordinary room, even with great location. Apparently the rate is $269.00 but price increases when I book. Tired from drive down the keys, get woken at 6 or so with a truck pumping outside and toilet not working. They come to fix fast and are surprised at the noise 30 yards from our window. It stops half hour later but that morning and every other, the power sweeper starts at 7 or so. Some high pitch from air conditioner at times just to fill in quiet times. Front desk staff have irritating habit of paying attention to something else during normal info request and then apologizing and go through it all again. Breakfast buffet is less than average, but location is good and we didn't mind cruise ships. Party people at night sometimes, but hey, you're in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diane6565
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Hotel in Key West, Florida is just wonderful, with comfortable beds, helpful concierge and a perfect location. The hotel has a pier where, in just minutes, guests can take a boat to go snorkling, parasailing, jet skiing, etc., and, of course, where guests can enjoy the wonderful sunsets every evening, while enjoying the two-hour festival of street performers, musicians and food. The hotel is also close to Duval Street, which is just great for shopping and dining. I loved this hotel so much that, as soon as I got back, I tried to schedule a stay for Memorial Day, but it was already booked up. I would strongly recommend this hotel for families, couples and even lone travelers. It was just great!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stayi!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and our twin daughters (21 years old) stayed at the HIlton from March 2nd thru March 4th. We wish we would have been able to stay longer. After reading some reviews about the hilton we found deciding on a hotel in Key West difficult, but we couldn't have picked a better hotel. The location was fantastic. The sunset festival takes place right on the hotel deck every evening and Mallory Square (where all the street performers are) is right next door. Duvall St. is just a block away. Everything is within walking distance. We were on the 3rd floor overlooking the pool and we could also see the ocean from our room. The view was beautiful from our balcony. The pool was one of the nicest we saw. (we walked to several hotels nearby and the Hilton was clearly the nicest) The staff was always pleasant and helpful. The rooms were nice and clean. The beds were extremely comfortable. Food and drinks were served by the pool. We never had a problem with noise and there was no construction going on at any time. We would HIGHLY reccommend the Hilton. The Hilton may be expensive but we were very satisfied with everything which made it well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a nice time during my stay at the Hilton. Its in a great location within walking distance of all the main attractions but secluded enough so that you can get away from the mayhem. I made a point not to get a room with an ocean view because I had read on this site that large cruise ships sit in front of the hotel everyday and I was right to do that because cruise ships were there every day of my trip. One of the great things about the hotel were the beds. Usually I miss sleeping in my own bed when on vacation but these beds and the linens were the most comfortable I've ever slept on. I don't know how many people would make a decision based on that factor alone but just thought I'd mention it. Wasn't too impressed with the pool as the water was very warm and a little too oily, and the restaurant is too expensive considering how close you will be to hundreds of other restaurants but overall I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice Hotel, Okay Service”
Reviews.Author: jlnjz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend at the Hilton Key West Resort and Marina. Overall, I found the hotel to be nice, but not exceptional. The service is definitely lacking. It is adequate, but you do not really get the feeling that they are there to take care of your wants and needs, there was a general attitude of "we'll get to you when we can....". The room looked as I expected it to look after reviewing this site and the hotel's site. We had a "partial ocean view" that was visible if you stood out on the balcony, but from the room we really could only see the adjacent buildings. We were on the north side of the building and at the corner farthest from the ocean. This mean we were right above the area where they seemed to be continually dropping off trash or laundry and there were huge mechanical units that drowned out any "local" sounds that we may have heard. It was not terrible, but would have been nice to be closer toward the corner near the ocean. We took a sunset wine cruise on the Danger and had a great time. The crew on board was fabulous and we had an incredible sunset that night. We ate dinner over on the Island (Sunset Key) and it was very good. Service over there was much better than in the "main hotel", but the rooms over there are significantly more as well, so I guess you get what you pay for. We had a great time wandering up and down Duval Street. Loved watching the cruise ships come in and out of the marina. Overall, we had a great vacation. This was our first trip to Key West and will go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton due to my web search and its location to most of the hot spots including Duval Street and Mallory Square. It was very clean and good food (although not much selection). The staff were friendly, the rooms nice but small. The view was great out to the cruise ships that come in every day. I read a review about the fire alarm going off at 3am. It did that when we were there as well! Odd thing they really need to get under control. Overall it is a good place but pricey. One other thing, the bicycles they send you to rent are real pieces. I saw many others much better and cheaper. Look into them. some places will drop them off there for you and they will have lights and everything. It is important since they are such a great way of getting around you don't need a car at all.

Reviews.Title: “Some trouble at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Every year, my family and I go to the Hilton for Spring Break. Though the service is sometimes lacking, it is a beautiful setting right on Mallory Square. This past year in 2005 we decided to go both during Spring Break and during the summer in July. I am writing on our experience in July. The stay was quite enjoyable, much better then Spring Break when there are lots of tourists and the pool is so crowded that you can barely get a seat. The service has never been top-notch especially at a high quality hotel. At the pool, the bar is nice because you can get drinks and very good food. However, the wait staff needs some upgrading. One bartender was too busy flirting with girls at the bar or chatting with other customers that he barely served my family. The restaurant Bistro 245 needs work, the wait staff is slow and many are foreign and do not always understand one's needs. Though the service was of poor quality, nothing tops one night near the end of our stay, or should I say early morning. At aproximately 3 AM, the fire alarm went off throughout the hotel. We thought it was just a warning and would go off soon, however the entire hotel was forced to evacuate to Mallory Square for a good hour or so. There were hundreds of tired guests in their underwear and t-shirts waiting for firemen to arrive. I would be less critical if this was the first time something like this ever happened. However, a few years back during Spring Break there was another fire alarm because a drunk Spring Breaker had thought it would be funny to pull the fire alarm. I believe the management needs to improve both service and perhaps make the hotel a place where young Spring Breakers and/or drunk college kids cannot stay. I only say this because all my bad experiences at this hotel have been on account of young college students who are drunk and immature making fools of themselves. Give the hotel a try, but be prepared for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Amenities and Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: PhillyBased
