Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just spent 5 nights at the Key West Hilton. We had a fabulous time. Here are some notes: 1) Hotel: Clean, comfortable, upscale but not pretentious. The staff at the front desk and the concierge was friendly and helpful. We had a non-waterfront room, however, our view from the balcony included the water and Mallory Square. The room was well-equiped and silent. We ate breakfast daily at Bistro 245, the hotel's restaurant. The food was good and the service friendly. Eating outside looking over the water and cruise ships was a plus. 2) Location: The location of the Hilton is unbeatable. 1 block from Mallory Square and the buzz of Duval Street. 3) Recommendations for Key West Activities: a) Eat at Pisces! It is a ten-block walk up Duval and over a block to Simonton Street. The food is expensive but well worth it, if you want a meal to remember. The restaurant is decorated with Andy Warhol paintings. The signature dish, which lived up to the raves, is the Lobster Tango Mango. You can make reservations at the hotel concierge. b) We also ate at Latitudes, the hotel restaurant on Sunset Key. It was good, but pricey. I would recommend it for the views and food, but not if you are travelling on a budget. c) On Duval Street - Don't bother going to Margaritaville - the food is just okay and you can't even hear the Jimmy Buffett music from the bar very well. Sloppy Joe's was the most fun bar on Duval Street - fantastic live music and good drinks. Hog's Breath was fun too. d) Activities: We took the 1 1/2-hour jetski tour around the island. Surprisingly, it is quite a workout - but very fun. Highly recommended. You can make reservations at the concierge, and the tour leaves right at hotel dock. e) Sunset cruise - We took the $32 pp sunset booze cruise on the Fury. There are more expensive sailboats, but the Fury was wonderful. There is a shaded area, unlike some of the other boats. The waitstaff kept our glasses full with beer, wine, or champagne. f) Aquarium - the aquarium is next door to the hotel. It was lovely for $11 pp admission. Recommended. g) Pirate Soul Museum - this is Philly's Pat Croce's museum. It was cute, but not worth the admission fee of $17 pp. h) Hemingway House - Recommended. Lovely gardens and view of Key West Lighthouse. The gardens are full of the famous 6-toed cats. All in all, it was a terrific vacation away from the cold winter. The people are laid-back and nice. It is a very casual environment - nice sneakers and shorts are perfect even for the fanciest restaurants. Duval Street is fun, but wandering around on side streets leads you past lovely old homes.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Key West”
Reviews.Author: jjc666
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Key West Hilton over Thanksgiving 2005. The island was a little battered from all the hurricanes but was still lovely. The hotel allowed us to check-in at noon, and we also requested a late check-out which was honored. We loved the location. We ate breakfast on the marina and watched the cruise ships dock, and at night we had a great view of the famous Key West Sunset from the bar. We took an all day sailing, snorkeling and kayaking adventure on the Danger's Prize. The concierge was very helpful. Really didn't need reservations for any of the restaurants, but the concierge was willing to call anywhere. The room was clean and plenty big, the bed was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: deb_ocon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Dec 6, 2005 on a rewards voucher..free for 40,000 points and I can tell you it was worth every point I gave up. Had we had to pay the going rate of at least $290.00 for our room I would not have even considered staying at the Hilton but after we stayed here we thought we just might consider staying at another time. It is right on Mallory Sq and Duval Street and yes as all the other reviewers stated, you do not want an oceanfront room because all you do see is the huge cruise ships. Because we read this site, we requested a pool view and were not disappointed. On arrival the staff could not have been more friendly. All of a sudden a cloudburst of rain arrrived before our bags could be delivered to our room and the bags were delayed but a phone call let us know that they would be delivered as soon as the rain let up as it did twenty minutes later. Our room was beautiful, king bed, many pillows (down filled), bathroom large, clean, patio next to the pool from which we enjoyed a very much needed breakfast (great eggs benedict) after carousing along Duval the night before (much fun). We questioned ourselves about the price we would have paid and decided that yes this property is overpriced and as some reviewers stated as just a "ordinary Hilton", this one just might be worth a little more. We have stayed at many Hilton's (thus the free room) and this is one of the better ones at which we have stayed. Will we stay again while in Key West..most likely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in Hilton Key West Marina in July 2004 with my family. Good surprise at the check-in : the room (2 queen beds) we requested through the reservation was not available, so they gave us a very nice Junior Suite. The suite was great : quite large with a superkingsize bed very comfortable in the bedroom, a large sofa, two bathrooms, two big TVs and, last but not least, a very good view on the sea and Mallory square. We really appreciated the large balcony. From this balcony in the corner of the hotel we could see everything happened around, like performers on the square. Of course the location is excellent for people who want to see the famous sunset, enjoy the Key West night life (a lot of bars, restaurants are around the hotel) and discover the island. The restaurant was pretty good too : very good fish dishes !

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but expensive for the standard”
Reviews.Author: stockholmguy
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Hilton - just before Wilma struck. Perfect location, good service - ok rooms. But for the same price in you`ll get a totally different standard in, for example, Miami. But hey, this is key west and everything is a rip off...so...I really would recommend this hotel, primarily for the location - very close to duval and the bar scene, but still on the waterfront with excellent view from seaside rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dancin2x2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hilton in Key West Florida was a terriric experience. All of the staff were extremely friendly, helpful, and desiring to make our stay a great one. The rooms are very spacious, each with a balcony, and the beds extremely comfortable. We had a room overlooking the pool and beautiful courtyard. Next time, though, we'll try to get a room overlooking the ocean. The location was also great - right in the heart of everything. The Bistro restaurant is exceptional as well. We enjoyed a wonderful breakfast buffet every morning and watched the cruise ships 'roll' into the keys. Terrific place to watch the sunsets too. Thanks for the great time - well worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Hyatt Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had forgottent to mention that the bathroom was gorgeous but probably very dangerous for the elderly and/or physically handicapped. If you are unable to lift your knee to your chest, you'll never get into the shower/bathtub. The sides of the tub are about two feet high. Unsatistfied in S. Fl.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect blend.”
Reviews.Author: Rescuepro
Reviews.Content: My Fiance' and I stayed in this hotel from August 9th through August 15th, 2005. Prior to making reservations I read ALL the reviews listed on trip advisor and decided that it was a safe bet. My reservations were for a Partial gulf view king. My room was on the 3rd floor (there is an elevator). Here is my contribution. I will address this as systematicly as possible so bear with me. Upon arriving in key west at EYW (the airport) I was disappointed that there was no hotel shuttle service available. Nothing that could be done about that I guess. After a brief but in depth cab ride (the driver gave us a varitable metric ton of island information to include which restaurants were the best) we arrived and I was very impressed. The hotel grounds are magnificant and well maintained. The staff at the registration counter were knowledgeable and friendly (and yes they speak English). We were assigned our room and they offered baggage assistance which we declined (we only had 2 moderately sized bags) and we were on our way. Upon arriving at our room the key card entry system worked on the first try (a plus) and we gained entry into our beautiful but simple room. We found the room to be clean and fresh smelling (another plus). The bathroom was clean and brightly lit (a plus for the fiance's make-up application). The only complaint about the bathroom I have is that the tub drained slowly and if you were in the shower for any more than 15 minutes you were standing in ankle deep water (I never did find out why that was, I just assumed that it had something to do with being so close to sea level). Move with me now into the mainroom (bedroom/tv room/lounge room). The bed was awsome. One of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on (and it had feather pillows, HUGE plus). The Tv armour held not only the TV, but the mini bar, ice bucket and the room safe also. The TV was large and in good working order. I never open the mini bar so I cannot speak about its contents but it appeared to be of the typical college mini-fridge variety. I do know that it operated quietly and didn't disturb us. I didn't use the safe either but it appeared large enought for several items (wallets, keys, jewelry) I would wager a guess that its size was roughtly 5"wide x4" in height x6" in depth. For those concerned there is an $80(USD) deposit for the safe's key. As I steped tword the balcony I noticed 2 things. First, one of the reviews I read was correct, the in-room A/C is of the old in-wall Holiday Inn variety. This was not a problem though because it was relatively quiet, modern in design and very effectively cooled the room (returning from the pool into the room was always a laugh for us because the room felt so cold). Additionaly it gave us the ability to better control the room temp to our liking (the floor around the A/C unit was damp but as I explained to the fiance' it was just condensation from running 24 hours daily). Secondly, I noticed that the couch did have several stains on it. Not the kind of stains one would worry about in a college dorm room, these appeared to be of the hyper child with a bottle of soda variety (nonetheless a bit of a disappointment). I then exited the room onto the "partial gulf view balcony." Amazing. I didn't expect the view to be as good as an ocean walk-out hut and it wasn't, but the view was awsome (see photo #1). Please not that the balcony is in a triangle form and measures about 6' x5' x4' and only has 2 chairs and 1 small table but were very comfortable on it. That evening at sunset as we were walking out of the room to go enjoy the night life I saw the other great view that we had right out our room's entry door, again it was spectacular (see photo #2). The second day of the trip we went to the pool. There are a limited amount of deck chairs (about 30) so try to be out there early (crowds didn't become an issue until Saturday morning). The pool itself is in some need of repair. Nothing huge, just some cracks and chips. Overall it seemed clean and I had no problem spending hour after hour it in. Please note that the pool has a slight salt water content to it. I spoke with the management and I was informed that it was a conservation/cost based decision that the Hyatt chain made. The salt content is very low and as a testament I was able to open my eyes under water (not a good idea in the ocean). The pool side staff is friendly and the concierge always has fresh towels. Scuttles (the pool side bar/grill) has good food and a generous hand with the spirits, however they are a little pricey, as is Nicola's (the 4 star seafood restaurant that we never tried due to the menu prices). The ocean access from the hotel is great as there is a beach to sit on with a deck chair and a sunbathing platform that you can swim out to. The beach was a little rocky and I would recommend sandalsfor the sensitive, but it was ample in size (not huge, not a small sliver). Also there are boat docks off of the rear deck of Nicola's that I HIGHLY recommend visiting at about midnight. There are lights that allow you to see into the water and the amount of fish that you see is amazing (see photo #3/4/5). My fiance' ran around like a 6 year old with a newly found toy saying "oh my god, oh my god." This hotel was an awsome choice for our stay and we would most assuredly return and stay again. Of the many things this hotel has to offer that I have written about the as yet unmentioned best is its perfect location. This hotel sits at the foot of Front street. You could stand in the middle of the street at the hotels entrance and hear nothing all day long but if you walk the 2 blocks to the corner of Front and Duval the party begins. The nightlife is well inside walking distance (maybe 200 yards from the hotel) but the noise doesn't follow you to your room. The hotel grounds remained quiet and subdued for our entire trip. Key points: Possibly the best location on Key West if you enjoy the night life. Great little beach to play on and to watch the sunset from (a better view that Mallory square whos' view is now block by very large homes). Only steps from the boardwalk and at least 10 excellent (and world famous)restaurants. Friendly staff and clean, well appointed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Welshtorchy
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have just returned from 3 nights at the Hilton & WOW! From the minute we arrived all the staff made great efforts to be friendly & helpful. My Hilton Honors Gold card ensured we were upgraded to a 1 bed suite with ocean view. This was a superb room with a great view. Our travelling companions were in a pool view room which was also spacious and well equiped. The pool was great and never got too crowded, the bar was close to the pool and served great food & beverage. The trip to Sunset Key was well worth $10 with only 40 people a day allowed onto the island. The concierge booked us on a trip "Wild about Dolphins" which was one of the best trips we've been on. Captain Sheri was great and knew so much about the local wildlife & the ocean. We were on the boat for over 4 hours and saw dolphins & had time to snorkel in two different areas - we recommend this trip to anyone. I can't go without mentioning the Cruise ships - which having read reviews on this site nearly stopped us from booking this hotel. In our opinion the ships did not in any way spoil our enjoyment of this hotel. They came around 8am and generally left around 3pm. You can check out which ships are due to visit on which days by visiting Key West City's web site. Overall - a superb hotel in an excellent location - and ignore the adverse comments about the cruise ships. Would I stay here again - you bet!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with ocean view”
Reviews.Author: CarrieRx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Key West for our honeymoon. We wanted to make it special, so we decided to dish out $300/night for the ocean view room. Well, the so-called "ocean view" was a view of the side of a cruise ship during the day and the docks during the night. We had a better view of the other hotel rooms across the dock. I thought they must have made a mistake with the booking of the room. The woman at the front desk informed me that I did have an ocean view room, but if I wasn't happy, there was one other ocean view room available. Well, this time the view was of the ocean but about 80% of the view was blocked by a tree!! I was so upset because we spent about $100 extra per night on this horrible view! Although the location of the hotel is excellent, I would never stay there again. I felt like we were robbed by Hilton. If you like the location, then save your money and get the garden view room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, if you like the side of a cruise ship”
Reviews.Author: Doogy
Reviews.Content: We are fifty-something frequent travelers. We often pay up to $500 per night in major cities and top resorts. This is an expensive Hilton because of its great location in the center of Key West. The property is nice enough with a pretty pool/garden area, but the oceanfront rooms are right on the town pier and the cruise ships pull up daily, blocking much of your view. They seem to depart by sunset. It is better on the second floor. We stayed in a grand suite on the second floor for one night and it was really super -- they comped us the suite because they were painting the hallway in our first room and I am allergic to latex paint. The A/C in the first room did not work well, and the room was stuffy all night. Furnishings and bathroom were suitable for a nice resort, no problem there. We didn't eat in the restuarant, but walked next door to One Duvall and had an excellent meal. The staff was friendly enough, but nothing special. If you can get in the Hyatt down the street for the same price I would try that, because the cruise ships don't dock there.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Key West as a Hilton Honor reward stay..........”
Reviews.Author: Lauriebugg
Reviews.Content: We have returned from using Hilton points to stay at the Key West Hilton Resort. Great location - we had ocean front and did have cruise ships daily except for Wednesday. To us that was no bother - nothing was much of a bother because we stayed for free. I would not pay $300-$400 a night for this resort however. That's ridiculous forwhat you'll find in Key West. The best part of our trip was a day trip to Hilton's Sunset Key island. The beach is not so long and was rocky - but nice in an area where beaches are not the attraction. We returned for a fabulous anniversary dinner at Lattitude's restaurant via ferry. 7:15 reservations made it that we had lovely evening sun then night time with tiki lights lit. Just a marvelous special dinner! However, it should have been for the $170 it cost the two of us - this was for more expensive entrees ($49 for raw seafood entree - 2 plates full, and $41 for the filet mignon). Plus add in three $10 cosmopolitans, and a glass of wine - and it all adds up very quickly. Normally this would not be our price range but for a 20 year anniversary meal - the atmosphere was worth it! They paid for our creme brulee dessert as a gift. The resort pool is medium size - Key West is small so you won't find huge pools like we enjoy in the Mexican Mayan Riviera resorts. Our vacation was full of relaxation and picking out great restaurants. Alonzo's restaurant on the boardwalk area is nice for happy hour appetizers and drinks. Monte's has a nice happy hour also, but I would not return there. Too many dogs running around and food was not that great except for the raw bar was good and good price at happy hour. Our waitress picked up a dog and kept servicing customers not washing her hands. It's very laid back - beware. Had lunch at Hard Rock - it bugs me they won't put prices of drinks on their menus, but food was very good. Servers and concierge were polite and helpful. It's true the second floor bar area to watch the sunset closed down too early - by 9PM - we left then to hit some spots in town like Hogsbreath Saloon and Sloppy Joe's. Very happening places with music. All and all, for a free stay using Delta frequent flyer miles and Hilton points, we had a great vacation! I would however next time choose a different location maybe with a larger pool or beautiful beaches. 3 nights was long enough on Key West in my opinion. Again, we loved the Sunset Key island that Hilton owns. I could stay there, but at $500 - $1,000 just for ONE night - we will never have that opportunity. It's only for the rich and famous! haha!

Reviews.Title: “$400 A Day, For A From With Bugs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 2 days at this hotel, which was fine until after 9pm when 90% of the staff leaves. So after spending a wonderful evening watching the sunset and having a couple of drinks my wife and myself returned to our room around 8pm to find a rather large insect crawling across our ceiling. After calling the front desk a maintinence person arrived and procedded to laugh at the "city folk"(Boston), who can't handle a "LiL" bug, until he saw it and screamed like a little girl. After trapping it in the bathroom he smothered it in a towel and flush it down the toilet and on leaving told us if there were any other problem to give him a call..So at 10pm when (2) more of these "LiL" bugs (about 5"-6" long) decided to run across our headboard, we were more then a little angry and after calling the front desk twice and being told I would be called back, which I wasn't, we were informed that everyone in service has left for the night and there were no other rooms available and no one to come up to help us out. For $400. a night we were left in that room to deal with it ourselves. The following day after a sleepless night I was called by an assistant manager and told the most she could do was a $75. dollar discount and then Hilton had the nerve to send us an online survey which I filled out honestly and have never heard from them again. I will "NEVER" stay at "ANY" Hilton hotel or allow any of my family to do so ever again and will continue to tell anyone who will listen excactly what happened..

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Quality and Location”
Reviews.Author: OwlClub
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Mother's Day weekend. This is my 3rd trip to this Hilton and it has managed to maintain its reputation as one of the top resort hotels in the country. Location is superb, accomodations are superior and service is exceptional. However, the daily presence of cruise ships and their passengers outside your window negates the value of ocean view rooms.

Reviews.Title: “PerfectLocation”
Reviews.Author: golfgabe
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better location to stay in Key West. If you bring a car its best to self park at $9 a day instead of $12 for valet, but be aware that if you self park, each time you leave the garage they will charge you $9. Self parking only pays if plan to never take you car out until you check out. Take a pool view room on an upper floor and you will see the pool and surrounding garden and some of the ocean. Skip the ocean view as Cruise Ships will block your view. Be sure to have Breakfast at Bistro 245. Great food. The Eggs Bendict were fabulous and there is no reason to eat breakfast elsewhere. Sit outside and look at the ocean and if a cruise ship pulls in you can enjoy watching it dock and it won't block your view. You can walk anywhere in Key West from the Hilton. Be sure to take a tour on the Conch Trolley or Train. The Hemingway house is a must see.

Reviews.Title: “3 Reasons to Avoid the Key West Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would offer 3 comments about a recent stay at the Key West Hilton: 1. DO NOT PAY FOR OCEANFRONT ROOMS. I paid a significant price above the standard rate for an oceanfront room. Unfortunately, there was no time during my stay that my family could see the ocean from our room because there are cruise ships docked outside the hotel around the clock. Given that our only view was that of the side of massive cruise ships, we would have had a more enjoyable experience if I had simply booked a courtyard-facing room at a much lower price. Quite frankly, I find the hotel's offering of "oceanfront" rooms to be extremely deceptive without being accompanied by some warning that you may never actually see the ocean due to the cruise ships. 2. BE CAREFUL IF YOU WANT NONSMOKING ROOMS. Our reservation confirmed us for a Non-smoking room, but we were given a smoking room upon check-in. When I inquired at the front desk, they denied that the room was smoking. When I returned to the front desk to tell them, despite their claims, that both the room itself and the hallway in which the room was located smelled of smoke, they again insisted that the room was non-smoking. When I returned to point out that neither our room nor any of the other rooms in the same hallway had signs indicating "non-smoking", whereas all of the rooms on the other hallway had "non-smoking" signs, they stuck to the same story. Finally, however, after 3 tries, they did relocate us to a true non-smoking room. I would suggest that they could have made a good customer happier by simply offering to relocate us at the time of the 1st inquiry. 3. DO NOT PAY FOR SPECIALS THAT INCLUDE BREAKFAST. As the only available rate, I was forced to pay for Bounceback weekend package with the free breakfast. I was OK with the breakfast package, but I think that the hotel should have been prepared to actually serve breakfast to its guests. We visited the hotel restaurant for breakfast 3 times during the stay. On the 1st visit, we left hungry after waiting over 1/2 hours for our food (which consisted of orders of cold cereal and bagels). During this 1st visit, we witnessed another guest furiously return his food because it was cold, and subsequently return the food of the rest of his family because that food had gotten cold while waiting for his food to be warmed. On the 2nd visit, we were turned away and denied a table because the hostess claimed the restaurant was too busy. Curiously, only about 1/4th of the tables were occupied at the time. On the 3rd visit, to our surprise, we actually managed to obtain a table and receive our food. Unfortunately, we thereafter were required to change tables because bugs were found to be crawling on a table immediately next to the one at which we were sitting. In short, a very unpleasant experience all around. We checked out of the hotel 3 days early and moved to the Hyatt hotel right down the street. There, for more than $100 less per night, we had a wonderful view of the ocean (in a nonocean-view room no less), we received a non-smoking room with no questions needing to be asked, and we enjoyed several excellent meals at the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vistaatraveler
Reviews.Content: After reviewing many recommendations for Key West on this site, decided on the Hilton during 2005 Spring Break. We were quite happy with the choice. Great location within walking distance to everything we wanted to see. Nice rooms. Great location for sunset celebration which the whole family enjoyed. We went to the private beach on Sunset Key for an awesome afternoon. They limit the number of tickets to this beach so my husband had to wait in line at 7am to get the tickets for our family of 4 to spend the day on Sunset Key beach but was well worth it. We also enjoyed lunch at the restaurant on Sunset Key. Overall this was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nmmesa
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this resort. The rooms were clean and it has a perfect location. We could watch the sunset from our balcony most nights. We were there six nights and cruise ships blocked the view two of the nights. I think we had just as much fun watching the ships dock as we did watching the sunset. The resorts proximity to old town is awesome. We could walk to almost everything we needed too. The concierge was very helpful. On the down side, parking was $12 per day and a tip everytime you wanted to get your vehicle out, plus the valets couldn't help but peel out every time they parked our rental. We ate at L'Attitudes one night, it was the most we ever paid for one meal and they got my order wrong, not worth the experience. The hotels restaraunt "Bistro 245" left little to be desired. The wait staff was very inexperienced and slow. The only reason we ate there was because we had breakfast vouchers. The private beach at Sunset key was nice but for much less you can walk to Fort Zachary Taylor or take a drive up to Bahia Honda State Park (our favorite). We stayed here using our Hilton Honors points and although the hotel is nice I would not pay the rack rate to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the Hilton Key West Resort and Marina”
Reviews.Author: dutchessofwinward
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Hilton Key West Resort and Marina. Ask for a room where the views are not blocked by cruise ships. We had a room overlooking Mallory Square and the Aquarium. It was great because we could watch the sharks in the aquarium pens all day long. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The sunset deck provided a great place to watch the festival, have a drink and listen to music. Disappointed by consistent slow service at the Cafe 241. We waited more than 30 min for a toasted bagel. When we complained, there was no sense of urgency. This occurred twice in two days. We never went back. Try Pepe's. Great service, great food, low prices. Hotel is clean, comfortable and well maintained. Also, would not ask for a room overlooking the marina. Because they service "Mega-Yachts" but the docks are not properly powered for them, the yachts have to run their electric generators all day and night. This means you have to listen to this noise. Despite this, would stay here again. You can't beat the location, and the views.

Reviews.Title: “How gorgeous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: debbie12
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West and we stayed at the perfect place. Yes, you may wake up in the morning and have cruise ship parked out your front window - but how cool is that? They are gone early enough to enjoy the sunset - and I think it adds to the atmosphere. As far as the hotel staff - they were great to us. We requested ocean front, side by side rooms and got just that. (Probably the best rooms in the hotel.) First floor is the bomb!! They also gave us no hassle when Delta messed up our flights and we arrived 23 hours late. If I could afford it - I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But not that nice !”
Reviews.Author: Chunky-M0nkey
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about staying at the Hilton Key West, we had been to KW a couple of times before and each time stayed too far out, so this time we would stay at the Hilton........ It was OK.... To me that is disapointing, for such a pricey hotel, yes the location is excellent, however to me the rooms were small and quite basic. We had a room with a nice balcony with partial ocean view (The first night atleast) then we had a room with a Cruise Ship view...... I would have been OH SO ANNOYED if i had paid for a true ocean front room, the cruise ship dock there everyday, and no there isnt anything you or the hotel can do about it, i just think they should tell you on the website that if you book a room with a view you might get a huge Mickey Mouse Disney Cruise ship as the view instead of the sunset. The service in the hotel was poor, we stayed for 3 nights and for 2 off those, food from a previous guest was left outside our room, we asked 4 times to have it removed, eventually it was, but that is not the service i expect from this standard of hotel. On the positive side, we caught the boat over to the Sunset cottage island for the day and had a great day on the beach with cocktails and a delicous lunch, with great service. Would i stay here again, yes if it was $200 cheaper or i think i will try the Hyatt next time just up the road enough for no cruise ships.

Reviews.Title: “location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay in Old Town,KeyWest.The location just off the foot of Duval is central to everything you would want.They do get cruise ship visits,but they are typically gone by 5:00pm each day.Beautiful sunset views every night.Wonderful beach access at Sunset Key.The staff is very accomodating & the rooms are very nice.The pool area is very nicely served ,as you are waited on for food/drink at your lounge chair. (the same on the beach at Sunset Key).

Reviews.Title: “Cruise Ship Views”
Reviews.Author: BisquitPA
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at this hotel over the New Years 2005 Holiday. The seat cushions on the couch and chair were stained. The bedroom door's lock was broken. The TV reception was poor so they replaced it with a smaller one with poor reception. When I called the manager, an angry, rude woman with a cockney accent to complain about the problems and the two enormous cruise ships blocking my ocean-front view, she refused to change my suite or give me a refund or discount. I called Hilton Guest Services and they told me there was nothing they could do because all Hilton Hotels are independently owned and they couldn't them what to do. The last night we were there, a Carnival Cruise ship (Glory?) was docked at the pier one down from ours and we thought we were finally going to see a sunset from our balcony, when two minutes before sunset, this ship pulled up and turned around just long enough to completely block out our sunset and then drove away. (This was around the same time Carnival stranded all those people in Miami).

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I want to start the review by pointing out the good things about this hotel: central location, clean room, day trip to the private island Sunset Key and so on. However, I felt the hotel was trying hard to squeeze every penny out of you and it does so in a not so subtle manner. First of all, the hotel charges $300 plus a night for room. I will leave to your judgement whether that is fair. What I can tell you is that you get a typical Hilton room with basic amenities. Clean but not fancy. We had breakfast one morning on Hilton's private island off Key West, the Sunset Key. I am usually wary of the stiff price hotel charges for breakfast, so I went down to the Conciege and asked to see a copy of their breakfast menu. I was pleasantly surprised to see that the prices looked fairly reasonable ($6-$10 range) and the Conceige assured me that locals go there all the time for meal so I decided to give it a try. When we arrived at the restaurant on the island, we were shocked to see that the menu had much higher prices. Continental breakfast was $10 (vs. $6 I saw at the conciege), which buys you a muffin (labeled "island selection of bakery", a small fruit bowl, juice and coffee. We had breakfast there anyway, thinking that the conciege may have given us an outdated menu by mistake. After a fairly expensive ($40) breakfast, we did a little sunbathing and swimming on the private beach. Soon came lunch time and we decided to order from our chairs on the beach. The beach boy fetched us a menu and again things looked reasonable. I picked a grouper sandwich ($10) and my girlfriend ordered a seafood salad ($14). The food was decent and we had a relaxing meal on the beach. When I asked for the check, the beach boy showed us a bill which put the sandwich at $14 and the salad at $16. The beach boy explained that again we had an outdated menu and prices have changed. I could not help but wondering if it is a systematic approach at this Hilton to "Bait and Switch". Although the bill was later adjusted without much hassel, it left a bad taste. On the checkout date, we had three beach passes billed to us, but there were only two of us. That was taken care of after a short conversation and again we wonder how many phony charges went unnoticed and uncontested. It is my first time to spend a few days in Key West (I had a day trip couple of years ago). During our stay there, we had experienced a few similar incidents from other establishments. I felt that the whole island is one BIG tourist trap and is more interested in your wallet than offering hospitality. I left paradise with a not so favorable impression.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Loved the Room!!”
Reviews.Author: jennLavalletteNj
Reviews.Content: Just got back last week and just loved this resort!! Location can not be beat if you love to be in the middle of it all in a convient location. The hotel sits right in malory square so you just walk downstairs for the sun set celabration. Our room was a fantastic suprise .. better than we expected. We got the king ocean view room .. but was suprised to find a jacuzzi and jacuzzi steam shower in our room. If you like a "out of the way" place this probably isn't for you .. also cruise ships dock right in front of hotel. When we arrived there was no ship and we had a beautiful view .. when we woke up there was a big ship and no view. That did not bother us because we only stayed one night. The Hyatt is right next door and does not have ships in front. Also the pier house is next to hyatt 2 down from hilton and great location and very private. A good choice if you want a private hotel.J

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Thanksgiving 2004 and our overall experience was terrible. We booked the hotel using Hilton Honors points (both of us are diamond members). This hotel is considered top of the line due to price and therefore was in the highest point bracket. Good Points: the location cannot be beat. You can walk anywhere within Old Key West. And we concur with others that the $10 pp to Sunset Key is worth it if you love quiet beaches with waiters bringing you food and drink. However, the service was the worst either of us have ever experienced (and we both travel for a living). We booked a King/Non-Smoking Harbor view and upon check-in received 2 queens overlooking the pool. We requested a room change (since we were to be guaranteed our room type) and got a King overlooking the 'courtyard'. BEWARE - courtyard = alley/dumpster. I cannot imagine anyone paying $300 a night for a tiny balcony overlooking a dumpster. Each time we got moved, the front desk person told us it was the room we were expecting. We would get to the room and it would be a little different than what they told us. We kept getting the impression they were trying to get us 'out of their hair' by telling us what we wanted to hear. We were eventually moved to a king overlooking the pool (albeit the ground floor and a day later) but the worse thing was the attitude of guest services and management to accomodate our request. We never got the harbor view for the 'amazing sunsets' we were promised upon booking. In addition, the rooms are not of the quality one would think of in a $300 a night hotel (beds are comfty, though). In addition, the food is mediocre -- go out to duvall for food. Upon our return to Key West, we plan on paying for a room in one of the gorgeous B&Bs.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful if paying for the view”
Reviews.Author: JLS24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Octoberfest 2004 in a partial ocean view room. The location of the hotel is perfect, and it is well worth the $10 to go to Sunset Island to the hotels beach - a carribean island by day, and then back to the town for a great evening. The only thing we noticed was that the ocean front rooms very often have a view of nothing other than the bow of a great big cruise ship for most of the day - although they do go for Sunset. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BigEagles
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. I was here Sept. 21-27, 2004. There are actually two parts to this hotel -- the buildings on the "mainland" and the cottages on Sunset Key. I stayed in the buildings on the mainland. A small boat ferrys you out to the cottages (and the beach on Sunset Key) every half hour, but I never made it out there as the boat ride costs $10 if you don't have a room in the cottages. Also, there is no beach on the mainland, so if you want to go to the beach on Sunset Key, plan on paying the $10. My "garden view" room had a balcony and overlooked the outdoor pool which is fairly large. The Hilton is in Mallory Square, which is where the cruise ships dock, so the place is kept exceptionally clean with very nice stores to attract cruise vacationers. I ate breakfast at the Bistro in the hotel every morning which offers a good variety. Happy hour starts in the early evening with exceptional views of the sunset from the second floor bar. Live entertainment and drink specials including $2 draft beers provide a relaxing ambiance. The pier is bustling with activity from street performers and vendors selling their wares to well past sunset. What I liked best about this hotel, though, is it's excellent location. You can watch the cruise ships come and go, enjoy spectacular sunsets during the evening happy hour, and continue on to the famous Duvall Street which is a block and a half away. Make sure you check out Sloppy Joe's and Durty Harry's. Kelly's (as in Kelly McGillis from Top Gun) Caribbean Bar and Grille is also near the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Wilde_37
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on Monday and Tuesday 20 & 21st September. I would be hard-pushed to find any problems with this hotel. The room was big, bright and spotless. The room overlooked the pool area and gave an immediate feel of comfort and relaxation. I'm sure those who booked a sea view would not be impressed to have it blocked most of the time with the several cruise ships which were a constant feature but it was not something which effected us. We found the staff to be courtous and very efficient. The highlight of the stay was getting away to Sunset Key - the private beach belonging to the hotel. Key West is always a busy place but this was a stretch of beach only accessible by boat and reserved for the guests of the hotel - there were only about 20 people on the entire beach all day. While some people complain about the $10 charge for using the facility I found it the best $10 I had spent. After paying $40 for sun beds on Miami beach it was a pleasure to pay $10 for seclusion which came with sunbeds, unlimited towels, floating mats, umbrellas, bar and snack service. Wish I was back there now.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience at the Hilton Marina and Resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: javierlabrador_123
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very nice stay at the Hilton Marina and Resort in Key West. We found the staff to be very friendly and accomodating. We experienced serious difficulties to get there due to hurricane Frances and had to call them several times. They were not only very understanding, but made us feel a lot better and confident that we had made the right choice. The room was very nice, comfortable, and clean. Due to hurricane Ivan all non-residents had to evacuate and the staff was very helpful and made us feel at home all the time. The concierge was very nice and instrumental in making us made our minds as to what to do in the days we stayed there. Even the telephone operator when we called her to find out a number we needed recognized our voice from the week before when we called the hotel to make sure our reservation was not going to be cancelled because of the hurricane. The location of the hotel is great. It is right there by the pier and the food is great. We certainly will be back... soon!

HotelInfo.Name: The Westin Key West Resort & Marina
HotelInfo.Address: 245 Front Street, Key West, FL 33040 (Formerly Hilton Key West)
